name: Victory in the Galaxy
description:
Small game, published on Tactics magazine in Japan.
Though it is really a small magazine game, this game covers all aspects of galactic warfare.
The key point is that at the start every power has really very limited capacity. Because of this reason, the small map is really big enough for expanding, and even the regular capacity for other game is really a special ability.
Very clever design.
But unfortunately even in Japan this game is neglected, because this game is attached with not the boardgame issue but with the RPG issue.
If you found this in the auction and you love sci-fi boardgames, please take it.

name: Steal: The Card Game
description:
Steal is a fast-paced card game for 3 or more players.

One briefcase contains thousands of dollars; the other cases are empty. Players must steal cases from each other, hoping to be in possession of the case with the money by the time the game ends.

Players will put their best ‘Poker Face’ to the test as they try to bluff their way to victory. Getting the money is relatively easy; keeping hold of it is the difficult part, especially if someone plays the dreaded ‘Switch’ card!

name: Spanish Fury: Hell on the Eastern Front
description:
Spanish Fury-Hell on the Eastern Front brings the ASL enthusiast to the chaos of the Eastern Front during late 1941 as Axis satellite troops attempt to stave off a resurgent Red Army.

Historical battlefield maps are what CH is all about and Spanish Fury continues that tradition with two new maps, including a long, unique riverside of the Vulkhov River, with two villages, Russa and Sitno, to fight for, and contest the terrain between.

This is not a complete game! Ownership of Beyond Valor is required to use this product. A set of new MMC counters depicting the 250th 'Blau' Division, complete with accurate shoulder patch emblems, are included, along with Sturmboot, Wagon and guns, a total of 192 color die cut counters!

Contains: 8 scenarios, 2 maps, variant special rules, and 192 die cut color counters.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader and Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 (both required)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Texas Hold'em StrataCards
description:
StrataCards is a unique set of playing cards that let you play poker like a game of solitaire or with a group. Each deck contains 52 cards and 2 "jokers", but instead of typical front and back faces, each side has multiple card faces printed on it. For this Texas Hold'em deck, the fronts show 2 card faces, and the backs show 3 card faces.

The front of each card represents your two hole cards, and their value relative to other starting hands. There are also example flops labeled "Weak", "Good", "Great", and "The Nuts", and their value relative to other possible flops. Text descriptions include a standard name and a popular nickname for the hole cards, and the common slang for your made hands and draws.

The back of each card represents three cards that would be a great flop for the starting hand on the front. The idea is that without looking at the front of the card, you can deduce a range of hole cards that might be on the front just by looking at the flop cards on the back. Turn and River cards are displayed by placing one card under another so that only one new card face is showing.

This connection between the cards on the front and back lets you play and learn the game by yourself, or practice your hand reading skills in a game with others. Key points of the system are: starting hands and their values before and after the flop, learning the lingo that the professionals use to describe their hands, and good practice spotting bad beats, missed draws, pure bluffs, and the stone cold nuts.

Game variations you can play with this deck include: Texas Holdem, Greek Holdem, Heads-Up Holdem Solitaire, Multi-Way Holdem Solitaire, Holdem Flash Cards, and Blind Man's Bluff.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition

name: Euro Risk
description:
A diceless game of global conquest played using the board, pieces, and cards from Risk. Territories are captured through card play. The winner is the player having the most Victory Tokens after all six continents have been filled with units.

A free online rules set available at http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/ER.html
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Starmada: Dreadnoughts
description:
Dreadnoughts is a setting book for Starmada X: The Admiralty Edition that brings to life the epic sweep of naval combat during the First World War.

To many people, the Great War conjures images of mud-soaked trenches and land-locked armies joined in a futile embrace across no-man's land. But navies were just as important to victory (if not more so); and it was on the seas that the conflict truly became a World War. From the North Sea to the Mediterranean, from the Black Sea to the South Pacific, battles raged across the globe.

So, go ahead: swap your energy shields for armor plating and the blackness of space for the wine-dark sea, and see if you have what it takes to rule the waves!

In addition to data cards for one hundred ship classes from eight different navies of the early twentieth century, Dreadnoughts adds brand-new options to the Starmada X game, including flotillas, wet-navy style movement, and dual-mode fighter flights, which can be used individually or collectively to enrich any setting. Also included are six historical scenarios, allowing players to re-fight various naval actions of the Great War.

Dreadnoughts is not a stand-alone product; ownership of the Starmada X Admiralty Edition Core Rulebook is required.

Expands:

Starmada X
Starmada: The Admiralty Edition
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I

name: Down In Flames: Winter War 1939-40
description:
A Rise of the Luftwaffe campaign module from RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr5, Winter War 1939-40 is an extension part/ module to the "Down In Flames"-Series - Volume 1: Rise of the Luftwaffe game by GMT.

In late 1939 the Soviet Union began preparing for a possible war with Germany, despite having signed a non-aggression pact with Hitler in August. To strengthen its western defences, the USSR absorbed the Baltic states and made exorbitant demands for territorial concessions from Finland.

"Down in Flames" series is a card-driven game that simulate WW2 air combat.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Impact
description:
An example of the family oriented, large-box dexterity games of the 60s & 70s, the object of Impact is to knock a steel ball off a rail by swinging a weighted pendulum across the ball’s path, thereby knocking the ball into scoring compartments.

The box includes: Plastic playing base; Metal rail; Score-markers; lower legs w/arch support; Upper arm; Upper arm swivel; Chain w/weight; steel ball

An arcing metal rail sits atop a tray of numbered compartments which serve as the score area. Each player is given 10 plastic score-markers for tallying. A player sets the steel ball at one end of the rail and releases it. Timing a swing of the pendulum, the other player attempts to knock the ball off the rail and into one of the scoring areas marked 100, 200, 500. If the player misses, the other player attempts to catch the pendulum and, if successful, can take a shot at scoring as well.

Play continues until someone scores, in which case the scoring player sets the ball in action again, or until the ball stops rolling, in which case the original “roller” sets the ball on its path again.

The game is over when either player has placed all 10 markers and the scores are tallied.

Impact was released in 1971. Interestingly, the game Balanko http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/23728 , winner of the “Family Fun” award in 2007, appears to be a direct “descendant” of this game, with the designer claiming to have invented the game in his garage. A quote from his site states, with irony that may be intentional or not: “Upon tinkering around in the garage one day with his son, Jamie began to build a game without any knowing of how this game would one day strongly impact his life.”

name: Hero Pax 3: Jungle Heroes
description:
Fighting in the Pacific Theater of WW II. Each of these scenarios contains a hero. These scenarios feature American army and marine, Japanese, Australian, and Dutch Marine forces. The action takes place in Saipan, Java, Luzon, New Guinea, and the Admiralty Islands.

Sequentially following the Hero Pax numbering, these scenarios are numbered HP 17-26.

Contents:
10 scenarios

Hero Pax 3 is not a complete game. Ownership of components from the ASL game system are required to play this game. This scenario pack is compatible with the ASL Gaming System (ASL) by Avalon Hill / MMP.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Escape from the Haunted Mansion
description:
From the Disney Experience website:

"Can you escape from the Haunted Mansion before the clock strikes '13'? Begin your journey in the mansion's attic, winding your way through haunted corridors and the ghost-filled cemetery. But, watch out! Madame Leota is performing many spells and enchantments that may or may not work in your favor."

Download, print, cut, and assemble on your own.

SPECIAL NOTE:
Be advised that this game does NOT fold up or disassemble for easy storage! It's big, and it takes up a good portion of space.
categories: Dice, Exploration, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Alexander at Waterloo
description: A fantasy scenario for "La Bataille de Mont St. Jean" that confronts the troops of the Duke of Wellington against the Macedonian Army of Alexander the Great.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Zombeja! Ovella!
description:
Zombeja! Ovella! is Finnish language storytelling boardgame for 3-6 players, One game takes about 30 minutes per player.

Like in most traditional roleplaying games each session starts with creation of character concept. Zombeja! Ovella! utilizes "charactersticks", short wooden sticks with different qualities like personality types and generalizations printed on them to create instant stereotypes suited for genre.

Game combines competitive and co-operative play elements in storytelling to produce a structured roleplaying exercise that simulates thematic elements of survival horror movies.

Players have to create conflict of interest to eliminate other players and to advance their own position on the board. Co-operation of others is required to survive but some need to be sacrificed.

Originally a free mini-game with issue #8 of Finnish language roleplaying games magazine Roolipelaaja the game was released later packaged in VHS tape case to make it look indie zombie flick.

Zombeja! Ovella! is predecessor to English language game Zombie Cinema which essentially streamlined version of it.

name: Bałkany 1912
description:
A game from "Dragon Hobby" magazine (6) 2/1999 about First Balkan War in 1912 showing battle between Bulgarian nad Turkish forces near Adrianopole.

The game's rules are based on Tannenberg 1914 rules.

Related Microbadges
Dragon fan

name: Pilsudski
description:
From the instructions:
"Pilsudski" is the recreation on a playing board of the turmoil of Eastern Europe at the close of the First World War. You, as the Russian commander, will attempt to secure your country's borders against Polish aggression. If so, then you will face the Allies. You, as the Polish commander, Pilsudski, will attempt to capture Kiev, pressure the neutral Baltic states into declaring war on Russia, and destroy the Russian aggressors."

This is a mimeographed set of rules, mimeographed counters to be mounted, and six section mimeographed three-color (brown, green, and mimeo purple on white) map.

This was published in Panzerfaust magazine (rules are marked pages 49 and 50), though was also sold as a stand-alone.

name: Guns at Gettysburg Scenarios 2: Frontier – Early Engagements for the Trans-Mississippi
description:
A selection of scenarios for use with Guns at Gettysburg miniature wargame rules.

The 15 scenarios included are:

* Boonville (1861)
* Carthage (1861)
* Bloody Hill (1861)
* Lexington (1861)
* Valverde (1862)
* Leetown (1862)
* Elkhorn Tavern (1862)
* Pigeon's Ranch
* Lone Jack (1862)
* First Newtonia (1862)
* Old Fort Wayne (1862)
* Cane Hill (1862)
* Prairie Glove (1862)
* 2nd Battle of Springfield (1863)
* Taken Front and Rear! (hypothetical)

Also includes 6 pages of optional rules for Guns at Gettysburg as well as conversion rules for players of Johnny Reb 2.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Beer Game
description:
A simulation game created to demonstrate some key principles of supply chain management. It was made in the early 1960's by some professors at the MIT Sloan School of Management.

The game is played by 4 to 8 people, who must cooperate despite limited information transfer. Early versions (including the one pictured) used pieces on a board, later refined to paper spreadsheets and then computerized ones. The target is to minimize total costs across the whole team, from factory to distributor to wholesaler to retailer. (With more than 4 players, either multiple players can be assigned to each station or the game can shift to competition between multiple teams.) Each day beer moves forward through the chain, paper order slips move backward, and shortages impose costs. The order slips are the only data each stage has to work with -- no table talk! End customer demand is simulated by a deck of cards, which can be stacked or randomized by the moderator to emulate different market conditions.

The game runs for a specific number of day/rounds, initially 36 at MIT (but the moderator told the players it would be 50 to prevent horizon effects). Invariably the limited information causes "bullwhip effects" that ripple down the chain, which is the main lesson the game teaches.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Railway Rivals Map SZ: Switzerland
description:
A map for use with the Railway Rivals game.

The map covers Switzerland and connections into surrounding countries. It is, inevitably, very hilly indeed, and you are instructed to use the leapfrog variant. This was a relatively late stand-alone map, which was not released in the large (approx A2) size, but just as an A3 black and white map.

name: Classic BattleTech: Jihad Secrets – The Blake Documents
description:
Centuries-old Secrets Revealed!

Chandrasekhar Kurita has spent his life hunting for ancient secrets. Almost as soon as the Word of Blake formed in 3052, "Uncle Chandy" put his vast network of spies and his massive wealth toward digging behind their façade and now, two decades later, Uncle Chandy has discovered more than he ever thought possible. Now he’s using that knowledge to send a coalition of forces against one of the Blakists’ hidden five worlds: the Ruins of Gabriel. More importantly, he’s found a connection to the single greatest mystery in the last half-millennia. Aware he’s almost guaranteed his death at the hands of a Blakist fanatic, Uncle Chandy knows the time has come to stand in the light and reveal the secrets that will change the tide of the Jihad!

Jihad Secrets: The Blake Documents contains a wealth of information on the current universe-shaking Jihad storyline, providing more "hard facts" than any book to date. Detailed information on the opening years of the Jihad, including maps of the most significant conflicts; a current 3075 "Around the Sphere" in the same vein as the Jihad Hot Spots series provides up-to-date information on the latest happenings; biographies of more than twenty individuals important to the Jihad; a complete description of all Word of Blake forces, including unit logos; and the hidden history of Clan Wolverine and the Minnesota Tribe revealed! A complete rules section rounds the book out, with game play rules for taking any Word of Blake division into the field, construction rules for "primitive units," and new ’Mechs, including Clan Wolverine’s Mercury II, Pulverizer, and Stag, the "primitive" Dervish and the mysterious Raptor II.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Mythgardia Expansion Set
description:
The Mythgardia Expansion Set is the first expansion set for Mythgardia and contains:

9 new Character Cards (including Boraggu the Troll and Scotomart the Adventuring Princess)
15 new Legend Cards (including The Mad Charioteer and Trolls)
15 Legends of the Sea Cards (including Sharkins the Pirate and Treasure Island)
20 Advantage Cards to assign to your characters
1 Instruction Sheet describing clearly how these new components are to be added to your game.

All of this is contained in a sturdy clear plastic box (25cm x 11cm x 3cm) which comes wrapped in a colourful ‘Troll Included’ wrapper.

This box fits neatly inside your Mythgardia game box and will hold all the cards for the game.

With adventures now to be encountered at sea and Advantage Cards to expand your Characters and enrich your game play, the Expansion Set takes Mythgardia to a dizzying new level.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hi!Noon: Das Duell
description:
HI!Noon - Das Duell is a four-in-a-row game on a 4×4×4 cube. 32 black and 32 white balls are used. Once you get 4 in a row you can get one ball from the other colour. The player who gets most balls from the other colour wins.

The rotation of the four playing surfaces is also part of the play action.

The game was released at Essen 2009 by the author.

Similar to:

Qubic - Played on 4x4x4 cube (4x4 grid with 4 layers) but without turning layers
Score Four - 4x4 grid of pegs that are filled from the bottom up
Dimensions(1970), Tic Tac Turn(2011), and X: Die 4. Dimension - the 4 individual horizontal board layers (4x4 each) of the 4x4x4 grid can turn
3D5 - which is played on a 5x5x5 cube (5x5 grid with 5 layers) but without turning layers

name: In the Trenches: Through Mud and Blood
description:
In the Trenches: Through Mud and Blood is the third game of the In the Trenches series. Designed by John Gorkowski, this series enables players to game historically accurate simulations of tactical operations from the Great War. ITT challenges players to move and fight with company-level formations made of separate platoon-sized units during five minute, impulsed-based turns. The historically accurate maps are scaled to 100 yards per hex. This approach recreates WWI command and control problems and inspire historically accurate play without forcing decisions.

In the Trenches: Through Mud and Blood includes seven operations. "Balkan Brawl" takes place in Macedonia, "Schneiders at Juvincourt" pits French tanks against German infantry, "The Lost Battalion" and "Go to Hell!" depict the battles of the 308th US Infantry Battalion in the Charlevaux Valley, "War of Machines" and "Combined Arms" involves British and German tanks on the Western Front, and "Kaiserschlacht" depicts trench fighting between the British and Germans during the last German offensive of the First World War.

Included in In the Trenches: Through Mud and Blood are five 11.5" x 8" maps, 264 die-cut counters, one rulebook, guides for all seven operations, one reference card, and two D6s.

(source: Grenier Games website)


Maps:

Maps are single-sheet 11.5" x 8" and printed on stiff, glossy cardstock.

The featured five maps are:
"Hill 06" covers a piece of territory near Lake Doiran in Macedonia
"Juvincourt" features the village of that name, and the nearby countryside
"Charlevaux Valley" contains the battlefield of the Lost Battalion,
"Open Ground" leaves a clean playing field for the tanks (and perfect for make-your-own battles),
"Racecourse Redoubt" features a network of trenches on the Western Front.

Scenarios:

Balkan Brawl
To break the stalemate at Salonika, the Allies planned to strike the Bulgarian centre. As part of a larger effort, the 11th Worcestershire Battalion, 78th Brigade, 22nd Division aimed to capture "06", a strongpoint of the Bulgarian 9th Division on "Pip Ridge" just east of Lake Doiran in Macedonia. At 2145, after days of intermittent shelling, the preparatory barrage ceased and the officers' shrill whistles rose from the din. British troops filtered down into Hana Ravine just before bounding up the slope to "06".

Schneiders at Juvincourt
As part of the Nivelle Offensive, Commandant Louis Bossut led five "Special Artillery" groups of 16 Schneider tanks each into German lines near Berry-Au-Bac at 0600. Groupment Bossut crossed the first German trench line with infantry against light resistance. But nagging artillery fires and mechanical failures began to nibble away at his force. Four kilometers later, Bossut swung northward to cross the second German trench line with his 60 remaining tanks and the 151st Infantry Regiment. After crossing around 0900, Bossut split his force sending two groups north toward Juvincourt, two more west toward Mauchamp and one south toward the Aisne.

The Lost Battalion
On 2 October 1918, elements of the U.S. 77th "Liberty" Division from New York attacked north into the Argonne Forest. Major Whittlesey's force of two battalions from the 308th Infantry and two platoons of the 306th Machine Gun outpaced neighboring American units by penetrating a full kilometer into German lines. At dusk, Whittlesey's men dug in along the north slope of a valley between a road at the top and a stream at the bottom. Company K of the 307th joined the following morning. Seeing that this force had outpaced its flank protection, the Germans slowly encircled the "Lost Battalion", in a pocket about 500 meters east of Moulin de Charlevaux. At 3 PM on October 3, the Germans launched their first attack.

Go to Hell!
After 5 days of siege, the Lost Battalion was out of bandages, drinking from the Charlevaux Brook, and coughing on the stench of the rotting corpses that surrounded them. the Germans sent an American POW back to his comrades with a letter offering to accept an American surrender. According to legend, Major Whittlesey spat back, "Go to Hell!"

Kaiserschlacht
The Kaiser's Battle began at 0435 with an unprecedented artillery bombardment of gas, smoke and high explosive rounds. About 9,955 tubes of all sizes rained over 1,100,000 shells across 40 miles of frontage. At 0940 the firing stopped; Stosstruppen immediately sprang from their shell holes as German regulars emerged from trenches close behind. Near Grugies not far from St. Quentin, Germany's 238th division slammed into Britain's 36th Ulster amid dense fog and lingering smoke. The recently arrived Ulster men had just taken over French positions and had yet to fully implement the new defense in depth doctrine.

War of Machines
During the Second Battle of Cambrai, British troops of Byng's third Army broke through the Hindenburg Line to "the green fields beyond." Leading the way, tanks of the 12th Battalion helped XVII Corps capture Niergnies. Just east of the town, Captain Roe's tank, L16, paused at Mont Neuve Farm. there he spotted four MIVs coming his way from the east. C Company - he thought.

Combined Arms
After Ludendorff's Operation Georgette bogged down in the north, he made a thrust for Amiens. At dawn on April 24th, thirteen German tanks lumbered forward over a gloomy moonscape with infantry close behind. After plowing through Britain's 173rd Brigade, they covered 4,000 yards to reach the Cachy Switch Line, a stitch work arrangement of incomplete trenches between Villers Bretonneux and Cachy. At about that time, Captain Brown led three Mark IVs to the Cachy Switch Line with orders to hold at all costs.

(source: user's description)

name: ATS: D-Day Rangers / Against All Odds Gamers Guide
description: The D-DAY RANGERS GAMERS GUIDE covers D-DAY RANGERS (ATS Edition), the introductory module that depicts the Rangers at Pointe du Hoc on D-Day through June 8, 1944. A move-by-move scenario replay, replete with analysis by the players, a detailed article on historical bocage tactics, and the second in a series of unpublished letter of Hal Hock in the 'Hock on Hock' series. Consists of a 48-page publication with heavyweight 4-color cover and pages printed on durable 70-lb stock.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: På spåret (DVD)
description: Based on a popular Swedish TV game-show, in a new version including a DVD. The DVD contains questions in the form of film and commentary by TV host Ingvar Oldsberg. The players try to guess the name of a destination based on images from a traveling train or car, while Ingvar gives increasingly more obvious hints. Once a destination is revealed there are more questions about it's local culture or history.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trains, Travel, Trivia

name: D-Day
description:
This is operational level wargame based on Invasion Normandy. Small size and easy rule game.
It is mostly called "SS D-Day" because there are many games of the same name.

The Allied player aims at a success of the landing operations. The German player aims at the obstruction of the Allied Forces. Each game turn is divided into three impulse. The number of times that it can be activated by the unit is different.

This game was first published as one of the Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku).
Republished in Command Magazine Japan #46 in 2002, along with The Battle of the Bulge: Panzers in the Snow.
publishers: Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社), Sho-Kikaku

name: Romania Trivia
description:
This is a new game about Romania, a trivia game for your family and friends to enjoy.

There are 400 cards with a total of 2400 questions about Romania, covering 6 areas: history, culture, science, sports, geography and misc.

Contents:

- 400 cards with 2400 questions and answers;
- the board;
- 6 pawns;
- 6 puzzle pieces;
- 1 dice;
- rules.

Roll the die to see from what category you will get your question. Once you answer one correct question from a category, you receive one puzzle piece. The first one to give a correct answer to a question from every category will make up Romania from the 6 puzzle pieces and win the game.

Be the first to find out how well you know your country, learn new things and have fun!

name: Verto
description:
Verto is an abstract board game which can be played with a Reversi set (though a 9x9 board is recommended).

Players enter stones (with their own color facing up) on empty spaces. If a stone is placed such that exactly one opponent stone is orthogonally or diagonally between the entered stone and another friendly stone, then this opponent stone is flipped and becomes a friendly stone. Then the capturing stone becomes the new starting point for another capture move and so on ...

The player who ends up with the majority of stones on the completely filled board wins the game.

name: MechWarrior: Unbound
description:
From the back cover:

"The Clan invasion left the Successor States struggling to recover from the war that devastated the forces of the Inner Sphere. The Federated Commonwealth took heavy losses, and its misfortune was compounded by the untimely death of Hanse Davion. The alliance is in a precarious position. The New Avalon Institute of Science has been charged to find a technological edge with which House Davion may regain its lost power. Study of Clan technology sent research in bold new directions, and led to an extraordinary breakthrough in BattleTechnology.

Unfortunately, the Federated Commonwealth's salvation is in the hands of a madman.

Unbound is a roleplaying adventure set in the BattleTech universe of 3053 on the Game World of Solaris VII. The player characters become involved in a struggle for control of a radical new technology that could change the balance of power in the Inner Sphere. The adventure includes several new 'Mechs and a selection of new tech from one of New Avalon's top research and development teams."

User comment:

Although this is primarily an adventure for the MechWarrior roleplaying system, it includes a number of features for the BattleTech: Solaris VII expansion, as well as including the first examples of what would become Level 3 technology with the publication of the BattleTech Tactical Handbook a few years later. The 'Mechs within this expansion are largely BattleTech game-legal.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Panzer Saint-Lo 1944
description:
Panzer Saint-Lo 1944 invites you to command the axis and allies armies, in the mission to conquest the enemy’s command posts and obtain the victory.

As an allied general, you must recover the city of Saint-Lo and the surrounded area. But if you play as an axis general, your mission will be to resist and to defeat the allies, maintaining the control in the region.

Command the infantry, tank, artillery and aerial units that take part in the battle! Ask for reinforcements, avoid any danger with your supply units and take the necessary supplies that allow you to move and attack with you units. Only with tactic and strategy you shall get the victory!

Panzer Saint-Lo 1944 is a new, hex-and-counter board game, that simulates the battle of Saint-Lo, between german and American armies in July. 1944, during World War II. Each player had the control of half the board game, and have eight command post on towns, cities and strategic positions on it. The mission of each player is to move forward into enemy territory and destroy the enemy command post.

The game contains 210 counters, most of it whit a fine representation of guns and vehicles that took part in the real battle. Player have to command infantry, tanks, artillery, planes and supply units, in order to move into enemy terrain and to destroy enemy command post. The game involves use of resources as well, so movement and attack of units uses supplies counters, and players have to obtain supply every turn, through supply units.

Combat between units is defined with dices in a simple but smart way. Artillery units provide extra support to attacking units, obtaining powerful attack even with cheap vehicles.

The game also includes two card decks, one for each army. Cards provide extra power units and extra resources; it also makes shortage of ammo and fuel to the enemy.

As in the real battle, there is no invincible unit. Even if you play your Tiger I tanks or your B17 Flying Fortress bombers, you will need to beware of enemy infantry, light tanks or other enemy units. There are many ways to obtain victory, and to defeat the enemy, and only a good strategy is needed to gain the battle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Shizugatake Campaign
description:
This game in Japanese covers the important campaign between Hashiba Hideyoshi and Shibata Katsuie after the death of Oda Nobunaga.

The game starts in February and ends at the end of April 1583.
The map covers Kyoto, Kanegasaki, Gifu, and Anotsu.
This game depicts the whole Shizugatake campaign, not only the final battle of Shizugatake.

During each turn, each player rolls a die to determine how many actions are available. Then the player allocate actions to his forces. The actions include operation, recovery, and fort construction.

Hideyoshi wins if he eliminates Katsuie or advances into Kitaguni-kaido.
Katsuie wins if he eliminates Hideyoshi or advances into Kyoto.
If both could not achieve a victory at the last turn, then Katsuie win.


Rulebook translated in English and French.

name: Autokross-88
description:
A drifter in Zone's wastelands for many years, the Preacher has finally settled near the Karlsruhe ruins, twenty years after the '68 war, with the promise of the Revelation to the conqueror in a number of trials set for those willing to take part.

People of all ages and backgrounds started pouring in, even from beyond the great Wall, driven by the irresistible urge to have their dreams made true. The pilgrimage, a trial in itself, killed many at the hands of the Scourges or the Infekted, but those who made it are now called the Circle Of the Eighty-Eight, and the Preacher - their shepherd.

The first trial, an unnatural selection process, will comprise of a series of auto races in which the Circle members will drive heavily armed vehicles to the death. With every type of car declared eligible, many in the Eighty-Eight started smuggling in their vehicles from across the Wall while others started tinkering with the Zone’s own war refuse.

Thus begins Autokross-88.

So the last shall be first, and the first last for many be called, but few chosen. The Preacher






Players will choose and control one of the 88ers throughout the Preacher's series of trials. During each crucible, Circle members will have to pick a vehicle and customize it with different offensive/defensive weapons and equipment in an attempt to gain the edge over their rivals. Death racing will take place in the Zone's hexagonal map tile built wastes through hostile weather, Infekted hordes and unscrupulous comrades.

name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Module P4 – Marines!
description:
(from the back of the book)

This Playtest Module Includes:

The most up-to-date copy of (D15.0) Ground Combat and (D16.0) Advanced Boarding Party Combat available anywhere, plus the entirely new Transporter Artillery Rule (E92.0).

Four Commando Ship SSDs never seen before

Four new Marine combat scenarios . . . And the classic: Descent of the Hawk

New Technology!
Cluster Bombs, Anti-Personnel Drones, Bombardment Shuttles, A-7 Attack Fighter, New Ground Vehicles

Tables of Organization for Marine units of all races, showing how they are organized and how they fight. Special section on Klingon Marines.

The first draft of the F&E Ground Combat System ever seen ANYWHERE! Along with a special Klingon-Kzinti Ground Combat Micro-Scenario.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: SuperUber-Six
description:
An expanded version of Uber-Six, this version changes a few core rules, and adds a large number of abilities to enemies to make the game a bit more of an interesting challenge.

A pencil-and-paper dice-based solo roleplaying adventure. Players build a character and face hordes of enemies in an attempt to level up or die. The ultimate grindfest.

Players create a character of one of four classes (Warrior, Mage, Ninja, or Druid) each with a special ability, and adventure off into the wilderness to slay countless foes. In between each fight, the character rolls on the monster tables to determine which foe they will face in the upcoming round. If they so choose, they may spy by paying one gold before the roll--spying allows the player to decide whether or not to face the enemy. After the enemy is determined, the game continues to battle. During battle, initiative is determined each round by a roll of the dice modified by attributes, and whichever side has the initiative is allowed to make an action--either attacking, running, or using magic if possible. Combat is worked out in this way until one side or the other is reduced to 0 health, at which point if the character survives they gather gold and experience, and lives to fight another monster. If the character is dead, the game is over.

The goal of this game is simply to kill time in a fun way. Surviving characters can last for several sessions, and allow for a feeling of progression.

SuperUber-Six builds upon the gameplay of Uber-Six by adding several additional status effects and generally streamlining the turn process.

name: Umbra Turris
description:
Umbra Turris is new skirmish level miniatures game in which players control 6-12 heroes who create a party, trying to gain fame and wealth in ruins of old, grim city of Umbra Turris.
Using high quality miniatures and free intuitive rules players can assemble and highly customize their own band of heroes and then lead them to death or glory in one of six scenarios provided with rules. Additional rules such as random magic items, quests and terrain rules ensure big variety of games.
Game uses simple and effective mechanic which uses dice rolls, bidding and actions, with alternating activation.

Rules are available in English, Spanish, and Polish. You can download them for free on Spellcrow's blog about the Umbra Turris universe - http://utchronicles.com/utchronicles/?page_id=73

name: Clash of Lions: Battle of Jiradi Pass – June 6, 1967
description:
Clash of Lions: Battle of Jiradi Pass – June 6, 1967, is an introductory-level wargame simulation of the battle of Jiradi Pass, fought in the Sinai between remnants of the Egyptian 7th Infantry Division and elements of Israel's Tal Armored Division. Players are cast in the roles of the local commanders on this battlefield. Both will be challenged to do as well, or better, than their historical counterparts.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 30 minutes
Hex: 500 yards / 457 meters
Units: Platoon to Company

Game Inventory:
One 8.5x11" full color map
One single-side printed un-mounted countersheet (56 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 3-page rulebook

Player Provided: One 6-sided die

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1 to 2 hours

name: Hail Caesar Army Lists: Biblical & Classical
description:
The first army list supplement for the Hail Caesar miniatures wargame. The book is 84 pages printed in full color, with army composition guides, gaming stats and notes for 63 different armies from the biblical and classical periods. Beautifully illustrated with full-color photos of ancient miniature armies.

Armies included:
- Old and Middle Kingdom Egypt
- Nubian
- Akkad and Sumer
- Amorite Babylonia
- Early Arab Raiders
- Canaanites
- Mitanni
- Hittites
- Mycenaean
- New Kingdom Egyptian
- Early Assyrian
- North European Bronze Age
- Libyan
- Sea Peoples
- Israel and Judeah
- Assyrian Empire
- Neo-Babylonian
- Urartu
- Scythian
- Saite Egyptian
- Lydian
- Kyrenean Greek
- Early Achaemenid Persian
- Early Carthaginian
- Hoplite Greek
- Thracian
- Samnite
- Later Hoplite Greek
- Pauravan and Mauryan Indians
- Syracusan
- Camillan Rome
- Gauls
- Illyrian
- Late Achaemenid Persians
- Alexandrian Macedonian
- Qin China
- Alexander's Successors
- Hellenistic Greek
- Bactrian Greek
- Carthaginian
- Republican Rome
- Galatians
- Parthians
- Numidians
- Meroitic Kushite
- Spanish
- Late Macedonian
- Seleucid
- Ptolemaic
- Han China
- Celtiberian
- Pyrrhic
- Early German
- Maccabean Jewish
- Sarmatians
- Artaxiad Armenian
- Ancient Britons
- Mithridatic Pontic
- Dacian
- Marian Roman
- Imperial Roman
- Jewish Revolt
- Kushan
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Spaniel
description:
This is a 3-player game, using 3 colours (Black, White & Red), but with no colour representing any one player. It is played using a standard Shibumi set.
In essence, it is a simple connect-3 game. The winner is the player that connects 3 of any colour in a visible straight line (“visible” meaning that, for instance, a 3-in-a-row going through the middle of the pyramid, with stones all round, blocking one or more stones from sight, is not a win).

The board starts empty. Each player places 2 stones each turn, in this order:
P.1: B, W
P.2: R, B
P.3: W, R
Passing is not allowed, and the stones must be played in this specific order. There is no removal of stones in this game.

That is the full extent of the rules. A draw can indeed occur.

This game was created in response to the Shibumi Challenge.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Takemo
description:
Players are divided into two camps playing with their pawns.
They put words on the board horizontally on the line closest to his line of defense one word in turn.

In his turn player may form a word on his line of defense by placing the letters on the board and by connecting the excisting words.
If he reaches the defense line of the opponent he earns the TAKENO (bonus token)
He can capture one or more words of the other side of the board by overlapping letters of the word.

When a player can not draw enough chips for the tokens required, the game is over. The winner is the player who has the most chips on the game board

name: Auspicious Beginning
description:
Introductory game for the OCMS system from Game Production Workshop. The current set is covering WW II in the European Theater of operations.

This game covers the campaign in Sicily using the rules, and components for the entire game series. Set with a scale of 15 day turns, and 17 miles to the hex, it is an operational level examination of the conduct of warfare, involving ground, air, and naval forces.

The players are the commanders of the Axis and Allied forces involved in the campaign, with the historical missions assigned to both sides.

name: Zero sumZ
description:
Abstract card game where you collect sets of three or more cards. Each card contains one to six abstract shapes, such as a green circle or a blue triangle. A set is called a "zero sum" if it contains an even number (including 0) of every shape.

In the Seven Card Challenge, seven cards are dealt face up. The first player to find a zero sum takes those cards, which are replaced with new cards. When the deck runs out, the player with the most cards wins.

name: Knights of Ten: Battle Ready
description:
Knights of Ten: Battle Ready includes four copies of three new cards that can be added to your Knights of Ten deck. These cards are:


Sorceress: Takes horde to zero.
Take the Donkey: Take the donkey.
Dragon Slayer: The dragon cannot be played this hand.

name: Celestia
description:
Gather stars from the cosmos to form constellations and rule the universe!
THE CREATION
Divide the deck into constellation and star cards. Shuffle the two decks and place them face-down next to each other. Each player draws three cards to begin their hand. Turn two constellation cards face-up, side by side, next to the constellation draw pile. A star discard pile will begin next to the star draw pile. If the star draw pile is empty, reshuffle the discard pile and replace face-down.

HEAVENLY MOTION
During your turn:
1. Draw one star
2. Do one of the following two actions:
a) Play two stars from your hand face-down on the table. Your
opponent(s) must place a star face-up in front of each of your two cards. Your opponent wins the stars that were matched opposite the players star. The player wins any unmatched cards opposite one another.
or
b) Discard a set of star cards from your hand that match the stars highlighted on a face-up constellation card. Take the constellation and earn the points labeled in roman numerals. Turn another constellation card face-up to replace the card just won.
If any player has less than two stars at the beginning of a turn, then, they draw to bring their hand to two cards.

STARS OF THE SHOW
Stars come in 4 types
alpha, beta, gamma, delta
9 cards of each type
Supernovae can be used as any star type
They always lose during a match phase
3 supernovae
15 Constellations in 3 types
3, 4, and 5 star combinations

2 players:
During a match phase, each player plays 2 stars
3 players:
During a match phase, the player plays 2 stars and each opponent plays 1 star
4 players:
Teams with 2 partners sitting opposite one another.
Player and partner each play 1 star face-down
Opposing team’s partners each play 1 star

RULING THE UNIVERSE
The game ends when the last constellation has been taken. Total the points in roman numerals that you or your team has collected. Receive a 2 point bonus for collecting 3 or more of a constellation combination type. The highest total wins!

name: Road Rally USA: Dead Man's Curve Expansion
description:
Set Up: You can play with either or both tiles in any combination. To mix things up you may flip the tiles before playing the game to see which side you will be playing with.

Before receiving your starting cards, place a shortcut between two unconnected squares on the same track tile, matching the layout of the pre-printed shortcuts (i.e. the shortcut skips over 3 spaces). The spaces (that you create a shortcut to and from) may have other features on them. You may also place and shortcut directly over another shortcut if you wish.

"Green, Green, Grass" Short Cut: The Green, Green, Grass Short Cut may only be used by spending 3 or more green cards as your standard movement. If you do, you may use this shortcut to skip over the intervening spaces during your normal move. You do not have to end your turn at its entrance, nor do you have to stop at its exit.

"Red Right Hand Turn" Short Cut: The Red Right Hand Turn Short Cut may only be used by spending red cards as your standard movement. If you do, you may use this shortcut to skip over the intervening spaces during your normal move. You do not have to end your turn at its entrance. However, you must end your movement at the shortcut's exit space.

name: Myrmidons Expansion
description:
The base game contains 12 myrmidon pieces (two each of six different types) (as well as a 6×7 checkered board and a cotton case). This expansion contains 28 additional pieces (two each of 14 new different types) in order to provide quite a few additional playing configurations. The base game allowed 720 starting combinations for each army, amounting to 518,400 distinct setups, with just its 6 pieces for each team. The Myrmidons Expansion gives each player nearly two million (1,860,480) starting configurations, for well over three trillion (3,461,385,830,400) setups for a six-piece-per-side setup. If you choose the new 12-piece-per-side option, each player will have nearly seven trillion (6,704,425,728,000) setups.

This expansion was first available through Crowdfunding: nestorbooster.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Memory

name: Sunrise City: Bonus Roles and Buildings
description:
Kickstarter Backers received these four bonus roles and Five community tiles.

Four Role Cards:

Detective allows you to combine your zone tiles and the zone tiles of another player, choose the four you want to keep, and give the remaining four back to that other player.

City Planner allows you to rotate any zone tiles you control, thus changing the road layouts and possible zone combinations before you place building tiles on them.

Foreign Investor earns you floor points for even numbered floors. You already earn points for odd numbered floors, so now you'll be able to earn a bonus for every upper floor you add to the city.

Re-Elected Socialite is a great last-round role as she allows you to choose a role card from any role that any players used in a previous round.

Five Community Tiles

Power Plant subtracts a point for any Residential Building added in a surrounding area.

University subtracts a point for any Commercial Building added in a surrounding area.

Theatre subtracts a point for any Parks & Rec Building added in a surrounding area.

Library subtracts a point for any Industrial Building added in a surrounding area.

Stadium subtracts a point for any Mixed Use Building added in a surrounding are
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Djibouti
description:
Djibouti
An Entrepreneur's Playground
The former French colony of Djibouti (jee-BOO-tee) in the present day: the economy is just starting to take off and you are a part of it!

Everyone wants to parlay their street vender origins into bigger and better things.

What small ventures will you start?

What big ventures will you invest in?

How will you outsmart your competitors?

Goal: Create the biggest business empire
- Build small ventures to accumulate capital
- Use capital to invest in big ventures
- Manipulate your competitor’s investments

Djibouti is a tableau building game where your hand of cards is used to construct buildings by playing the building card and spending additional cards for payment or expending cards as action cards to move your (or other players') capital.

Small enterprises are built in your play area, but large ones are shared in a central pool. Large enterprises all have special abilities that you can use if you invest capital, and points to score for either plurality on any card, or for having capital across sets of the same colour.

The game lasts eight rounds and the person with the high score is the winner.
publishers: Sweet Storm Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Jam: The Roller Derby Card Game
description:
Roller Derby is a contact sport where 2 groups of 5 skaters from rival teams compete on an oval track to score the most points.
Your duty as the coach of one of these teams is to lead them to victory.

JAM is a card game for two coaches, or teams, based around the Movement Programming mechanic.

name: Swarm!: Anti-Body Assault
description:
Swarm! Anti-Body Assault is a competitive-cooperative science fiction game for two to four players. A breach between dimensions has opened at the edge of the galaxy, and the Anti-Bodies, a race of horrible interdimensional space monsters, are spilling out and threatening to consume everything in their path if left unchecked. That's where you come in! You and a couple friends can take control of one of fifteen giant robots from all across the Milky Way, equip an arsenal of futuristic weaponry, and mow down the horde. And although everyone is working towards the same goal, killing some enemies will bring you more recognition from others when it's time for the Senator to hand out the medals...

Gameplay consists of rounds of play, called waves, in which a random number of enemy cards are dealt out of a deck to each player. Then, players take turns making attack rolls using up to three different colored dice, which correspond to enemy types (for example, red dice can only deal damage to red enemies, etc.). After all attacks have been made by players, any surviving enemies counterattack, then remain in play during the next wave.

The primary goal is to work with your teammates to deplete the 100 card enemy deck entirely, but in addition to that each enemy a player kills is worth anywhere from one to six points. So, while players are competing against each other for points, they are also required to work together to prevent a total party loss.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Heblo
description: An unusual-looking game in which the playing field "flips" its rows depending on how the playing pieces are distributed. The wooden game features eight rocking levers in a board that contains 64 spaces. The winner is the first player who gets four pieces off the board.

name: Płowce 1331
description:
This game covers the battle of Płowce, fought between the Kingdom of Poland and the Teutonic Order. Despite the Polish victory on the field, the battle is traditionally regarded as inconclusive given that the Teutonic Order was not destroyed. Nevertheless, it was an important battle for Poland, which was just regaining its stature as a country on the international scene, and held its own against a powerful military force.

It was published in 27th issue of "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine. It contains board and 92 counters, along with two scenarios:

- Hasło "Kraków" (early stage of the battle)
- Płowce (late stage of the battle)

name: The Pacific War: From Pearl Harbor to Philippine Sea
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Can right strategy alone change history?

Was defeat in the Pacific War inevitable for Japan? Could you set the goals needed to end the war and use the Imperial Japanese Navy in greater effect, which was the strongest in the world at that point, in order to achieve different results? An "if" scenario that history could not forgive, but may be investigated through a simulation game.

[Pacific War] is a strategic level simulation game of the naval operations in the Pacific from 1941 to the first half of 1944. Players become commanders of the Japanese Imperial Navy and the Allied navy, which is centered around the US navy, and have to plan a strategy and execute it in order to win the war.

Even though the rules are simple and cover only 4 pages, a unique gaming system is adopted. Similarly to the actual warfare in order to maximize the efficiency of your aircraft carrier task forces will require experience and a significant amount of trial and error. The designers notes and detailed example inside the provided play book, are designed to help the players get a grasp of the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Soviet Maximum Effort and the Estonians
description:
This variant adds ten Soviet and one Estonian counters for the Non Historical Scenarios.
Also contains errata for the Historical Scenario German reinforcements.

name: Asphodel
description:
At the mouth of the river of the dead is the mighty city of Asphodel. It is known by many other names, some call it Purgatory some Stygia. Many lives that were cut short by violence or tragedy resume here fighting each other in a nightly battle to gain the strength to move on while fending off the attacks of rival factions. Asphodel is a strategic skirmish game set in the afterlands.

Factions of ghosts fight over locations to gain enough resolve to move on. These locations exist as shadows of places in the world of the living. In the afterlands locations may be adjacent to other places that are actually many miles apart in the living world. Set up -----Each player begins by either choosing or randomly drawing one of the available factions:

The Drowned, whose lives were cut short by tragedy at sea, or perhaps at the bottom of a well.

The Burned, victims of fires, radiation, and explosions. Their connection to the fire has lasted into the next world.

The Gremlins, tinkering souls who lost their lives to the machines they still love.

The Mystics whose pursuit of knowledge and power has become even greater on the shadowy side of the shroud.

And the Poltergeists whose violent brutal ends leave them raging, and lashing out across the asphodel meadows and possibly beyond.

Players take turns moving their Ghosts, who are represented by dice. Ghosts will be banished, and summoned back to Asphodel. Ghosts may find the resolve to transcend this purgatory, scoring points for the player or they may find themselves stuck in Asphodel, wandering the twilight city forever.

name: Ophidian Wars
description:
Bloodsport has reached its pinnacle. The Ophidian race tyrannically hunts, controls, and exploits the most powerful fighters in the universe. Arenas are packed to watch the spectacle, and worlds tune in to cheer for their teams and champions. Welcome to the arena, coach! Prepare your gladiators for battle.

Ophidian Wars is card-based combat game where you must draft and coach a team of 5 deadly gladiators. You get to choose your own team (from a set of 14), then equip them with a custom arsenal, and train them with maneuvers. The last team standing is the victor.

The game's combat/gameplay is governed by "the Flow" - every action you take in Ophidian Wars is either positive (+) or negative (-). Positive actions allow to you retain control and continue making further actions, while a negative action transfer control (Flow) to your opponent. Learning how to best manipulate the Flow while managing your team's field position and resources (Cheer and Adrenaline) is crucial to winning.

If you enjoy minis, all 14 beta set gladiators are available for 3D printing and painting, high detail resin, 54mm. Gladiator stats/abilities are directly on the pedestal, replacing their cards if you so choose.

The Ophidians are watching your every move. Get in the arena, pull up your pants, rally the crowds, and master the flow of combat.
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Raising the Flags
description:
After a long journey crossing never-ending wild seas, the colonies reached a wonderful and prosperous island… The rush of power began quickly after… And, the battle for conquering the island to prove who was the master of this mysterious island… Colonies started to expand their own territories by acquiring more lands… And, to flourish by harvesting resources... However, the resources were limited … And, industrialization was inevitably ahead… So, at a glance, the faces of tiny villages have been changed to modern cities… Colonies rapidly developed new cities, built massive factories, used airplanes to collect the resources, and scratched the sky with their high-rise business centers... The danger of foreigners was always around… Hence, the incomers funded the costly militaries to protect their people… War was not always an option… Thus, they established diplomacy and started trading with their neighbors… Famine lead to demand for more lands… So, the settlers were convinced to invade new lands and raise their own flags on them… And now this is the question: whose flags will remain waving on the horizon?

Raising the Flags is a strategic board game where every player is a leader of a colony. The winner of the game is the one who creates the most prosperous territory. The game occurs on an island containing various lands and cities. Each player begins the adventure by selecting a capital city and raising the main flag on it. Players should expand the territory with the construction of new buildings such as farms, houses, factories, airports and business centers, and by harvesting crude resources including, food, wood, stone and oil. The players also experience negotiation and trading with neighbors, tricking and attacking them…
The game board is an island which contains four different tiles, including sea, resources, lands and cities. Each player starts the game by selecting a city as the own capital city and raises the main flag in that capital city. Then, it is time to expand the territory, construct the buildings, generate and trade resources with other players based on some pre-determined rules. The players expand their territory and raise the land flags on them. Then, they start to construct new building on the own territories. Simultaneous with construction of every new building, the player must select a building flag and raise it on the top of that constructed building. Selection of a flag is according to the player’s own decision, which can be aimed by the logic of probability. When a player rolls two dices, the summation of both dices will make a number. If this number is matched with any flag number on top of any player’s building, the owner player will receive the income of that particular building. Therefore, the territory of each player is expanded according to the optimal construction of the buildings and efficient way of raising the flags. During a gameplay, management of resources/money, planning to expand lands and cities, effective negotiation with neighbors, wise decision to attack other players, defending territory, and of course having a bit of luck will make a player closer to the final victory.
categories: Adventure, City Building, Dice, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Territory Building
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Income, Modular Board, Race, Random Production, Trading, Variable Set-up

name: CHEW: Chog Frappe Promo
description:
This promo package contains:

2 Chog Frappe Cards
5 Green Variant Chogs

The Chog Frappe card makes all players discard all chogs. The green Chogs are simply more Chogs to add to the game.

name: Die Krieger vom Jein
description:
Game no. 1 (of 7) in a family called "Die Kleinen Feinen". Each game contains only 10 cards. Rules have to be downloaded or might be available separate.
Players receive 3 or 2 cards and one card is placed face down in the middle. Cards are showing vikings with different helmets and shields. By asking others players about the kind of helmet and/or shield you have to get the clue about the viking on the face down card in the middle.

name: Blink!
description:
Blink! is a Doctor Who miniatures game, written as a pre-sequel to the Doctor Who story, “Blink!” The background to the story is as follows; The Doctor and Martha Jones have been investigating the strange disappearance of a number of people which have brought them into the garden of an old abandoned house. They are then ambushed by alien monsters called “Weeping Angels”, which they must escape from.

The game is involves one player taking the role of the Doctor and Martha, the other takes control of the four Weeping Angels. The aim of the game is that the Doctor and Martha must escape from the garden to win before the Weeping Angels capture them.

The game was first published in the fanzine Ragnarok, issue 60, with instructions on miniatures and scenery required.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Thrones
description:
From the publisher:

Thrones is a two-player 9x9 board game where each players set their tiles and pieces secretly, screened from their opponent's view, until the screen is removed, the middle fifth row is set, and the battle's combat begins.

Gameplay:
Each player controls an army of 13 and a homeland of 36 tiles, including 1 Fortress.

A screen separates the players as they set their sides of the battlefield in secret.

Before the screen is removed, both players choose positions for the tiles in a middle row between their two sides.

Once the screen is removed, the middle row tiles positions are resolved, and the remaining empty space is occupied by a neutral Fortress.

The game begins! Tiles affect their piece’s ability to move, attack, and defend itself- sometimes to their benefit, sometimes not. Players must battle their opponent’s army while preserving their own, but will lose if they lose their Throne piece.

A player instantly defeats their opponent by moving their Throne piece into their enemy's Fortress- no matter what pieces either player controls.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Setting The East Ablaze!: Warfare in the Back of Beyond 1917-1926
description:
Setting The East Ablaze! contains miniature wargame rules for warfare in Central Europe, Russia, Central Asia, China and elsewhere from the years 1917-1926.

These rules are designed for medium-sized games (c. 60-70 figures per side), but they do work just as well for smaller skirmish-level games, and for larger games of up to 500 figures per side.

Rules use standard six-sided dice. Figures are grouped into units, ranging from 8 (cavalry units) to 20 (irregular mobs) strong. An action card system is then used to play the game, with considerable potential to customize the card deck depending on the game you wish to play.

Appendices provide further information on basic points value of units, tanks and armored cars, optional rules, fire and bomb templates, and army morale.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: Balancing Dolphin
description:
1 blue dolphin
18 coloured rings (small,medium and large in red, orange, yellow, blue, green and purple)
* The small rings are able to be placed inside the large rings
1 coloured dice

The dolphin is placed on the table with it's back facing down, like a see-saw. The 18 rings lie next to it. Players take turns to roll the dice and place a ring of the required colour on the dolphin's tummy. The player that makes rings fall off the dolphin must drop our. The remaining players then continue to play without the eliminated player and the fallen rings become part of the game again.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Drider Expansion Pack
description: The Drider Staltax is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Rage of Demons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Kruge's Bird-of-Prey Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Classic Movies. It is a B'Rel Class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Table Air Combat: F4F-4 Wildcat
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability. The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the F4F-4 Wildcat. Wildcats were used in the early Pacific war, where they fought against the superior Zero.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II

name: Robotech RPG Tactics: UEDF Tomahawk / Defender Destroids
description:
From the publisher:

Prepare for invasion with Robotech RPG Tactics! Take command of the deadly mecha fighting forces of the United Earth Defense Force, the Zentraedi Armada, or the Malcontents. Robotech RPG Tactics is an epic 6mm scale battle game where players control whole armies from the Robotech universe. Take to the battlefield to crush your friends in a dynamic tactical game where the outcome is always hanging in the balance. 2 Tomahawk Destroids which are the main battle tank of Destroids, brimming with powerful particle beam cannons for arms, and wielding a battery of missiles and an array of other weapons. 2 Defender Destroids which are a long-range, anti-aircraft juggernaut capable of shooting down incoming Zentraedi Battlepods and Gnerl Fighters.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: We Saw Spain Die
description:
WE SAW SPAIN DIE is a solitary game simulating military operations during the Spanish Civil War (July 18 1936 - April 1 1939)

The board covers the historical space of this conflict.
The goal of the game is to reduce the Republican morale and increase the Nationalists morale.
To get those victory/morale points, areas must be captured, provinces and main towns that are military objectives.

As a player you are in charge of the Nationalist group and try to topple the Republican government elected in 1936.
In a context of European division between democracies and dictatorships, you get support from Nazi Germany , Fascist Italy and the authoritarian Portuguese regime.
The player gets to pick different combat strategies to achieve his goal - Mass attack, Safe progress, Armoured attack, coordinated maneuvers or a non-combat reinforcements action.

1 turn = 3 months
12 turns total

Game published in French
categories: Civil War, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Invasion Evasion
description:
Invasion Evasion is a party game that pits friends against each other to prevent or cause a hostile alien takeover.

The invasion has begun! Flying saucers are abducting innocent people off the streets and returning them corrupted and changed. It has become impossible to tell apart harmless civilians from vile alien scum.

Deep inside of an underground bunker is a team of humans trying desperately to stop the attacks. They have developed a cure to the alien parasite to transform humans back to normal, but are unable to mass produce it. As they try to gather the supplies necessary to save the planet, it becomes clear that some among them cannot be trusted… and have more nefarious plans in mind.
Each player receives a secret role and either works with the Humans to mass produce a cure or joins the Aliens
in the construction of a Doomsday Device. The fate of the world hangs in the balance.
Human Victory: Have one Human player hold all three types of Humanity Cards - Alien Specimen, Chemical Stockroom, and Medical Laboratory

Alien Victory: Have one Alien player hold all three types of Doomsday Cards - Black Hole Bomb, Perpetual Motion Drive, and Quantum Reactor

As each Humanity and Doomsday card is found it becomes more and more important that they are placed in safe hands, but in Invasion Evasion the teams can constantly change. Who do you trust?
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Role Playing, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Spell Saga: Realmwalker – Prelude: Science//Armor//Romance
description:
The world's first tabletop novella!

Way out West, in the coldest part of the Wintery Woods lived the ghosts of songs he never played anymore.

Things must be remembered. Ghosts must never fade. Songs will keep you alive, now that the world has ended...

Welcome to Spell Saga ~ realmwalker ~ the world's first tabletop novella! This is a one player solo-style game with magical items, mysterious party members, & dangerous battles. There is no grinding for levels, as the game allows you to grow by exploring.

The ending of any realmwalker is always the same, but how you get there--and IF you get there, is up to you.

Each turn, you get a few cards in your hand, as well as some on the action pile on the table. One of the major finds can be story cards, that move the story (and the game) along. This will also trigger some of the cards (including enemies) in the action pile! You can perform different actions by moving your adventurers to different places - once you have discovered them! The story cards will (eventually) tell you how you can win the game.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Heroes of Normandie: Kampania Czterej Pancerni
description: Promo campaign from Portal Games. Contains 3 missions based on polish TV series "Czterej Pancerni i pies"("Four tank-men and a dog") and hero tank tile "Rudy 102"("Ginger 102").
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Ascension: Shadow Piercer Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was available thru the Dice Tower 2016 (Season 12) Kickstarter

Cost: 4 Runes

Void Construct

When this comes into play, put 3 arrow counters on it.
Once per turn, you may remove an arrow counter to gain 2 power. If there are no arrow counters on this, destroy it

Worth: 2 Honor
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Skewered and Roasted
description:
Skewered and Roasted is an Apples-to-Apples style points based game. There are two decks Events and Memories. Each round, the active player draws a Memory card (which features a situation like "What was my favorite classroom activity") from the deck, then the other players each secretly choose the Event card in hand that best matches that player's history and plays it face-down on the table. The active player then reveals these cards and chooses the Event card that, in their opinion, best matches the Memory card, which he awards to whoever played that Event card. This player earns 1 point, and the active player marker is passed down to the next player.

Once a player has won a number of points, selected from 3 gameplay styles, that player wins.

name: Perpetual Life
description:
Perpetual Life is a farming management worker placement game in which the players are to cultivate manafruits in order to develop the lands as much as possible. Each turn, the player chooses an action to perform, like getting seeds, watering the lands, harvesting, or leasing a machine. The more people who have chosen a specific action, the more beneficial it is to the latecomer.

When harvesting a fruit, the fruit may evolve into a more valuable fruit if it's adjacent to a specific other fruit. Also, having several fruits of the same sort adjacent to each other gives bonuses.

name: Sword World 2.0: Card Adventure
description:
This game is best described as a card based co-operative dungeon exploration.

Heroes of different roles and powers join together to defeat different challenges before them, and unlock the more difficult ones beyond. Every turn each hero can join in if they have a card that allows them to contribute to that particular task, pooling their dice with the ones the previous hero chose not to use. If they succeed the challenge is removed, but if you fail, you discard cards as damage.

Be careful though, the cards can only be used 3 times, and after that the heroes run out of time.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Munchkin Oz 2: Yellow Brick Raid
description:
Description from the publisher:

Loot the Emerald City even more thoroughly than before with Munchkin Oz 2: Yellow Brick Raid, which contains 56 new cards inspired by the fourteen Oz books by L. Frank Baum.

There are 34 Doors and 22 Treasures, with plenty of monsters (including a handful of high-level ones), some Allies and Curses, and lots of treasure. Now, you can fight the Googly-Goo or The Lizard of Oz in the Lemonade Rain and Popcorn Snow using a Can of Brains or the Magic Apron.

It's a great way to experience all the characters, locations, and quirks of the Oz books, whether you're a fan — or you've always meant to read them but never quite got around to it.

name: Cat & Co.: Meow Meow
description:
Description from the publisher :

Four little kittens compete in an amusing race for the best spot in the basket. You can lay down one of your colorful cards only when the color or the motif matches the last card played. Whoever is the first to get rid of all their cards may move his or her kitten one step closer to the basket as a reward. With some luck, you can win this colorful race. A cheerful and colorful classic card game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Pacific War Naval Chess Game
description: Pacific Ocean naval campaign Spring 1942 through Summer 1945 in 14 seasonal turns. Capital ships paired. Simple surface, submarine, and air combat mechanics any kid can quickly master. Magic intelligence in the early seasons - kamikazes in the later ones. VIOLENT little game is also somewhat unpredictable making it solitaire fare.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Trick Legacy
description:
Trick Legacy takes you on a journey through traditional trick-taking games, by altering core mechanics and individual player abilities from one game to the next. At various points throughout the campaign you will find similarities to popular trick-taking games, such as Setback, Pinochle, Euchre, and Whist, while also experiencing unique mechanics of our own design.

In true "legacy-style" fashion, you will make permanent changes to the deck as the campaign proceeds (over multiple days or weeks), from adding new cards, marking cards with a sharpie, and even destroying cards. However, these changes are only made to the standard decks of playing cards you will use, so when you're ready to start up another campaign all you'll need is a couple new standard decks of cards from your local drug store.

--

Rune. Our once prosperous realm had fallen into bitter decay. The great empires of the land shattered, forsaking all treaties and reverting to their primal instincts and savagery. Many were thought to have faded to extinction.

Countless decades have passed, and the remnants of these broken civilizations have begun to rebuild and emerge once again. It is a time of uncertainty – it is a time of convergence. From Lords to peasants, from Jinns to diplomats – all must adapt to a new life on Rune.

name: Arena
description:
Description from the publisher:

Arena is a fast game reproducing gladiators’ combats. Nine different typologies of gladiator are available. Each gladiator plays with a deck of 15 cards, different for each typology. The combat is divided in turns. In each turn a gladiator plays with 3 action cards, using only 2 of them for trying to hit his adversary or escape from him.
The match is played on a hex grid.
It is possible to reproduce single combats, organize full days of competition and follow the career of the gladiators from the beginning to freedom (or death in the arena).

name: Hadművelet
description:
It must be very exciting to get across the Alps riding an elephant like Hannibal, to conquer the greater part of the world like Napoleon or to subdue Napoleon like Kutusov. Still in is more interesting to be able - like a mighty general - to command one's own modern army, to purchase arms, tanks, and soldiers and fight battles against the armed forces of an imaginary country. The game can be played by two or more players, more partners can overcome the enemy with allied forces led by mutual chosen commanders.

There are neither children nor adults who not be taken by a victory, that is due to their own skillful, cunning strategy and their clever quick decisions.

name: Archichato
description:
The first player to reproduce a castle with his cones wins!But you have to be very observant because they all look alike

Un duel de constructeur : le premier qui reproduit la pyramide de la carte remporte la partie ! Mais attentions aux pièges et aux ressemblances !

—description from the publisher

name: State of Wonder
description:
State of Wonder is a Card Game of Skill, Deceit and Strategy. Recruit mighty armies to destroy your Enemies or build a Great Wonder to show your power and seize the throne of Scathia.

In State of Wonder you are trying to take the throne of Scathia, a large kingdom of several city states that is in full civil war after the Queen died. You accomplish this through building and protecting an awe inspiring wonder or through destroying all others who dare to fight for the throne.

No ruler can stand without the might of others. Stand united with one of the three powerful factions, the Noble Crux Militem, The Cunning Frifolk or the Mystical Ritualists!

State of Wonder features a very deep combat system. Where players siege each others cities and fight in the open field. Taking turns activating units during each combat phase.
