State of Wonder also has a Production System based upon deceit. When cards are played they are put face down into the production system, showing the cost that was payed for the card. Players can pay more than what is stated on a card, to confuse their enemies as prediction will lead players to victory.

In State of Wonder, every decision you take matter, as there is only one random element. Who Goes first. There is no card drawing, no die rolling and no coin flipping.

Are you the one to take the throne, or will you fall to the might of another conqueror?
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment

name: WHATEVER Party Game
description:
WHATEVER is an awkward and embarrassing adult party game.
With physical challenges, dares, embarrassing confessions, awkward situations, and so much more, game nights are going to get weird.

The game consists of instructions, a spinner, and 200 cards: 75 Challenge/ 75 Showdown/ 50 Penalty

Spin to determine whether you will be completing a Challenge or a Showdown. Challenge cards mean you’re on your own completing the ridiculous task. Showdown cards mean it’s you head-to-head against another player. Don’t have what it takes to attempt your card? Draw a Penalty card and pay the price until your next turn...or for the rest of the game.

Successfully complete or win a Challenge or Showdown card and keep it in your pile. First to earn five cards wins the game.

In WHATEVER you may find yourself doing things like:

Staring into the eyes of another player and going back and forth saying 'moist' until someone laughs and loses.
Getting tickled by the player with the longest fingers.
Showing the rest of the group the last thing you Googled.
Bringing all the boys to the yard with your milkshake.
And so much more.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Space Princess
description:
Space Princess is a two-player retro sci-fi strategy game that fits in your pocket. Test your wits against a friend as the Space Princess or the Dark Zealot, each with their own unique abilities and powers. Beautifully illustrated by Rachel Kozy and graphic design by Ian Moss, Space Princess is an homage to our favorite space princess, the late Carrie Fisher. Proceeds from Space Princess are donated to the International Bipolar Foundation, a cause supported by Ms. Fisher and dear to us!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Colosseum Alter of the Sun
description:
Colosseum Alter of the Sun is the sequel of Colosseum. This game is basically the same game to the previous game only with different characters and skills. You can even play with character cards and overdrive cards of both games mixed together.

Colosseum is a one-on-one duel card game. This game reflects many features seen in fighting video games, such as character-specific abilities, distance control, anticipating opponent's moves, three-way-deadlock skill interactions, and overdrive skills. With these features, this game provides an environment where players' risk and return fluctuate throughout the game.
publishers: Just Play Games, Riddle Inc. (株式会社リドル)

name: "Almost a Miracle!”: The Revolutionary War in the North
description:
(When asked about it, years after it ended, George Washington said that the American Victory was "little short of a standing miracle."

Almost a Miracle! uses our successful Tarleton's Quarter! as a game engine starting point to bring the Northern "half" of the American Revolution into play. Will the British be able to impose "the King's Peace" on the northern colonies or will the revolution survive to birth a new nation?

The map and victory conditions for Almost a Miracle! show players why battles took place in key areas but also lets players explore those seemingly odd tertiary campaigns, like Halifax, Fort Pitt, and Quebec.

Designer David Jones forces both sides to deal with their own challenges. The British consistently failed to "live off the land" and had to buy or ship food to sustain their armies, while the Continentals struggled with purchasing power and transportation.

The game handles battles in both large and small scale, as both were critical to the War's outcome, with a system that models 18th Century combat and how it differed from later times, where morale, readiness, leadership, and mere chance all could be "the" critical factor at one time or another, and disease and desertion could be an army's biggest killer.

Special rules cover the short enlistments of the Continentals, the uncertainty of French support and entry, prisoner exchanges, and the variable support of Loyalists and Native Americans. Both sides faced challenges they did not expect, and both sides contributed nearly as much to their own failures as they achieved in victory. The game will provide insights into how narrowly the Americans succeeded and how close the British came to their own victory.

—decription from the publisher

Designed by David Jones, after Mike Joslyn.
Graphics by Mark Mahaffey, after Craig Grando.
Developed by Lembit Tohver.

This game was published in issue no.51 of "Against the Odds" magazine.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame

name: Châlons 451 A.D.
description:
Born half-Roman, but all business, this battle saw “the last great Roman general”, Aetius, at his finest! And “finest” would mean both political maneuvering with shifting alliances as well as tactical finesse.

The build-up to the Battle of Châlons (also called the “Battle of the Cataulnian Plains”) is incredibly complex, and no one is certain which parts are actually true. Certainly much of the “invasion” of the Late Roman Empire were fierce peoples—Vandals, Goths, Alans, etc—who were fleeing from the even-fiercer Huns. But Hunnish leaders like Attila, were far more than merely brutal, playing alliances, taking advantage of the deaths of neighboring leaders, and playing both Eastern and Western Romans as clients and victims. The Roman leader, Aetius, had Hunnish warriors fighting FOR him in earlier battles, and spent time with both the Huns and Goths as a honored hostage (learning much about both peoples while there.) In fact, his father was a Roman general of “Scythian” origin, one of the original groups of powerful mounted nomads, so you could say he was closer to his allies and adversaries than most Roman commanders of the day, which is one reason he was one of the most influential men in the Western empire for over 20 years.

Attila had spent time “visiting” various parts of both East and West, but taken home more loot from the East and decided there must be riper pickings in the West. Adding much of Gaul to his empire and plundering the rest looks to have been his aim, but his movements suggest as much opportunism as strategy.

The “two” armies involved at Châlons were a varied hodge-podge of peoples, with the “Hun” side including various Goths, Alans, Burgundians, Rugians, Franks, Thuringians, and many more. The “Allied” side was primarily Visigoth and “Roman” (which would be a broad mix of peoples in the same uniforms) but also included various Celtic and German tribes, Romano-Britons and their own allies of Franks, Alans, and Burgundians.

Now, you can apply those multi-faceted armies against each other in a way that really shows off their diversity. The Battle of Châlons game uses full-sized cards for each unit (rather like our Battle of Arbela game by the same designer). Each card has all the information you need for movement, activation, combat, and morale. Players set up their best available deployments to execute their strategies and win the game (if the gods of fortune smile!). Your leaders allow activations and assist in combat. Some troops may make choices other than what the commanders might have wished (and that can work out well or otherwise). It’s all part of presenting this chaotic game in a timely and playable fashion.

A full battle will last 60 to 120 minutes. And then you can swap sides and try it again! Châlons comes with full-sized, coated playing cards, a sheet of information counters, playing field diagram, dice, and all the rules you need.

Part of the TPS "Decisive Battles" series. That means straightforward rules, key insights into the history behind the game, and designs aimed at one-session conclusions and high replay value.

—description from the publisher

name: Tenochtitlan
description:
It is the late 15th century. In the central valley of Mexico stands the great city of Tenochtitlan, the capital of the mighty Aztec Empire. You are an ambitious citizen traveling through the city doing great deeds to achieve social advancement. Tenochtitlan is a Euro-style dice drafting game for 1 or 2 players.

The game features four upgradable characters, each with different special powers. Five out of six double-sided location cards are selected at the beginning of each game to create a modular board (384 possible configurations). Players travel clockwise around the board, collecting different goods (represented by dice), delivering goods and making sacrifices at temples. Careful planning and interrupting your opponent's plans are the keys to victory.

Tenochtitlan was created for the 2018 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest on Board Game Geek.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: DINO Land
description:
DINO LAND is an exciting game for all family. It is an adventure, where every player is aiming to accompany his dinosaur from a little dinosaur (dino-baby), hatching from an egg, to the powerful adult dinosaur.
Players compete against each other for the best valleys with a meal; in fact a correct and high-caloric feeding is a basis for rapid growth of a little dinosaur.
The primary purpose will be to know, where necessary fruits and delicious grass grow, and to have time to regale oneself by meal rapidly than other animals.
If a dinosaur did not have time – it is necessary to wait, while a new grass will grow and other fruits will ripen.
A winner is considered a gamer, whose dinosaur will grow first to 60 dino-meters.
AWARDS
Winner of the "Baby Expo Ukraine 2019" (best family game)
Nominee of the ukrainian “Game of the Year 2019” (best ukrainian designer game)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Castle Siege Chess
description:
A two-player chess variant that is played on the CirSquare 96 (a unique circular board merged with a square board). The object of the game is the same as for traditional chess--checkmate the opponent's King.

The board (24"x24", double-sided, quad-fold, custom designed) has 96 spaces and divided into 2 castles of 24 spaces each and a battlefield of 4 rows with 12 spaces each. Numerous initial board setups are possible. Up to 4 additional or new power pieces can be used. The game comes with 2 new optional pieces--Archer and Catapult--which compliment the Knight, Bishop, and Rook.

All the traditional chess pieces move as they do in traditional chess. See the game rules for how the Archer and Catapult move. Castling works like it does in traditional chess only if the standard chess setup for the power pieces is used.

The board has 4 triangular spaces. When a Queen or Bishop moves into a triangle across a corner, it can exit across either of the other 2 corners. When a Queen or Rook moves into a triangle across a side, it can exit across either of the other 2 sides. Thus, the pieces gain an extra path (a 5th path) of coverage when they are aligned with a triangular space, which is often a great advantage, especially in the middle and end games.

—description from the publiser

This entry is 'level 2' of the games contained in Castle Strife Games. Each level is a game in its own right, but the earlier levels also serve to gradually introduce the rules of Castle Siege. This level is the most chess-like.

name: Dirty Drawers
description:
A Mature Drawing Game For Immature People

The Judge for the round flips a card from the first three stacks of cards to form a randomized scenario for the rest of the players to draw. Next, they roll the dice for the drawing/judging criteria listed on the "Judge Card".

Drawers draw the random scenario keeping in mind the criteria from the "Judge Card".

After drawing, each player reveals their drawing and competes for the Judge's vote.

The Judge selects a winning drawing based on the "Judge Card". The Drawer receives all cards used during the round. Each card is a point.

—description from the designer

name: Munchkin: Party Pack
description: Munchkin: Party Pack has 15 party-themed cards to add to your Munchkin games and three copies each of five new cards to give away as party favors.

name: Soldiers of God: Tabletop Wargames Rules for the Raids, Battles and Sieges of the Crusades
description:
Soldiers of God is a miniatures wargame about the crusades to the Holy Land: it always pits a Crusader army against a Saracen one.

The core of the game is in the action cards, the play of one allows the left, centre, or right of the army to carry out the action of the card, such as advancing or shooting. At the start of the game, each player choses three cards that they will have access to each turn; at the start of each turn they also draw four random ones so that they have a hand of seven. Accordingly, what an army can do will be strongly influenced by the initial plan as indicated by the chosen cards: if you chose a "attack on left" card, you'll always be able to do so, if not any such ambitions are at the mercy of card draw.

Combat resolution is more traditional: a unit in combat rolls one die per stand it consists of, needing a certain number to hit depending depending on weapons. Hits cause disorder unless negated by resolve saves, and a unit that takes more disorder than it has stands routs off the battlefield.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Siege of Izmail
description:
Siege of Izmail is a two-player game recreating the storming of the Ottoman fortress Izmail, situated on the Danube River, by Russian forces under the command of General Alexander Suvorov. This battle occurred on 22 December 1790.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Scarlet Monastery Dungeon Deck
description: Players can form a party of three to take on Scarlet Commander Mograine cooperatively. Unlike previous raid decks of World of Warcraft: Trading Card Game, you don't need a pilot for a Dungeon Deck, the deck plays itself by a built-in AI. You can also customize the Dungeon Deck for difficulty and your heroes will level up as you gain experience.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Pivot
description:
It's not enough to think for your opponent
In this game you BECOME your opponent!

Objective: Be the first to form a straight line of 4 pawn in a row (horizontal, vertical or diagonal) in your chosen color.

First, players choose either Red or White for their pawn color.
Each player gets 7 playing pieces , each consisting of a red pawn and a white pawn connected by an elastic band.
Taking turns, players add 1 playing piece to the board, and stretch the band accordingly. Note: Players place both their own color and that of their opponent in the same turn.
The first player to form a straight line of 4 pawns in his or her color wins the game!
All 14 playing pieces placed with no winner? Player then take turns moving their own pawns until someone wins!

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Lord Voldemort
description:
Lord Voldemort, (born as Tom Marvolo Riddle), or simply Voldemort was the most powerful Dark Wizard of all time and the Dark Lord of the Death Eaters; who aims to take over the wizarding world and shape it following his supremacist views. He made himself the archenemy of Harry Potter after trying to kill him as a baby, having learnt that he would grow into a threat.

This expansion set includes

Voldemort miniature
Rules sheets
6 Cards
Spells cards
1 Crucio
1 Imperio

Artifact card
1 Nagini
1 Elder wand


Events cards
2 A dark presence
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Heights of Alma
description:
Tom Russell's first published game was Blood in the Alma. That humble little magazine insert game, published in 2012, introduced concepts that over time gave birth to Hollandspiele's Blood in the Fog and, eventually, the Shot & Shell Battle Series. So it is perhaps fitting that seven years and nearly forty published designs later, Mr. Russell would turn his attention back to the topic that started it all, redesigned from the ground-up through the lens of the Shot & Shell system. The result is The Heights of Alma.

The heights overlooking the Alma River provided a natural defensive advantage for the Russians, who proceeded to utterly squander it with slapdash entrenchments and a left flank that was completely exposed. It didn't help that the commander of that left wing was several sheets to the wind. At least he was on the field; on the opposing side, British commander Lord Raglan snuck behind enemy lines for a better view of the battle without telling his subordinates, leaving his army without any orders. Frontal charges against the Russian heavy guns were as costly as they were pointless. Eventually, a group of men disobeyed orders, choosing to stand and fire instead - discovering, to their delight, that their new Minié rifles outranged the enemy artillery! They would have known that from the beginning if anyone had bothered to listen to their French allies - the only side to acquit themselves competently.

The historical scenario recreates this glorious mess of a battle. Three additional scenarios explore increasing levels of coordination and competence on either side. This game has more special rules than the previous Shot & Shell title (Seven Pines; or, Fair Oaks), resulting in a more complex and nuanced experience, but not so many rules that it bogs the thing down - a given scenario will still be resolved within a couple of hours.

name: Opération Archéo: Nouveaux Défis
description:
This is the first expansion for the boardgame "Opération Archéo".
More scenarios; more items to collect; more archaeologists to join the staff. New mechanisms increase the challenge of your researches!
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Prehistoric
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Monster in the Woods
description:
Monster in the Woods is a card game where 16 cards are placed face down, forming the woods. Player hand size is limited to 2. Players search the woods to find Mei card and Door card in order to escape. However, standing in their way are monster cards and other players.

—description from the designer

name: Postcard Galactic
description:
A tiny game of Galactic Intrigue. Postcard Galactic is an asymmetrical dice placement and resource management game for 2+ people.

The game involves the struggle for supremacy between several factions of the Galactic Empire as the seek to place their Scion on the Imperial throne.

Players can buy assets on the cards of other factions, giving them access to those faction's abilities, this makes the game quite a bit different depending on which factions are being played.

—description from the designer

name: Front Line No Komrades: Oxna Bears All
description:
Life at the front is a bleak and hollow reminder of what once was. The memory of home is all any Komrade can cherish while in the trenches. Their longing to return is what keeps Komrades marching steadily forward towards near-certain death. News from home is a much-needed respite for a Komrade’s spirits.

However, Oxna the Bear receives some rather grim tidings from home. Her success at the front has been costly for her family. The Party has ordered that more bears are needed at the front and can think of no better reinforcement than Oxna’s own cubs. Hoping she has bestowed some of her fighting strength to her offspring, the Hero Kommissar leading the Ursine Special Services Recruitment program, has recruited Oxna’s cubs to join the fight. Oxna is not going to let the horrors of battle reach her offspring. In this, our first expansion for Front Line No Komrades, OXNA BEARS ALL.

Oxna Bears All is a brilliant new expansion for the hit card game Front Line – No Komrades.

Oxna continues the fast-paced card game of survival, but offers new expansive play possibilities, including a cooperative campaign and alternative “missions” for the rag-tag group of conscripts.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Nudge
description:
An environmentally conscious abstract strategy game.
It’s an incredibly simple yet insanely addictive abstract strategy game, designed to send you or your opponent over the edge – three discs each, two moves per turn, one wrong move and it could be game over!
Flip a disc to decide who starts. Players then take it in turns to make two moves each turn.
Individual discs can move one square at a time or two squares with your two moves, either forwards, backwards or sideways and in any combination of these, but no disc can ever be moved diagonally.
Rows of linked discs can be moved together lengthways, like train carriages, one square at a time, which counts as one move, but you can’t move rows widthways.
To nudge an opponent’s disc, you have to out-number them lengthways – 2 against 1 and so on.
The game ends when you nudge an opponent’s disc off any edge of the board. It’s as simple as that. Then you rack it up and you play again

name: Pictomania (Second Edition): Promo cards – Boardgaming
description: 9 thematical cards with various difficulty from board gaming and board game design.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: The Poll: The Great Indian Election Game
description:
The Poll: The Great Indian Election Game, is a board game that simulates the Indian electoral system. It pushes people to take charge of the affairs of a political. In the game, players are made leaders political parties. They must draft a manifesto, in accordance with the problems of the constituencies, they must manage the resources such as workers and money and finally, decide the best campaign strategies that they can use to win the election.

The game carries on for five rounds in which the players play a total of 19 constituencies. Each constituency has an accurate set of issues based real world problems from all over the country.

—description from the designer

name: Ciné Défi
description:
Ciné Défi is a french quiz game. It is about cinema. You have to pick a card, roll the die, and pick the question which is attributed to your figure.

—user summary

name: Outburst!: Kartenset
description:
This is a card set of 300 new subjects as extension to the base game "Outburst!"
Focus: Communication; creativity & imagination

Es handelt sich um ein Kartenset mit 300 Oberbegriffen als Ergänzung zum Basisspiel "Outburst!".
Schwerpunkte: Kommunikation; Kreativität & Phantasie

name: GoYe
description:
Work with your friends to tell the world by spreading the gospel across a world map of 58 conferences and 10 divisions. Collect Total Member Involvement by investing your resources in mission trips, spiritual gifts, churches, and offices. Once every conference has a church, the second coming ends the game, and the player with the most TMI wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Zombie Commandos From Hell!: Extermination
description:
The year is 2143 A.D. and Gaia has finally had enough of the defiling human race. She has struck a deal with the Devil to exterminate them from the face of the Earth; allowing his legions of demons to possess the corpses of the deceased and raise them as zombies with full access to all of their memories and experience.

In this cooperative combat card game based on the comic series, players take command of the demonic zombie hordes of Hell. They collaboratively confer together, then take turns attacking the faction cards in play, intent on eventually eliminating humankind's last remaining strongholds. Meanwhile, the factions offer an ongoing resistance as they strive to establish their game ending survival conditions. Combat is quick, based on stats comparison, yet remains diverse from the wide range of abilities. Game flow is fast paced, yet decisions still have depth, including some deck building undertones. Pick up the game and gather your friends. Do you have what it takes to achieve Gaia's ambition?
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Zombies

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Gangs of House Delaque
description:
Necromunda: Gangs of House Delaque is a eight page supplement included in the December 2018 issue of White Dwarf.

Within are the rules for the just released Gang of House Delaque.

Since the rules for the Delaques were not published within a new Gang War supplement, as it usually happened with the previous gangs, but only within the Supplement Necromunda: Underhive – Gangs of The Underhive (a compilation of all the gang rules already appeared within previously published Gang War Supplements) this mini module was made avaialble for free for those who didn't want to buy a whole supplemet for just one gang.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Xenofera: Galactic Market
description:
Xenofera: Galactic Market is a strategic bidding game where 2-6 players compete to build the most magnificent collection of Xenofera. Players will need to balance bidding with acquiring resources to bid with as all bids are lost, regardless of who wins, at the end of each round. In addition, players can play special action cards that alter the bid or in other ways help them. Multiple play options and combinations of special action cards allow each game to be unique. Game play lasts between 25 and 30 rounds depending on the version of the game played.

Each round, you must choose between bidding on the present creature or gathering more resources, at the expense of forfeiting a bidding opportunity. This decision may give your competitors the chance to acquire valuable creatures. Adding to the excitement, special actions can be obtained with your additional resources, enhancing the strategic depth of the game.

To add a layer of strategy, collecting sets of Xenofera from the same planet makes your collection even more valuable. With careful planning, clever bidding, and strategic use of special actions, you might secure the galaxy's most coveted Xenofera collection.
When all cretures are acquired, the game ends and the player with the most valuable collection wins.

—description from the designer

name: Railways of Portugal: Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
Included as part of the Kickstarter for the base game. Adds several new types of cards to the event deck.

Contains:
2 x Government Subsidy
1 x State Treasury Shares (start card)
1 x Operations Growth
1 x Boomtown
2 x Express
2 x Civil Engineers
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: SSO:  The Rage of Montalbano
description:
This expansion for SSO includes additional crew members and ship locations along with a totally new 30 card mission representing the SSO being attacked by a deadly external threat, a second ship.

It includes a box sufficient to hold all the SSO expansions so far (and a few more in the future) sleeved, replacement and upgraded components for the base game and an extended and improved rule book.

SSO itself is a 1-6 player sci-fi survival horror game. Players must work together to survive and defeat the threat attacking the Space Ship Omega, but players win or lose as individuals. Once the threat to the ship has passed, it may be that not everyone can survive, if that happens your fellow crew may become your biggest threat.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Chaos Dice
description:
Nothing says Chaos like these random number generators (as long as you only need numbers from 1 to 6). These six attractive dice will add an extra dose of Chaos to any Munchkin game . . . and they come with four new Munchkin Warhammer 40,000 cards!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Phase Order

name: The Munchkin Book
description:
More fun than a Chainsaw of Bloody Dismemberment and more useful than a Chicken on Your Head, The Munchkin Book is a lighthearted and suitably snarky celebration of all things near and dear to the munchkin heart, featuring contributions from the game's designer, Steve Jackson, and its signature artist, John Kovalic, as well as notable mavens of geek culture, including:

Joseph Scrimshaw (comedian, Comedy of Doom)
John Wick (game designer, Houses of the Blooded)
Bonnie Burton (author, Girls Against Girls)
Dave Banks (Wired GeekDad)
Matt Forbeck (author, Dangerous Games)
Jennifer Steen (Jennisodes)
Rob Wieland (Onion AV Club)

The Munchkin Book also includes exclusive game rules to supplement reader gameplay, and an introduction by New York Times bestselling author and Forgotten Realms creator Ed Greenwood.

—description from the publisher

By gently—and sometimes not so gently—mocking the fantasy dungeon crawl and the sacred cows of pop culture, the Munchkin® card game has stabbed and sneaked and snickered its way to the pinnacle of success. Along the way, its sold millions of copies, been translated around the world, and spawned more than two-dozen sequels and supplements.

More fun than a Chainsaw of Bloody Dismemberment and more useful than a Chicken on Your Head, The Munchkin Book is a lighthearted and suitably snarky celebration of all things near and dear to the munchkin heart, featuring contributions from the game’s designer, Steve Jackson (president of Steve Jackson Games), and its signature artist, John Kovalic (creator of web comic Dork Tower), as well as notable mavens of geek culture.

The Munchkin Book also includes exclusive game rules to supplement reader gameplay.

Steve Jackson Games, based in Austin, Texas, has been publishing games, game books, and magazines since 1980. Its best-selling game is Munchkin, with well over 2 million copies of the games and supplements in print worldwide. Other top sellers are GURPS (the Generic Universal RolePlaying System), Zombie Dice, and Illuminati. Past hits have included Car Wars and Toon. Steve’s very first game, Ogre, recently drew almost a million dollars’ worth of Kickstarter support for a super-deluxe edition to be released in 2013.

—another description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: A Elegia do Pássaro da Morte
description:
A Elegia do Pássaro da Morte (The Elegy of the Bird of Death) is an eleven card microgame. 6 double-sided cards contain verses of a poem, 4 are identity cards, and the last one is the death card.

The verse cards are shuffled and laid out in a column, forming a poem. Each player receives a character card. The poem tells about the characters' death, and the goal of the game is to manipulate the poem and escape death 4 times.

Each character card shows four combinations of verse card symbols, one combinatino on each side. Whenever each of these appears in the poem, all turned to the red card side, the player has escaped once, and then they turn their character card by 90 degrees to achieve the next sequence.

On a turn, can do three actions: they may move one of the last two poem cards to the first position in the poem, or flip the first card of the poem to the other side (which results in certain other cards to be flipped as well), or escape death by having the three necessary cards flipped to the red side.

The first player to escape death four times is the winner - everybody else dies.

The game is based on the novel O Réquiem do Pássaro da Morte by Andrio Santos. Although the poem is in Portuguese, the game itself is language independent.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Chaotic Beasts
description:
The corrupting power of Chaos has fully defiled the Eightpoints over the course of centuries, transforming flora and fauna alike into unnatural, mutated abominations. Many of the beasts that make their lairs in the lands around the Varanspire are little more than frenzied monsters, but others possess an unsettling cunning, and will even follow a warband into battle in return for fresh meat or some other, darker incentive.

Harness the Chaotic Beasts of the Eightpoints with this Warcry expansion set. Inside, you’ll find a monstrous menagerie of Furies and Raptoryxes, allowing you to add a new level of challenge to your games. Alternatively, add them to your warband as thralls, or field them in your Warhammer Age of Sigmar army.

This set contains:
- 6 multipart plastic Raptoryx – brutal, frenzied avian predators
- 6 multipart plastic Furies – sinister lesser Daemons who are nigh-impossible to pin down
- 2 Chaotic Beasts Fighter Cards for keeping track of their characteristics
- A Chaotic Beasts abilities card, printed in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, that allows you to harness the distinct tactics of these monstrous inhabitants of the Eightpoints

This set is supplied with 6 x 32mm round bases, and 6 x 60mm oval bases.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Master of Wills: Overlord Game Variant
description:
The Overlord Master of Wills game variant is a mind-bending experience where the control of your fate no longer resides in your hands. This thrilling new experience forces all players into uncomfortable situations which require a different style of strategy to navigate. The Overlord has taken the City of Novus by storm… can you defeat your opponent while fending off this new unstoppable force?

The Overlord deck comes with 20 Overlord cards and 1 Help/Rule card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Competition between provinces
description:
Before the events of Who wants to be president? the country enjoyed a stable economic situation, so the president has promised a substantial contribution for the governor to carry out the best management in his province. To do this they will compete to show who is the best at administering their gobernor´policies.

The oldest player roll all the dice. Starting with him, and continuing with the rest of the players in a clockwise direction, he must choose one dice, withdraw it and write it down in whatever government policy you want. When the round is over, the player on your right roll all the dice again and the withdrawal and scoring operation es repeated.

Once all the throws per player have been completed, the game is over and the winner is the one with the most power.

—description from the designer

name: Merchant of Venus: The Variant Mini Expansion
description:
Merchant of Venus provides a nice, solid base upon which to build variants. In addition to providing a simple movement system for combining speed, navigation and carrying capacity, it provides a balanced economic model with which to play. These two aspects combine to be very handy when you're modelling such expensive pastimes as war, politics or civilization. During the development of Merchant of Venus many alternative rules were tried and discarded. The variant here presents some of the best of these alternate rules, and the counters to implement them.
These rules add quite a bit of versimilitude and fun to the game, but they also add some complexity, unbalance the play a bit, distract the players from the commercial aspects, and/or increase the playing time. That's why they weren't included in the original game. Generally, each variant rule can be used by itself, or it can be freely combined with the other rules.

The variant rules are:
- Fast Set-up: Shortens setup time by mixing in the bonus markers with the goods markers and placing them only on culture discovery, makes bonus markers appear more early.
- The Lost "?" Box: Make the asteroid in the Multi-Generations Ship a "?" box.

Variable Nova Balls: Change the firepower of Nova Balls according to blast attack rolls of the players.
Own Species Bonus: Allow multiple items to be traded in a city matching the players species.
Customized Spaceships: Ships work differently depending on the player species.
Haggling: Adds a bartering system depending on presence, availability and luck to trading of items.
Extra Forts: Additional fort markers for the merchants.
Agents, Bases & 2nd Ships: Rules for the new agent, base and 2nd ship counters
Mercenaries: Rules for the new mercenary markers.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nobody is Perfect: 390 neue Begriffe
description:
features the same game play as the original Nobody is Perfect – first released in 1996, then released in a new edition in 2009 – but with 390 new terms for players to puzzle over.

Game play is similar to Balderdash or the public domain "Dictionary" game with players being presented with an unusual word or image that they're unlikely to know. All players write down a definition for this word/image, then everyone votes on which definition they feel is the correct one. Vote correctly, and you score points; have others vote for your definition, and you'll score then, too.
categories: Bluffing, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Monte Cassino 1944
description:
The game covers three important battles of the Italian campaign. Allied landing near the port of Salerno, executed on 9 September 1943 under the codename “Avalanche”, was a part of the Allied invasion of Italy. The Italians withdrew from the war the day before the invasion, but the Allies landed in an area defended by the German troops that quickly started a number of counterattacks. The battle of Monte Cassino (17 January-18 May 1944) was a costly series of the four assaults by the Allies against the Winter Line. The capture of Monte Cassino resulted in 55,000 Allied casualties, with German losses estimated at around 20,000. In the battle of Ancona (16 June-18 July) Polish II Corps captured an important Italian port of Ancona. Game gives players a lot of units to command and shows all there battles in the detailed way, so players have a chance to change the course of any of these.

Monte Cassino 1944

System: Battles of the World War II (B-35)

Complexity: very high

Scale: battalion-company

Boards: 2x 50/70 cm, 1x 30/30 cm

Scenarios: 3

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: D100 Dungeon: Mapping Game – Add-On
description:
With the release of new products for D100 Dungeon, it has become important to update the mapping game with new tokens. This add-on provides these tokens, and also new rules for the additional material for D100 Dungeon that can be used with the mapping game.

Included are tokens for D100 Dungeon – The Dragon Armour – Adventure Book One, and D100 Dungeon – The Lost Tome of Extraordinary Rules, and more. You will also need the D100 Dungeon rule book and the Mapping Game in order to use this expansion.

name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Hunter Freebies
description: This Kickstarter Exclusive box contains stretch goals and free expansions unlocked during the campaign. This includes: 11 exclusive heroes, alternate sculpts, 3 elder vampires, extra core enemies, more cards, The swarms expansion, grelrok expansion, and 3D terrain.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Space Marines
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Lilypads
description:
Lilypads is a solo / 2-player cooperative puzzle game in which the players aim to complete as many objectives as they can before the end of the game.

--

The aim of the game is to complete objectives and earn as many points as possible. Setup the game by selecting 9 of the 15 Lilypad cards and arrange them in a 3×3 grid. Place the Frog on the bottom left card. Shuffle the objectives and set the top one aside so you can see the current objective and the next objective.

On a player's turn they must move their player pawn to a different Lilypad card and then may choose to use the action on that card. Then check to see if the current objective is complete. If yes, place it in front of you and draw the next objective card then move the frog onwards one step in the grid. If no, just move the frog onwards.

The game ends once the frog has moved up the grid (from left to right and bottom to top) and then reversed her journey back to the starting card in the bottom left. Add up the victory points on completed objectives and see how well you did!

-description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Party & Co: Extreme 2.0
description:
From the same family of Party & Co, Party & Co Extreme is made out of 4 different categories of games: 'Quiz & Co, 'Psyco & Co', 'Show & Co' and 'Art & Co'. Each category have different card games including some like Pictionary, Taboo, Trivial-Pursuit...

People have to compete with each other in teams until they fill out his objective card (a number of games won).

The game includes:
800 cards with different games (200 of each category).
48 'peanuts' (12 of each color)
A pair of party glasses (blind-drawing game) with a color pencil
2 pencils and 2 block notes
1 'flexispaghetti' (shape game)
10 objective cards
1 die and a instructions booklet
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Singing

name: Gardeno
description:
Don't listen to what they say, farming is still fun! Grab some seedlings, hoe, and watering can and try to grow some vegetables during your first year in this hobby full of dirt, effort, and satisfaction!

A co-winner in design category of 1-card Print and Play Contest 2020 packs an action selection mechanics and a bit of dice-rolling right into this compact package.

The game runs through 3 seasons and each season consists out of 6 turns. Each turn roll a die, place in on available spaces and choose one of four actions available. Raise the vegetable dice, eliminate the dice representing costs of farming, and earn the most points.

Players try to beat their best score. On the back of the card there is a scoring table the player can compare their achieved score with.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Into the Outside: Prelude
description:
You and two of your close friends are lost in nightmarish woods. You don’t remember how you got here… You will have to survive and desperately search for a way out. All whilst trying to avoid the numerous horrors that lurk in this never ending forest.

Into the Outside: Prelude is a Roll & Write mashed with a Choose Your Own Path story. Push your luck scavenging for food and wood to meet your survival needs. All whilst risking encountering the numerous monstrosities that hunt in these dark woods! Manage your camp, craft items, and level up skills to aid you in the Outside. Then with all your skills and tools at your side, Roll & Write your way through each scenario campaign’s branching narrative, culminating in one of various endings!

Into the Outside: Prelude contains one storybook scenario. This scenario comprises a 3 game campaign and variant for playing.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Horror, Novel-based, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Luna Mare: Mineralis & Dominatio
description:
OVERVIEWThe lunar Mare, plural Maria, are large, flat and dark basaltic plains of lower elevation on the Earth's Moon formed by ancient volcanic eruptions. The term Mare, which in Latin means "sea" was erroneously applied to such features by telescopic observers of the 17th century who mistook them for actual seas. In actuality, Maria are huge basins containing lava flows marked by craters, ridges, faults, straight and meandering valleys called rilles and are devoid of water. Maria are the largest topographic, dark and relatively young features on the Moon. Together with the bright, heavily cratered and very old lunar Highlands (Latin: Terrae), they form the landscape of the Moon. Maria are less reflective than the Terrae and can be seen from Earth with the naked eye. Back in the days, the Apollo program, led by NASA, brought back many samples of lunar rock and soil material. It proved that among other minerals and elements, Maria are to be rich in Iron, Titanium, Magnesium and Silicon. Even three new minerals were discovered on the Moon and named Armalcolite, Tranquillityite and Pyroxferroite. Since then, besides being a research object, the Moon becomes increasingly, a point of interest to many of Earth's public and private companies, which perceive it as their next source for acquiring and extracting resources in the future ...

... in Luna Mare: Mineralis & Dominatio game, players compete in collecting elements discovered on the surface of the Moon with aim to discover additional, valuable, new resources and minerals. In addition to gathering resources they also fight for control over Maria to establish a rewarding Moon dominance.

Gameplay introduces and smoothly combines 2 core mechanics of pick up & deliver and area control in a single game. Together with light combat, score rivalry, units and cards management or team play, it provides a deep, tactical experience.

2 to 3 players may compete with each other in multiplayer games. Also, 4 players may play the game by being divided into 2 teams of 2 players. Playing cooperatively team members compete with the opposite team.

The game is based on a strong, realistic theme. Included map represents quite real boundaries of the lunar Maria seen from the Earth, as well as the Apollo landing positions. Also elements and minerals with their names, amount and composition are based on real discoveries, research and available publications.



TWO GAMES IN ONELuna Mare: Mineralis & Dominatio is a single board game that consists of 2 separate gameplay modes and experiences - Mineralis and Dominatio.

Although sharing the same goal concept, each gameplay mode offers different mechanics ratios and ways of playing the game, forcing players to adapt their skills and tactics. Mineralis focuses more on a pick up & deliver mechanics with a support of an area control. While Dominatio strongly prefers an area control with a complementary assistance of a pick up & deliver.

Besides using the same, basic gameplay mechanics and components, both modes also introduce their own, unique features. Mineralis has its element delivery and new resource discoveries. Dominatio, on the other hand, provides a constant fight for domination over the most valuable regions and elements.

Each mode comes with a dedicated map, rulebook and a few additional, individual components. They may be easily treated as a standalone, full-featured games.

Choose the way of playing and dominate the resources and surface of the Moon!




Check the forum thread for game presentation and all official resources/files/links
[OFFICIAL] - Game presentation + PnP files + Links + WIP Thread + Digital versions


2021 Two Player Print and Play Game Design Contest - achievements

BEST GAME: 1st place!
Best gamer's game: 1st place!
Best game to play remotely: 1st place!
Best mechanics: 1st place!
Best rule book: 5th place!
Best art/graphic design: 1st place!
Best use of theme: 1st place!
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Mocarstwa: Wydanie II Rozszerzone
description:
Mocarstwa is a strategic game with elements of the economy, the action of which takes place in 18th-century Europe.

It introduces us to the political and economic realities of that period, allowing us to play the role of the ruler of one of the nine powers: Poland, France, Spain, Hungary, Germany, Great Britain, Sweden, Russia or the Ottoman Empire.

The player can command an army, develop his empire and conduct political negotiations with other players. The goal is to gain control over most of Europe.

This second extended edition adds:

new game mechanics based on Combat Cards eliminate the randomness of the game and significantly accelerate its course
new scenarios, also in solo mode
Power Cards that give each ruler individual options
additional types of troops
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Negotiation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hitting Home: Axis Raids on the Soo Locks, 1942 &1945
description:
It is not beyond the ingenuity of Hitler’s military schemers to carry bombing planes in sections across the Atlantic by submarine and slip them through the slim cordons of the naval patrols in to the Hudson Bay area. There, on some lonely island, safe from the eyes of all except an occasional Indian, those planes could be assembled and made ready for an attack on the Soo ship canal. —— Lieutenant Colonel Harold A. Furlong, February 1942.

Hitting Home is an introductory level game about Axis raids on the Soo Locks during WWII. The Soo Locks were a crucial choke point for the shipment of all of the iron ore used by US and Canadian steel mills. Air raids by German and Japanese aircraft were planned by all sides.

Although never carried out, strikes against this crucial Home Front installation could have had a profound impact on the war’s outcome. Hitting Home allows players to explore the “what if” of German or Japanese attacks against the Soo Locks.

The 1942 scenario portrays a German attack using disguised merchant ships to transport Heinkel (He) 115 and 114 floatplane bombers to Hudson Bay. There the aircraft would have been unloaded, armed and taken off to attack the Soo Locks about 600 miles to the south and west. Since the range of the He-114 aircraft would be insufficient for the planes to make a return trip back to the transports, it is assumed the planes would have landed in a lake on the return leg and been picked up by the larger He-115 or other floatplanes designated for search and rescue.

The 1945 scenario portrays an attack launched from two Japanese I-400 attack submarines. These massive submarines carried three Aichi M6A bombers in hangers. The bombers were launched from a catapult that ran along the top of the ship’s bow. It is assumed 4 of these bombers would be used in the attack (based on the presumption that it would be very remarkable for all 3 of a submarine’s aircraft to be operational at the same time).

—based on description from the publisher

name: Icetoids
description:
Be the first to position your 3 pieces on the 3 tiles that display the icon of your color. 16 tiles.

Players launch their pyramids from an edge base, can move 1, or can move in the direction of an arrow on a tile. You may also be able to push another player's piece.

name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Companion App Pack #03: Rotten Wounds
description:
This is the last of the three packs with the zombies in it! You can use this pack when playing any existing scenario.

At the begining you've noticed the smell... Like the Island itself has already gave up to the infection. Trees began to drop already spoilt Fruits... Then the limbs themself started to fall off, one after another. And the worst part was when you injured yourself. Even though you did spill plenty of fresh water across the wound, it began to rot! Not to mention the unimaginable pain, it also lured these rabid mutated beasts towards you! Will you succumb to their fate?

This pack has zombies in it! You can use this pack when playing any existing scenario.

A physical deck of 75 Adventure and 35 Event cards which will be available also in the companion app.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Novel-based, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Catholic Card Game: NFP Expansion
description:
A 54 card expansion made in collaboration with Simcha Fisher!

This expansion pack is recommended for adults only. Being all about Natural Family Planning, the cards in this deck were written for adults who enjoy marital intimacy jokes and the wonders and headaches of NFP :)

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Religious

name: Arcadia Quest: Pluck
description:
When he was seven years old, Pluck managed not to die. Which was, in fact, incredible considering his burgeoning affinity with fire magic, and his rather excitable pyromaniacal nature. In fact, if his parents hadn’t been wealthy enough for a cinder-stone house, they likely would’ve all perished within the year. While it seemed Pluck was on the fast-track to a University scholarship, he never exhibited much desire to learn more magic than it took to create a small open flame. He greatly preferred watching things burn, and experimented at length, noting particularly the flammability of certain mixtures and chemicals. Now he works as a loyal and happy Guildsman, so long as he’s allowed some leeway with regard to collateral damage.

Promotional character for Arcadia Quest.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk card update pack
description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of maps for Free People players.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Possessed
description:
In the early 1900s, an old house forgotten for 20 years has been discovered by a group of supernatural investigators. Following rumors of the haunting, they come to the house and begin to explore. As the daylight fades they make for the exit, but they are locked in! What’s more, an evil spirit has possessed one of them, but no one knows who. Desperately, they scramble to uncover the secret of the house before time runs out, wary all the while that they can trust no one. Welcome to Possessed, a fast-paced game of exploration, supernatural forces, and treachery. Can you survive the night?

Players take turns drawing cards from the house deck, representing the rooms they are searching. Clue cards will be claimed as points at the end of the game, and you may trade these with other players to make sets worth additional points. However, should you draw too many Ghosts or Despair in one round, you risk losing those points. You must decide whether to hide from the Ghosts and drop out of the round, or push your luck and risk losing it all.

At some point in the game, the Possessed will reveal who they are. From now on they will attempt to thwart the investigators using the cards they have accumulated throughout the game. Can the investigators collect enough clues before three rounds are up? Or will they be overwhelmed by the Possessed and the terrors of the haunted mansion?
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Traitor Game

name: A Tale of Bravery
description:
A story driven adventure game for 1 to 4 players set in fantasy Britain some 20 years after the death of King Arthur Pendragon.

Each separate game session, or “quest” as it is called in the game, takes about 1 hour to play. Each quest can be won, lost, or even forfeited. The game is over when you have played through all quests listed in a separate questbook.

Each one of the players controls a “hero”. There are four heroes to the so called “party”. The players win the game if they manage to complete the goals of all the quests of the game.

The players will take turns reading aloud from the questbook. At regular intervals the players are allowed to make decisions on where to go and what to do. This affects the outcome of the game session. Whenever a fight occurs, it is played out on a game board made of separate modular tiles. The combat system is quick and focused on tactics and using the hero’s abilities to survive.

During the course of the game the players will be able to improve their heroes abilities, and also her equipment and retinue.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Origins: First Builders – The Voice
description:
The Voice is a small-module expansion for Origins: First Builders. During setup, a random Voice card is chosen to be used in the game. This Voice card gives special powers to the weaker (and therefore often less desirable) Speaker dice.

When taking a Speaker die of value 2 or 3, you may immediately receive the associated benefit depicted on the Voice card before placing the Speaker die in your player area.

This gives the players a few additional things to consider when competing for Speaker dice.

name: Microcity: Microville expansion
description:
Postcard with map on one side, rules on the other including goal, set up and gameplay.

The card substitutes instead of a building card from base game. You use teh Microville card instead the regular/challenge building. You have to prepare the 4-card city as usual and put Microville next to it. You don't go to Microville with your Engineer, you build Microville with your regular build action. You score points for what you've built and for the sets of 3.

name: Tech City: City of Cards
description:
Tech City is a multi-player, semi-cooperative city building game for 1-6 players. The cards are tiles that are modular representing companies. Card game effects become available as the city expands. Service companies require multiple players to cooperate to jointly build. Each round players add companies to Tech City and players individually score points as they build companies based on pattern matching and board state. 

The Tech Deck is a modern deck of cards bringing playing cards into the 21st century. It is a game platform designed to support many different games. Each card in the Tech Deck has unique game effects to create unique game experiences. Also, see Tech Grid Poker. Cards represent companies in Tech City each with special effects that players can use.

Each round, players get to play a card representing a company to build up Tech City. They score points based on matching cards they play and the board state. Players then get to use effects on any card in Tech City to make each game experience unique and fun.

The game ends after 6 rounds of play. The player(s) with the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Matching, Pattern Building, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: AdvanceQuest: Chaos in the Chasm
description:
A missing ambassador. A lost treaty. A strange asteroid. A deadly monster. You'll lead a team of gryphon raiders to investigate all of this (and more) in Chaos in the Chasm.

AdvanceQuest is a compact adventure system. Generate a character with any traits you want, and advance your way through the story, rolling dice against challenges and trying to reach the end.

A new chapter in the AdvanceQuest story is coming.

Using a clever new exploration mechanic, each foray into the story will offer different challenges using a simple combination of two elements. Select two of your own traits and roll off against the two story elements, and see if you can beat the dangerous situation. If you roll well, you survive to continue on. If you fail, you will take damage. But don't despair – you can spend Stamina to re-roll dice before you apply their effects! If you can make it through the story, you win! Your score is how many treasures you manage to collect along the way – see if you can beat your high score by playing again!

—description from the publisher


A solo micro-game designed by C.C. Chamberlin, based on Dungeon Hero. Create a hero using eight defining characteristics, like Archer of the Realm or Chainmail or Stealthy. Assign them dice ranging from d12 to d6. Note your Health and Stamina levels, and then start the adventure.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Just One: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A pack of 5 new words for Just One, chosen by Dice Tower fans!

name: Sly Foxes
description:
Sly Foxes is a super fun and highly strategic card game in which you have to outsmart the other players… ughm… I mean foxes! You can do that with the help of a hedgehog hug, nosy weasels, pouring vodka instead of water, giving long-forgotten cookies and many more! We don't have unicorns, explosions or kittens, but if you're into foxes, turtles, NINJA-DEER, rabbits, squirrels and other cute animals, then try this game!

The cards get separated into 2 decks - attack and defence cards. There are special cards too, like ‘I don't care’ which protects you against attacks and nosey weasels, who in turn interfere during other players' turns. In the beginning each player has 3 lives, gets 3 cards from each deck and a secret character that helps them in certain situations.

When it's your turn you either draw a card or attack a player of your choice. The player who eliminates everyone else wins the game and gets proclaimed the slyest fox in the woods. You can also play the game in teams and this makes it even more fun!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Mathemagical World
description:
Mathemagical World is an exciting math board game for kids ages 5+ (but can be used by kids across all ages). It takes just seconds to master and can be played from minutes to hours! The best part of our game is that children will not even realize they are learning math as they get immersed in our beautiful world filled with 8 unique islands: Desert Island, Dinosaur Island, Pirate Island, Zombie Island, Unicorn Island, Ice Island, Dragon Island, and Ninja Island!

Practice & Play: Addition and subtraction; Double and half concepts; Includes options for speed and difficulty; Includes options to count use numbered dice or dice with pips

Players take turns rolling the numbered dice with operation die to create a math equation. Solve the equation by adding or subtracting and move the number of spaces to match the answer. Watch out for "Special Spaces" which make the game exciting and fun for the kids!

You can also customize the difficulty:
-The green dice are numbered 1-6 and used for the easiest mode. You will be doing adding within 12 and subtraction within 6.
-The hardest mode uses the red dice which are numbered 1-10. You will be doing addition within 20 and subtraction within 10.

First player to reach the finish line wins.

name: Bridge City Poker: Kickstarter Exclusive Cards
description:
These were 2 cards given exclusively to backers during the Bridge City Poker Kickstarter Campaign. The Creators have said they may be made available again at future Game Conventions they attend or during other promotions as free giveaways. However, they will never be available for purchase.

Cards included:


Level Up
Kick Start
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Melding and Splaying, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking, Variable Set-up

name: Magic: The Gathering — Commander 2021: Strixhaven Commander — Prismari Performance Deck
description:
This preconstructed commander deck is part of the Commander 2021 set. It is a blue-red deck with an instants and sorceries theme, featuring Zaffai, Thunder Conductor as the face commander. Each of the five Commander 2021 decks ties into one of the five colleges featured in Strixhaven: School of Mages; "Prismari Performance" is based on Prismari College.

This deck contains 100 cards, 10 double-sided tokens, 1 display commander, 1 life wheel, and 1 cardstock deck box.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Last Chronicle Infinity
description:
A non-collectible card game depends on the background of Japanese collectible card game——Last Chronicle.

The games use picture from the old version Last Chronicle, but the mechanism is different from it. The mechanism is like Epic Card Game. Each player can use one 1-cost card and any number of 0-cost card each turn. The player who make his/her opponent's lifepoint to 0 will win the game.

A unique system of the game is the time-check system. Each turn the player will reveal a card from the deck to do a time-check. This player card use the card's time-check effect and use it as a special resource to play cards later.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: X-Men: Mutant Insurrection – Domino
description: Following the announcement of X-Men: Mutant Insurrection last summer, the votes were cast to introduce a new hero to the dice-driven card game. It is that time to release the winner! The winner of the poll was the ever-popular probability manipulator, Domino. With luck on her side and a whole lot of firepower, Domino is a powerful addition to any team in X-Men: Mutant Insurrection. Domino is a free print-and-play that is available on Fantasy Flight's website.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Battle of Pensacola Game
description: The Battle of Pensacola game is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the Spanish and French attack on British held Pensacola in 1781 during the American Revolutionary War. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Spanish and French forces and the other player commands the British forces.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: X MAS: Uomini Gamma Contro Gibilterra
description:
"X MAS: Uomini Gamma Contro Gibilterra" is a Solitaire wargame on the attacks performed in 1942 by the Italian Xª [10th] MAS Flotilla against the Royal Navy base in Gibraltar.
The game is freely inspired by the "278th Squadron" wargame of the designer Marco Campari.

Parabellum magazine X, Spring 2022

name: Dingsi: die wilde Zahlenpyramyde
description:
The aim of the wild number pyramid "Dingsi" is to reach as many and high rows of numbers as possible by swapping and using drawn cards. By trying to get a row with the same number you need skill and tactics. The signal word "Dingsi" should used in a targeted manner to prevent other players to get points.

—description from the publisher

Dingsi die wilde Zahlenpyramide ist ein Kartenspiel der etwas anderen Art. Das Ziel bei der wilden Zahlenpyramide "Dingsi" ist das Erreichen möglichst vieler und hoher Zahlenreihen durch das Tauschen und Einsetzen gezogener Karten. Beim Versuch, eine Reihe mit der gleichen Zahl zu erreichen, ist vor allem Geschick und Taktik gefragt. Dabei sollte auch das Signalwort "Dingsi" gezielt eingesetzt werden, um das Punkten der Mitspieler zu verhindern

—description from the publisher (German)

name: BARABAR
description:
Do you want to save the world with the help of a colorful mix of characters from the past and the present? Do you want to have fun creating stories while learning about human rights? Then BARABAR is the game for you!

In BARABAR, the players will have to collaborate with each other and play with characters of important people who have achieved great things for mankind. They belong to 5 clans: activists, environmentalists, artists, ecologists, and entrepreneurs. You will have to create stories on how these characters will help to solve challenges, some of them real or some of them more science fiction. Have you ever thought how Martin Luther King could help in a zombie apocalypse?

BARABAR is both competitive and collaborative, as well as educational. It can be played in a variety of different ways depending on how you want to do it.
Some of the rules make the game more didactic while others make it more competitive.
It is ideal to play with friends, ideally from 2 to 6 players. The game usually takes from 20 minutes to 1 hours.

—description from the publisher

name: Narvik 1940
description:
Narvik 1940 is a two-player wargame of low to intermediate complexity that simulates the battles around Narvik, Norway in 1940. To control complexity and present an overall force commander’s view of the battle, the game uses a tactically scaled map and units of maneuver coupled with an operationally scaled turn length. The Allied player is normally on the offensive, trying to clear the Germans from the Narvik area, but the German player has opportunities for counterattacks. The game starts in mid-April, after the Germans seized control of Narvik and just as the Allies have made their initial landings to begin their counteroffensive. Narvik models a battle fought in Arctic conditions with extremes of weather and long daylight hours. There was a chaotic command system on the Allied side and an overextended force on the German.

Each hex on the map represents 1.5 miles or 2.4km. Each game turn represents one week. Units of maneuver are platoons to battalions representing from 50 to 1000 men. Air units represent a variable number of sorties.

—description from the publisher

name: Rising Storm: The Starborne
description:
A Sci-Fi themed card game. Points are earned by winning challenges, capturing enemy cards, and earning credits. Governments use military and civilian abilities to achieve their objectives. This game features a "hand-building" mechanic. Draft cards into your hand (not into a discard pile) at the beginning of each round; unused cards are rolled over to the next two rounds.

Players will play four cards per challenge (trick). The most powerful card will win the hand, but there are exceptions. Military can combine power, diplomats prevent military from winning, cards can be captured or eliminated. Assassins, Diplomats, Mechs, Merchants, Emissaries, Sappers and Spies are just some cards you will encounter. A complete game consists of 3 challenges.

—description from the publisher

name: Dice Treasure
description:
Legends say that at the end of every rainbow lays a pot of gold guarded by the mischievous mythical creature, the Leprechaun. In Dice Treasure players must carefully match the colors and values of their cards to invoke the seven colors of the rainbow and steal the Leprechaun’s treasure.

Over multiple rounds, players take turns rolling dice from the bag and placing them on their cards looking to fill the patterns and collect gold coins. As the turns (composing a round) progress, the dice count decreases by one die and when the second-to-last turn starts, players incomplete cards will be available for opponents to fill and collect too and dice from the reserve and the common pool will become very useful.

At the end of the game, players add the gold collected from their pattern cards plus the color tokens and public objective cards earned to find out who is the best treasure hunter.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Sláine: Kiss My Axe! Starter Set
description:
Sláine: Kiss My Axe! is a skirmish tabletop miniatures battle game for two or more players set in the fantasy world created by the legendary comic creators Pat Mills and Angela Kincaid. Axes and swords clash whilst Earth and Sour magic lash out across the Land of the Young, as the Earth Tribes of the goddess Danu battle the decaying Drune Lords and the relentless Fomorian Sea Demons.

In Sláine, players take control of a small band of Earth Tribe, Drune, or Fomorian warriors as they fight for glory and survival in the mist-shrouded lands of Tir Nan Og and beyond. This starter set contains scenery, tokens, cards and all the rules you need to play, including scenarios, advanced rules and profile lists to create your warbands such as the heroes of the Earth Tribes and Drune Lords included in this set and much more...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Autobahn: Mini Expansions
description:
The Road Traffic, Upgraded Service Stations, and Wine Import Mini Expansions are included in the deluxe edition of Autobahn, or available to purchase separately to add to the base game.

Road Traffic adds 12 Traffic meeples that block roads into growing cities. Upgrade the roads to clear the traffic and earn promotions.

Upgraded Service Stations provide more opportunities to use Service Station Actions, racing for additional bonuses on a shared board by building upgrades to your Service Station Network.

Wine Imports reverses the direction of transport. Ship wine from neighbouring countries into Berlin to earn promotions.

-description from publisher

name: Minerały: Promo 4 – Serce (Turmalin arbuzowy)
description:
This expansion adds 1 tile – Heart (watermelon tourmaline). When you have a Heart tile and give it to the opponent on your left, you can move your pawn to any unoccupied Mineral and excavate the Mineral where your pawn was. At the end of the game the Heart (watermelon tourmaline) is worth 3 pts.

The expansion was given to blood donors during event "Planszówki w Spodku 2022", Katowice, Poland.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Neighbor Scope, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Slip Stream
description:
Slipstream is a two-player abstract racing game.

Both players run four near-future machines, accumulate points obtained by being the first to pass some of the seven checkpoints and the first-come-first-served goal, and hope that their team will get more than half of all points.

The only random element is creating the race course. Players alternate moving their machines. The course has oval and circle spots. Machines must stop on oval spots but may continue through circles. Players should take advantage of slip streaming behind vehicles in the lead as it allows passing through oval spots.

name: Spartacus: A Game of Blood and Treachery – Arena Legends
description:
Originally available in pack C of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

These promos are for use with 2nd edition of the game

Ragnagild
- 4 Attack
- 2 Defense
- 5 Speed
- Cost 5
- Deft: Opponent's Weapon Card is negated when fighting Ragnagild

Jugurthas
- 5 Attack
- 3 Defense
- 4 Speed
- Cost 5
- Intimidating: When rolling Initiative, Jugurtha's opponent subtracts 4 from their Initiative total

Scathach
- 4 Attack
- 5 Defense
- 3 Speed
- Cost 5
- Breaker: Opponent's Armour Card is negated when fighting Scathach

Acerbitas
- 5 Attack
- 4 Defense
- 3 Speed
- Cost 5
- Punishing: When attacking, "6"s win ties

Zephyros
- 3 Attack
- 5 Defense
- 3 Speed
- Cost 5
- Retaliation: When defending, DEF "6"s each deal one auto-wound

name: Castle Up
description:
CastleUp is a competitive card game for 2-4 players set in the bustling era of the middle ages. Each player embarks on an ambitious journey to establish and grow their own city, vying for influence and supremacy in a world where strategy and cunning are key. The game intricately blends elements of moderate complexity strategy with engaging mechanics of deck building and tableau building.

In CastleUp, every card action is a strategic choice, revealing layers of depth as players carefully construct their city. The game features innovative mechanics, such as cards that turn when damaged, maintaining full visibility to all players and adding a layer of tactical foresight. Resource management plays a crucial role, as players must judiciously allocate their assets to outmaneuver their rivals.

Designed for competitive players, CastleUp eschews the randomness of dice, focusing instead on skillful planning and execution. As the game progresses through multiple rounds, players take consecutive turns, each action building upon the last towards an intricate web of potential victory. The game concludes when the drawing deck is depleted, with the player amassing the most victory points declared the winner. This title not only challenges the strategic acumen of its players but also invites them to immerse themselves in a richly crafted medieval experience.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deck Construction, Investment, Market

name: Bitoku: Promo 4 – Quetzalcoatl Promo Card
description:
Quetzalcoatl is a promo Bitoku (Meijo) card. It was first available during the convention Mega XP 2022.

This is a unique spirit - only one copy is in the deck. When you reach this card in your Bitoku path, you are awarded with two victory points and the option to obtain a crystal.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Pet Adoption Agency
description: Players match pets with owners to adopt them.
