Main combat units are infantry, artillery, and armor battalions. Supporting arms such as recon, anti-tank, anti-aircraft, military intelligence, and engineers are built as companies. Players are able to provide Close Air Support to aid the ground pounders and leaders like General Model even play a part in providing your troops with their best chance of success.

Game Scale:

Game Turn: 2-4 hours
Hex: 1.24 miles / 2.0 kilometers
Units: Company to Battalion


Game Inventory:

Four 11 x 17" full color mapsheets
One dual-side printed countersheet (216 1/2" counters)
One 26-page Guderian Crosses the Desna rulebook
Three scenario setup charts
Nine Player Aid Cards
Two 10-sided dice
One 6-sided die


Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15 hours

(from publsher's website, box and user's desciption)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Darkfast Dungeons
description:
Darkfast Dungeons is a print and play tabletop game designed to provide a robust dungeon crawl experience in a couple of hours. A typical dungeon crawl will last 2-3 hours and provide a unique adventure with each game played.

There are many ways to play Darkfast Dungeons with rules and scenarios for co-operative games, competitive games and solo play.

The Darkfast Dungeons basic set includes 6 heroes, 12 monsters, a full set of game cards, rulebook and 26 customizable 2d tiles.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring Deck-Building Game – Merry & Pippin Promos
description:
Set of 2 extra cards for Cryptozoic's The Lord of the Ring: The Fellowship of the Ring Deck-Building Game.

- Merry & Pippin: A playable over-sized hero card. Card text: "Hobbit Heroes / You start the game with 'Second Breakfast' in your deck."

- Second Breakfast: 10th card for starter deck for a player with 'Merry & Pippin' as their hero. Card text: "Maneuver / If you have already bought or gained a card this turn, +3 Power. Otherwise, +1 Power."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Fierce fight! Smolensk Blitzkrieg
description:
The Fierce fight! Barbarossa series tries to portray the Barbarossa campaign with the popular Series: Fierce fight! system.

This is second game of Fierce fight! Barbarossa series.
Rules to link with Fierce fight! Leningrad Blitzkrieg are included.

This game focuses on Army Group Centre's operations. The Axis player needs to defeat the Soviet armies in Belarus and occupy Smolensk.

Time scale: 10 days per turn
Unit scale: Division
Counter: 252
Map: 1 A1 size
Duration: 1941 Jun-Sep

name: Shootin' Blanks
description:
Shootin' Blanks is an easy to learn (less than 5 minutes) 2-8 player elimination card game that fits right in your pocket. Compete for fun, drinks, money or anything you want!

Each player begins the game with three lives. Use poker chips, pennies, dollars, pieces of paper, beers, etc. Be creative.

Deal three cards to each player (one at a time). Place the rest of the deck in the middle of the table to draw from throughout the game. Turn the top card of the draw pile over to begin the discard pile.

The player to the left of the dealer can draw the top card from the draw pile or the discard pile and then must discard a card on top of the discard pile. Continue clockwise around the table.

Players try to collect the highest possible hand value in the same color OR in the same number.

Play continues clockwise until a player bangs or the draw pile is exhausted. Players cannot bang on their first turn.

When a player believes their hand is better than at least one other players hand, they bang on the table (or say bang) during their turn instead of drawing and discarding.

All other players get to draw and discard one more time.

At the end of the round, players show and announce their hand value (only adding cards of the same color OR the same number, not both).
The player(s) with the worst hand lose one life.
When a player loses all three lives, they are eliminated from the game. The last person with a life wins.

If a player at any time during the game has three blank cards in their hand, they throw down their cards and yell "I'm Shootin’ Blanks!" The round ends and all other players lose one life. Blanks are worth 0.

If a High/Low card is ever face up in the discard pile prior to a player banging, the scoring for the round changes from high to low. You still calculate your high hand, but instead the player with the highest hand value loses a life (ties work the same way for low hand rounds). It is possible to switch from High to Low back to High back to Low in a single round. High/Low cards are worth 0 and can never be drawn from the discard pile.

Wild cards can be any color and any number 1 through 8. They cannot be Blanks or High/Low cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Math, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Trickster: Starship
description:
Trickster is a fun and easy-to-learn card game for 3-7 players, lasting about 15 minutes. Each Trickster set features its own heroes and new ways to play. Find the set that’s right for you... or mix together characters from different sets to customize your own game!

A Trickster set has 49 cards with seven heroes, each with their own simple effect on play. A hero appears in seven different suits, each a color of the rainbow: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violet. Each hero and suit combination appears once in a set.

The first player of each round may play any card from her hand. The second player in the round is called The Trickster, who may also pay any card from her hand. Any subsequent player that round must play a card that follows the pattern set by the Trickster. (If the first two cards are Yellow, then everyone must play a Yellow card.)

If you cannot follow the pattern, you must collect cards played this round into your personal scoring area. If everyone was able to play one card, then the Trickster collects the cards.

The goal of Trickster is to have the fewest cards by the time any player has emptied her hand. Whoever has the fewest cards is the winner... with one exception! If you have more cards of a suit than any other player, you may ignore those cards when scoring.

name: Ultra Coins
description:
Ultra Coins is a collectible coin game that uses solid brass coins to represent a player's army that is comprised of characters from fantasy, science fiction, and horror. A coin can represent a force of soldiers or a powerful individual. Some coins are more powerful than others and all coins have different special abilities.

Each coin is 2 inches in diameter. The front of a coin has the artwork representing the character. On the outer perimeter are numbers that represent the character's attack and defense values. The inner ring contains the character's name, rank, and special abilities.

The back of the coin has a tip which allows the coin to spin. The coin can spin on a game mat, notebook, table, etc.

The spinning of the coin represents the random element of an attack or defense. After the coin is spinning, a players stops it with their finger and uses the number next to their finger.

There is no game board, no dice, and no markers. The only thing you need are the coins. The game is modular which allows players to battle with only a few coins. They can expand the battles as they collect additional coins.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Waterloo: l'ultima battaglia di Napoleone
description: 'Waterloo: l’ultima battaglia di Napoleone' ("Waterloo: Napoleon's Last Battle") is an introductory board wargame designed by members of Casus Belli association for the association itself. The subject of the game is the famous battle between Napoleon and Wellington which took place in 1815 and caused Napoleon’s final defeat and his getting off the stage of history. The game simulates the first part of the battle, until short before the arrival of the prussian reinforcements. The limited amount of counters, the size of the map, the duration of the game and the limited amount of rules make of it a good introductory game for anyone willing to approach the world of pure board wargaming. Movement and combat take place on a classic hex grid with the use of playing cards (“Tactical” cards and “Command” cards). A high number of alternate activations by both players and the way in which cards are used contribute to “mitigate” the flaws of a classic “I go, you go” mechanism.

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trederra Promo Cards
description:
2 promo cards for Shadows of Brimstone. Includes 2 artifact cards:


Void Canary (Promo card 157)
Scorch Pistol (Promo card 158)


Available when purchasing the Trederra Deluxe Otherworld Expansion direct from Flying Frog, either online, as part of the Kickstarter, or at conventions.
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Plan 1919: Fuller's Plan to End the Great War
description:
Plan 1919 is a two-player game exploring the most influential campaign that never was: J.F.C. Fuller's revolutionary plan to use new tank technology to penetrate past the frontlines, forgoing the brutal stalemate of "body warfare" to take out German lines of communication via a "shot through the brain". The 1918 armistice rendered the plan moot, and it was derided by the more traditionalist elements of the British Army. But others were paying attention, and the Second World War saw Fuller's vision realized with terrifying effect by Nazi Germany.

The Allied Player is on the attack, with many tank brigades at his disposal - but will they be enough? The Germans of this era have few armor units, but can utilize anti-tank units and aircraft to mount a stubborn defense. It's in their interest to prevent and minimize Allied advances while maintaining their tenuous lines of supply and communication.

Units represent corps, divisions, and brigades, moving across hexes that are about seven miles across. The time scale of individual turns is fungible and dependent on tempo, but the entire twenty-turn campaign represents about two months of real-world fighting.

Designer John Gorkowski is no stranger to the Great War, having designed a number of games on the topic at tactical, operational, and strategic scales. When Hollandspiele decided it wanted to publish a game on the subject, Mr. Gorkowski was the first and only designer we had in mind, and his experience with gaming the era results in a plausible, believable, playable version of Fuller's what-if.

name: Batman: The Animated Series Dice Game – Mr. Freeze Promo Card
description: This promo card allows for a fifth player to play as a villain (Mr. Freeze) with unique player powers in Batman: The Animated Series Dice Game.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Alien Artifacts: Fate Enhancer Promo Card
description:
1 promo card.

Fate Enhancer: When you take a Trade action, if all cards drawn are of the same Type, shuffle them back into the appropriate deck and draw again. Then pass this card to the left.

The card text SHOULD be:
Fate Enhancer: When you take a Buy action, if all cards drawn are of the same Type, shuffle them back into the appropriate deck and draw again. Then pass this card to the left.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Lightning Aggro
description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2019 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Lightning Aggro deck includes only red energy. In the tradition of Aggro deck, it focuses on inflicting damage early on during the game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Football Highlights 2052: King Flutie Promo Card
description:
Available in the Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter campaign.

A new player card for the game. Ability text is "Caught Off Guard: No Def Off Gains Play Yardage"
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Art Collector
description:
In Art Collector you build up an art collection. Objects can be bought from galleries in four countries, each with their own currency, or sometimes at auction. There are three scoring rounds in which the player with the most distinguished art collection gets the most points.

There are six categories of objects (in increasing order of value): old masters, 'de Stijl' (an art movement from the Netherlands), cubism, impressionism, favorite of the public, and Vincent van Gogh. All 54 objects, represented by cards, are actually part of the collection of the Kröller-Müller Museum.

Art Collector was developed by 999 Games in collaboration with the Kröller-Müller Museum.

—user summary

name: Mothership: Beyond the Expanse
description:
Wondrous sights await you as you explore Beyond the Expanse. Tales are told of Pirates, space dwelling aliens, merchant traders and planets that are covered in giant sprawling cities. This miniatures-focused expansion pack will add a variety of ways to increase your presence in the galaxy and more ways to gain Victory Points.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Furl
description:
Either furl up a row of your discs, or unfurl a stack. If you have a disc in your end row at the start of your turn, you win.

COMPONENTS:

Hexagonal board with 4 hexes per side
15 white discs
15 black discs


RULES OVERVIEW (Please refer to rulebook)

Players alternate turns until the victory condition is reached.

Each turn, choose one of two types of moves:

Furl

Choose two or more of your discs in an unbroken line, and stack them on the disc at the end of that line.

Unfurl

Choose a stack of at least two discs and sow them one per space in a straight line starting in the space in front of your stack. Intermediate spaces must be empty, but the final space may be occupied by an enemy disc or enemy stack. If so, you capture those discs.

GOAL

You win if, at the start of your turn, you have a disc or stack on the row farthest from your starting position.

You lose if you have no legal moves.

—description from the publisher

name: Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) – Council's Deliberations Expansion
description:
The Council cards expand the gameplay of Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) by allowing the defender to use the powers of the Pearl Keep's High Council.

In this expansion, the Council deliberates each round and makes decisions to bolster the Defender's power against the onslaught of the undead hordes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Selección Natural
description:
Selección Natural (Natural Selection) is a competitive game, where you must evolve to survive in a changing world. Choose your creature, and help it to thrive, mutating and evolving into an species better adapted to the environment. This task won´t be easy, as you will face several obstacles, from predators and diseases that may decimate the population, to sudden changes in the environment that will force you to adapt. And if that wasn´t enough, other species are also fighting for survival, thus creating a race for becoming the first one to evolve or to reach a population that dominates over the other species.

Each player starts with a Level 1 Species Card, and three cards in their hand. On your turn, you will take a card from the Mutations & Events Deck, and you will play a card from your hand. It could be a mutation that allows you to increase your population, or an event card that affects your creature or your enemies´. After each player has played a card, mutations are checked. If your mutation matches the current Biome, your population increases. If both mutations are active, congrats! Your creature evolves to Level 2. The game ends when any species reaches the critical population, or evolves to lvl3.
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Race, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Golems: Golem Runes
description:
This mini-expansion for Golems is part of the "Achievements" series of Matchbox Collection mini-expansions, and as such should only be opened and used once the 3 criteria on its envelope have been met; because of this...

SPOILER ALERT:

This expansion adds a new set of 4 staring cards to the base game of Golems, expanding gameplay through new and unique challenges.

name: SUM8
description:
SUM8 is a two player tile based, puzzle-like strategy game with a rearrangeable board, unique tile design and extreme re-playability.

The gameplay is simple: you play against your opponent, each player starting with 8 tiles. In alternating moves you create circles and then eventually '8's in a puzzle like sequence to score points to victory, but don't give your opponent the opportunity to score big!

On their turn, players place a tile onto the board, or move an already placed tile on the board to a new spot. This will give the player points based on what / where they place the tile.

The game ends when all tiles are played, or no one is able to place or move a tile. The player with the highest score wins!
mechanics: Connections, Matching, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Asking for Trobils: Bounty Hunters – Ship Package 3
description:
Each Ship type comes with a Ship card and 4 of the Ship Minis.

Contains:
The Knifs's Edge
The Seeker

name: Neustart
description:
Following a blackout, in Neustart you and the other members of a municipal crisis management team need to protect a small town from chaos and destruction and provide the population with the best possible care. You don't know how long it will be before power can be restored. Dealing with uncertainty and insecurity, possibly with failures and losses, the situation will make enormous demands on you.

Each round of a game is a complete day, broken into day and night. Different events happen in day and night, with these events becoming more serious and all-encompassing as the days progress. Initially everyone still has enough to eat, but people might be stuck in elevators, and accidents or fires can occur as the population handles open flame to cook.

Over time, food will run out, people will need more care, and the population needs to be informed about what measures the administration is taking. To solve these problems, the players control five teams — fire brigade, police, rescue service, construction, and administration — each with three members. Each team has important skills, but they can also crossover to handle other tasks, with the construction team also being able to put out fires, for example.

Teams can be used only for a certain amount of work, after which they need to recover. Players must act under time pressure and a lack of information, having only a few minutes to decide how the teams will act, with anything unaddressed remaining undone — and unfortunately unresolved tasks deteriorate the mood of the population, possibly leading to riots and chaos. Teams and time are limited, though, so you must set priorities and ration where needed.

The game lasts 4-7 days, and you can determine how well you do based on the damage suffered by the population and area.

name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Horse Set 7 (Trophy) Mini Expansion
description:
This set focuses on the Scoring.
8 Horse Cards (Set 7 - Trophy)

We recommend mixing several of these horses with other sets to complete a full set of 1-8 to play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Five-Dollar Words
description:
There’s an old folk game played on car trips, where you come up with a word using the letters on a license plate, but you must use them in order – BRT can be answered with trebuchet, for example, but not antidisestablishmentarianism. That often-maddening restriction is at the heart of this persnickety bauble.

Given the same three letters in the same order, players will each conjure up a word. You’ll score points for its length, for how many times each of the three letters appears, and the use of difficult letters – your Qs, your Xs, your Js, and your so-forths. Each round will specify a type of word – for example, a noun or a verb – and your score will be doubled if it falls into that category… but only if no one else at the table thought of the same word! The best score of each round wins one of the three cards. This not only removes it from future rounds but might form a set to score you extra points at the end of the game.

This is a word game for sesquipedalianists, show-offs, and pedants – where the longer and more unusual the word is, the better it’s going to score. It’s the sort of game where it’s valuable to know that “rebutter” is not a verb describing what you do when your toast fell on the floor but no one else saw it, but rather a noun for a defendant’s pleading in response to a plaintiff’s surrejoinder – and therefore it IS TOO worth double points, Susan, SO THERE.

Five-Dollar Words is the 2023 Hollandays Sale Freebie game – given out for free with orders during Hollandspiele’s big end-of-year sale. That’s the only way to get your hands on this tiny wee little baby deck of cards containing a grotesque menagerie of alphabetic monsters and delights.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Spelling, Trick-taking

name: The Phantom of the Opera
description:
"The Phantom of the Opera" is a novel written by the French author Gaston Leroux in 1910.
Players take on the roles of the two protagonists from this novel, the Phantom (Erik) and Christine, engaging in either cooperation or opposition.
This essentially translates to playing tricks according to the sheet music or thwarting them.

name: Innsmouth 32
description:
The third and most terrifying game in the Shuffling Horror board game line, Innsmouth 32 is a cinematic card-and-dice game that plunges players into one of H. P. Lovecraft's weirdest tales. One player controls the cultists and deep ones, all other players are gangsters, students, and scholars trying to make it out of Innsmouth alive.

Key to the Shuffling Horror experience is the movie deck: a sixty-card deck that hold all the characters, twists, turns, and terrors that await in Innsmouth. To start the movie, the deck is shuffled and a number of cards are dealt for the first reel (round) of the movie. Ten cards are dealt for the first reel, representing the first ten minutes of the film; as these cards are played, they confront players with terrible things.

Two new features have been added to the Shuffling Horror system to bring Innsmouth 32 its terrifying Lovecraftian vibe: Mythos and Insanity. Mythos are obtained by characters via items or investigation and grant the power to banish monsters. Characters may also gain Insanity during encounters with powerful creatures (such as the shoggoth). The more Insanity a character gains, the more unstable they become.

The game is playable with 3-13 players; if eliminated, players return to the game as cultists and deep ones (now playing on the Director's team against all other survivors).

Terror mounts with each successive reel! Who will be standing when the film fades to black...
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: To Make Georgia Howl!
description:
Division-Brigade level. Sherman's campaign from Chattanooga to Atlanta. System uses rosters to allow for fog-of-war and leader ratings to show varying levels of command skill. Several scenarios.

200 counters, 22 x 34 map, 16 pages of rules, charts.

name: Source of the Nile: Tributary
description:
Expansion for the Discovery Games edition of Source of the Nile.

This supplement clarifies many rules from Source of the Nile, and introduces many new and optional rules including:

Customizing not only the explorer but EVERY guide, bearer and askari with individual skills, stregnths, and weaknesses
Rules for lady explorers
Rules for developments in weapon technology, to even up the odds against the heathen savages
Rules for the slave trade, and encounters with slave raiders
Cape Colony and the Boers
Rules for shooting the rapids and going over cataracts
A name generator for tribes


While this supplement was intended for the Discovery Games edition, with a little tweaking, it is serviceable for use with the Avalon Hill edition, particularly if you use the "game 2" ruleset. Using all of these rules will greatly increase the complexity of the game, but if you can handle it all, it is a very rewarding and involved simulation of an African adventure.

name: Chops
description:
Lets face it, everyone wants to be a rock star. Now you can live out your rock and roll dreams with Chops, a 3 Headed Giant Game.

While your friends wasted time on paltry endeavors such as getting good grades, preparing for college, holding down jobs, and listening to the man, you answered a higher call: the call of ROCK! After spending every waking hour of your formative years learning to play, it's time to cut the apron strings and strike out. Question is: do you have the Chops to become a superstar? Hire musicians, build bands, and play gigs for cashola and, even more importantly, BUZZ. But be careful, Rock can be dangerous.

Players use game cash to buy musician cards. Bands are built using musician cards. Each band has a collective Chops Rank which allows them to play gigs with differing requirements for cash and, more importantly, BUZZ. Bands may be upgraded with special instruments, with specific musician combinations and other factors.

Players foil other bands by playing Rivalry cards that can have hilarious effects such as musician demonic possession, alien abduction, botched pyrotechnics, broken instruments and many more.

Whoever ends the game with the most BUZZ wins.

-- description from the publisher

name: Metal Minds
description:
STORYLINE

Metal Minds is a science fiction card game of hand and resource management where you play as a psychic agent indentured to the government of a colonial planet. Using your gifts, you can construct intricate machines and create powerful energy spheres called rift orbs to power cities.

A squad of agents is dispatched to a remote mountain range, rich in resources, to harvest rift orbs. While there, your team discovers some mysterious abandoned factories. The government promises release from servitude to whoever can be the first to unlock the factory secrets. As a result, a fierce competition ensues.

CONTENTS


8 Agent Cards
75 Inventory Cards
4 Tracker Mats
12 Resource Pawns
4 Rift Orb Gems


GAME PLAY

Players take turns playing cards and using agent and device powers in a race to get rift orbs. You play cards and use certain powers by spending resources. Cards can have a variety of effects, including drawing cards, converting resources, creating rift orbs and attacking rivals. At the end of a round, a player with 8 or more rift orbs wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Science Fiction

name: Troy
description:
"Troy" is a Trojan War board-wargame simulation including both Heroes and Gods.
Divided into five scenarios after Homer, it contains 252 counters and a deck of gods cards in a zip-lock, plastic bag.

Mentioned in the Chaosium magazine Wyrm's Footnotes
no. 3: "Wanderlore" by Greg Stafford (pp. 9-10) and in no. 4:
"Troy: Errata & Questions" by Don Dupont (pp. 31-33).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: L.L.A.M.A.
description:
L.L.A.M.A. is a board game inspired by the classic Commodore 64/Amiga/Atari/Intellivision game M.U.L.E (designed by Dan Bunten). L.L.A.M.A. tries to capture the feel of the trading and territory expansion processes of M.U.L.E.

The game is still under development.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Video Game Theme

name: Extractors!
description:
From the publisher:

Doriana, a Sol-like star system in the Sagittarius arm. Doriana-5, a medium sized planet barely suitable to life, is inhabited by bipedal intelligent creatures, organized in "hives". Not as curious as us, their evolution has been slow, but they have now reached a technology level high enough to put a halt on the centuries-aged wars between hives. Dorians became aware that continuing these wars with weapons more and more deadly would lead to mutual extinction....

5 light-years away, the Avronians develop the ability to send non-living materials through space at effective speed faster than light. Carbophosphate composites, the main organic energy source on Avronia, has now become very scarce but, according to recent probe reports, it is common on Doriana-5.

Whilst most of the Avronian masters are still debating the best way to negotiate their energy crisis, groups of desperate peoples decide to send armed forces (huge semi-autonomous machines) to secure large extraction perimeters on Doriana-5....

Extractors is a two-player game of medium complexity and medium solitaire suitability. One player controls a company of the Dorian Cellular Forces, consisting of Augmented Infantry Sections organized in cells and support vehicles. They face Avronian Machines whose AI is represented by the second player.

Contains a rule book, playing surface, a sheet of die-cut mounted counters, and a sheet of tables.

name: DINO DERBY kyoryu race
description:
A card predicting the dinosaurs' ranking in the race will be dealt at random. These cards are not shown to anyone else. If the ranking is correct, you win.
Roll the dice and move the dinosaurs to achieve that ranking.
The game time is short, so you can easily play as many times as you want.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: WYSIWYG
description:
WYSIWYG (pronounced WIZ-ee-wig) is an acronym used in many computer applications that stands for "What you see is what you get". Since in this two player card game, the players get to see what cards they are playing for before they play to a trick, it's an appropriate title. WYSIWYG borrows some elements from a couple of old games called German Whist and Honeymoon Bridge, while adding in some new ideas of its own.

WYSIWYG is a trick taking card game for two players. After each player is dealt 13 cards, a hand proceeds in four separate phases. First, each player evaluates their hand and announces the total. Then, a bidding session takes place to establish the hand's trump suit and objective. Next, the players play to tricks, with the winner of each trick replacing their card with their choice of one of two exposed cards and the loser receiving the other card. Each trick is worth one mark. This continues until the deck is depleted. Finally, the players play out the remainder of their cards to tricks, each of which is worth two marks. If the player who set the trump suit has earned marks at least equal to a goal based upon the two hand evaluations and his bid, he wins the hand. Play continues until one of the players scores 50 points.

(description by Larry Levy)

name: 100 Swords: Starter Sword
description: A promo card for 100 Swords, given out during the Kickstarter campaign. This item lets you acquire any non-boss item.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Lanterns: The Harvest Festival – Game Boy Geek Promo Tile
description:
A promo tile originally available as a reward through the Season 4 Game Boy Geek Kickstarter campaign.

The player receives one Lantern Card corresponding to the color on the side of the Lake Tile the player is facing (either black or red). Other players will receive Lantern Cards in a clockwise fashion as long as the supply hasn't been exhausted.

This tile also features a platform so any platform bonuses will be applied first.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Cactus Town: The Lone Ranger
description:
An expansion to Cactus Town introducing the solo mode & 5th player mode. It also introduces a new asymmetric party to Cactus Town: The Lone Ranger.

Commissioned by the Federal Marshal, his objective is to keep everyone in check until the Marshal’s task force arrives, not trusting anyone but himself. A new game mechanic based on round events will put a time-limit on your games, ending the game when the event deck is depleted and the Marshal arrives.

In the solo mode, you will take on the role of the Outlaws and experience a race against the clock to get your job of plundering done before the Marshal shows up… all the while the Lone Ranger will tamper with your plans, being your automata opponent.

In a 2-5-player game, you can take on the role of the Lone Ranger yourself, trying to prevent anyone else from fulfilling their objectives and manipulating events to win time and speed up the arrival of the Marshal. Note that the Lone Ranger is a necessary faction for any 5p games, since he puts a natural time limit on the game.

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Programmed Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Calakmul
description:
One day, you will rule the kingdom! To do so, you must demonstrate the greatest influence among your people. You will have to work hard and use your leadership, wits, and quick thinking. These are the tests you must face. And, there is a challenger...

Calakmul is a two player dice game where players cast stones (dice) that, based on combinations, give them actions to take. In general, you can build or cause mischief. The game offers three victory conditions and players decide first which game they will play:


The Leadership Challenge - the first to build three levels of their temple wins
The Honor Challenge - the player with the most honor points wins
The Artistry Challenge - the first one to engrave their side of the Historian’s Temple with the correct sequence off carved stones wins


Plus, the game offers a solo variant with its own winning conditions as well. It comes in a small tin that holds five large dice in two colors, 30 small dice in the same two colors, gems, cubes, nicely colored and printed cards, and rules for the two player and solo games.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Slot Machine
description:
Forget the old-fashioned bet your luck games because this is the new advanced “Slot machine” in which everyone can become a millionaire overnight! However, only one of you will be able to win this game. You must decide how to move the token that determines the prize through the main engine or the substitute engine to the desired location in order to gain the most points.

Slot Machine is a Family and Hand Management for 2-5 players where you must plan to move the Jackpot Token in the Slot Machine onto the position that you think has the greatest chance of winning the prize. Relying on luck may not be enough in this game. Thus, plan your next move and win the jackpot!

Let's have fun and laugh together in this Slot Machine game from Goalbeat Montree, the designer of "Foxy & Wooly" and "Sriracha" and find out who will win the prize in this game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Programmed Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Hegemonic Promo Card: Cosmic Engineering
description:
A Kickstarter and convention promotional card for the base game.

Once advanced, this card provides a one-use technology that allows you to discard all the tiles in the sector pool and refill the pool with new tiles from the stack. When used in conflicts, Cosmic Engineering results in the power from played technology being ignored, but the card must be discarded after use.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Civilization, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Intervention: Reach for the Stars
description:
Inis Vare - Welcome, Earth-dweller.

It is the year 3251 Earth-Standard-Time. Mankind overcame its century old conflicts a few decades ago, and now strives for the stars as a unified species.

In the Millennia past the humans eyes looked up to the stars uncountable times, yet they didn't know that there were always others who looked back to them, from stars far away. While the rise to glory for mankind has just begun, the old species will continue to ignore them, while they split up the galaxy among themselves.

While fierce battles raged in the depth of space, trade and smuggling prospered, spies tried to gather secret knowledge and sinister laboratories sought always for new ways to annihilate rivals or solve the riddle to gain immortality. ... in all that Chaos of the crimson night... you Earthlings might be able, to save and preserve a part of the Universe.

Inis Vare, Mortal, in Intervention!

Intervention is a 4X turn-based strategy game set in space. There are four phases to run through per player and turn.

In phase one the player rolls the die and moves. Depending on where the token ends up, it can have unexpected impact on the player’s turn.

In phase two resources are gained form planets, colonies, conquered worlds, alliances, technologies and strategic resource-fields, that are occupied by his ships.

In phase three the player can take various actions. For example, building ships, move, conquer, colonize, research, trade or sign alliances.

In phase four you check if you have fulfilled one of the three victory conditions and tell it the person to your left.

The game ends, if one player has fulfilled one of the victory conditions at the end of a turn.

You may have to trade, cooperate, advance through research, or conquer your opponents to win this game. You also share the stars with non-playable factions, neutral star bases, and many other planets, asteroids and greater Neutrons.

What does make Intervention so special and worth to be played?

The designer has created an own unique universum for the game, the so called “Interversum”, with its own unique history. The Interversum is populated by 14 different species already, but it is planned to extend this pool further in the future. A player can even create its own unique species by using our civilization builder, which then can find its own place in the Interversum.

Furthermore, there is a lot of additional gaming material of high quality included. Every civilization comes with 30 spaceship tokens, each with six individual drawn spaceships. The species cards (faction cards), where the players income and victory points are marked, are coated with an iron lamination, that lets the magnets adhere on them.

At last there is to mention, that the board is made out of modular square cards, of which are more in the box than needed for a single match. That means every match is unique and not repeatable.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame

name: Telendar
description:
A bounch of adventurers explore the cursed kingdom of Telendar, in search of a key to close the Gates of Evil, end the curse and win! They fight monsters with brute force and magic, gaining treasures and artifacts, they gain followers, visit strange places and they trade with each other or in the four burghs of the map.
But there is a ticking clock: the King of the realm is slowly dying. Each turn, an event card is turned over. This could lead to the King lose lives, and when the King dies all the players lose.
Each game is different, with a random 7x7 tiles map, tons of monsters and encounter in different combinations, and you need to use very different strategies every time like improving fighting skills, becoming a very powerful magician, exploring the land for money, tempting fate and, last but not least, trading watermelons.

Can be played solitaire.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing

name: Alice Chess
description:
Alice Chess is one of the more popular chess variants. David Pritchard's Encyclopedia of Chess Variants recommends it as one of the best chess variants.

It was created by V. R. Parton, who described his variant in his 23-page booklet "Chessery for Duffer and Master" (1953).

The standard game of Alice Chess is played using two boards, A and B. All pieces move as in standard chess. The normal array is on board A; board B starts empty.

In turn, each player makes a single move on either board following these three rules:

1. A move must be legal on the board where it is played.
2. A piece can only move or capture if the corresponding destination square on the other board is vacant.
3. After moving, the piece is transfered to the corresponding square on the other board.

(Thus a square and its corresponding square on the other board are never both occupied.)

name: Heroes, Villains and Fiends: A Companion for In Her Majesty's Name
description:
Game description from the publisher:
A selection of Company Lists, scenarios and special rules designed to expand and develop the world of In Her Majesty’s Name. The Company Lists will introduce new, fully playable factions to the setting, from the Vatican’s monster hunters to revolutionaries and underworld organisations across Europe to Russia’s intelligence agents, American rail barons, Asian secret societies, and the inhabitants of darkest Africa. The scenarios and special rules further develop the base game, giving players more variety, and increasing the possibilities!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Ultimate Warriorz: Dice Tower Promo 2016
description:
A new character that was originally available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

Amaryllis (The referee fairy or "refairy")

Amaryllis is a fairy referee who guarantees "fair play". At the beginning of the game, she’s placed atop a column without flame. When a fighter is injured, (loss of at least 1 life), Amaryllis will land on him to protect him. Her cardboard figure is taken from the top of the column and placed directly on the fighter. The player puts the corresponding token of +1 defense in front of him. The character immediately receives a +1 defense bonus as long as Amaryllis is on him (to maximum Defense of 6) When another fighter is hurt, she flies and lands on it (which thus moves the +1 defense token).

And so on.

If a fighter with the fairy is wounded a second time in a row (no other fighter is wounded in themeantime), Amaryllis increases its protection. The affected player flips the chip over to the +2 defense side (always to a maximum Defense of 6). This is Amaryllis’ maximum protection, if the protected character is injured again, the token remains on the +2 side.

Important: There is no protection available during a final duel. Amaryllis returns to a column when there are only two fighters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Vorex
description:
Vorax extensio (VOREX) is an invasive carnivorous plant. Feeding on mushrooms, insects, water and light, it spreads in the forest, and devours everything in its path. Be voracious, spread out…. Take control of the resources of the forest!

Vorex is very easy to learn, but allows the implementation of complex strategies, requiring the players to constantly adapt. The balance and feel of the game remains intact at every player count.

Mechanisms: Conquest, Management Game, Blockade

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Environmental, Territory Building

name: The City: Upgraded Edition
description:
The Upgraded Edition (Kickstarter) includes content packaged inside the base game box that is not found in the retail edition.

This includes The City: The Expanded City, 3 Iconic City packs (Paris, Seoul, Washington DC), and the Eco Mini-Expansion.

The cards from the Iconic City Packs replace those in the base game while the ones from the Expanded City and Eco Mini-Expansion are added to the base game.

The cards in the Eco Mini-Expansion are labeled as 'ECO' on the right side of the lower text area of the cards. The cards in the Paris Iconic City pack are labeled as 'PARIS'. The cards in the Seoul Iconic City pack are labeled as 'SEOUL'. The cards in the Washington D.C. Iconic City pack are labeled as 'DC'.

name: Squek!
description:
Squek! is a family game useful to teach English to children (it appeared on the Greek and on the Italian market) with a fun and amusing mechanic.
Players earn Squeks guessing the right translation of the words, or pay penalties if they fail to do so. Several mechanics make the game more intriguing and amusing: there is the possibility to buy the answer from other players that will try on your place, if you think they are better than you, but the bargain must be done within a minute… and the seller could give the wrong answer anyway! Joke cards are the most amusing part of the game: they add suspense, put a bit of fortune into the game and are the occasion for some good laughs.
A small pronunciation guide come within the game.
The game sold 16.000 copies in Italy with the first edition: a very good start for a non-major publisher without any advertising.

Expanded by:

Squek! Reloaded
categories: Card Game, Educational, Negotiation, Party Game

name: California Gold: The Northern Counties Expansion
description: California Gold is expanded by adding the Northern California Groves. This allows for up to 6 players and adds one more railroad, The Western Pacific.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Shadowfist: Combat In Kowloon
description:
The Combat In Kowloon set, from new publisher Inner Kingdom Games, saw a change in the venerable Shadowfist card game. First, it is no longer sold as randomised boosters. Instead it is a Dynamic Card Game: sets are sold as fifty card decks. Second, it removed the two-player option (dueling) for tournament play and is now focused on 3 to 4 player matches. Third, the factions of the Secret War are set to: the Ascended, Dragons, Eaters of the Lotus, Four Monarchs, Guiding Hand, and the Jammers.

The Combat In Kowloon boxed set included starter decks for the Ascended, Dragons, Eaters of the Lotus, and the Guiding Hand, play-mats, counters, as well as a new rulebook. (The Jammers and Four Monarchs factions would be included in the follow-up set Back For Seconds.)

name: Kartoffelkrieg
description:
Kartoffelkrieg is a light-weight family-friendly "potato war-game" using real potatoes equipped with plastic miniature parts and weapons. The game can be played virtually anywhere, including non-flat surfaces.

At the beginning of the game, players take turns drawing and choosing part boards with which to equip their potatoes, resulting in asymmetric character setup. Parts include treads, legs, shields, power supplies, guns, cannons, and other weapons with various abilities.

After choosing their parts, players then insert the corresponding miniature pieces into physical potatoes, and place them on the table as specified according to the number of players. Players set up their control boards, assign each part board strategically to the control board, and set all parts and potatoes to maximum power and zero damage.

During a game, players take turns using the power their potatoes produce to perform various actions with their parts. For example, a potato could use power to use their treads and move or ram another player. Alternatively, they could fire off one of their weapons, and attempt to damage another player.

Each part is different, has different power requirements, ranges, abilities, accuracy, and damage that it can give or take. Some parts require dice rolling to determine the hit location and damage amount. Players can continue using their parts for various actions, until their power reaches zero. At that point, their turn is over. Their power will reset on the subsequent turn.

When a part reaches maximum damage, the attacking player who caused that damage, removes the part from the potato, and keeps it as a victory point. The defending player removes the part board from their control board. That section of the control board is now unprotected, meaning that future damage to that location can now directly hurt the potato/control board.

When any one person reaches maximum damage on their player board, the game ends immediately. The winner is the person who destroyed the most parts and has the most victory points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Alien Entity: Mutated
description:
In Alien Entity: Mutated, you play as a group of astronauts trying to escape a sabotaged medical ship. An unknown member of the team has been mutated by an alien entity and will sabotage and mutate the researchers as they try and repair the satellite array to contact mission control. Will you survive? Are your friends mutated by an alien entity? Can you contact mission control before it’s too late? Grab some friends and join the paranoia!

Alien Entity is meant to be played multiple times. Players are passed cards face down to determine who is playing as a human or an alien. The humans win if the satellite array is built, they escape on the escape pod or the alien gets shot. The alien wins if it passes out mutation cards to all of the humans. After each game ends players may be eligible to open up legacy style expansion packs depending on the outcome of each game.

Each player draws cards from a central pile and takes turns playing and passing cards. Choose wisely because you will only be able to play one action and one battery card per turn. You may pass cards face down to other players to either help them or hurt their progress. If you are a human you may want to pass parts of the satellite array to another human. If you are an alien you can pass mutation cards to other players to get them on your side.

Games usually last between ten to twenty minutes. Once certain requirements are met new card packs are opened and introduced into the game altering the game play. The new cards give players alternate weapons and equipment to make every play through unique.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Storisende
description:
Storisende intricately merges the two most prominent goals in the realm of abstract strategy games, elimination and territory. It does so with uniform material and a simple unified behaviour. This unique characteristic wasn't intended and not wholly foreseen, but it emerged during play.

Players alternately move pieces. A piece can be a single man or a mono-colored stack and moves as far as it is high in a straight line in one of the six main directions. Pieces may merge or split and they capture opponent's pieces by replacement, regardless of size, removing the opponent's piece.

The actions of both players inherently lead to a division of the board in a number of territories, separated by a contiguous Wall. Play takes place down in the territories as well as up on the Wall. The fight on the Wall is existential: it's all about eliminating the opponent. But whoever dominates it has the means to claim territories of take them from the opponent afterwards.

Moving is not compulsory and the game ends when both players pass on successive turns. The winner is then the player with the most territory, counted as cells of the board. Draws are possible but not frequent.

-description from designer

name: Colonialism: Upgrade Cards
description:
This expansion adds a 6th available action to the game: Purchase Upgrade. This action allows players to spend collected resources to gain a permanent advantage for the duration of the game.

These are six additional cards which were added to the game for the 2018 reprint Kickstarter, and made available separately for owners of the first edition.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Political, World War I
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die Suche Nach Grenolin
description: Die Suche Nach Grenolin is an official bonus legend for Legends of Andor: Journey to the North. This legend occurs when the heroes want to begin their journey from the fog islands to Hadria, but a sudden onset of winter prevents them from doing so. And then... play the legend to find out what happened!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Make a wordsearch
description:
You've had 'roll and write' and 'flip and write'. This is a 'read and write' game.

Each turn, flip to a page of a book and use the first word as a randomiser.

Each turn, you'll fill one square in a 5x5 grid, until - after 25 turns - it's full. Try to make words, which can run in any of the 8 directions. Score points for using letters and making longer words!

The length of the word in the book determines the line you write a letter on and the letters in the word are your options for letters to write.

At the end, score one point for each letter used (so a maximum of 25), 1pt bonus for every 4-letter word, and 3pts bonus for each 5-letter word you made.

—description from the designer

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Joris Promo
description:
A promo figure for Krosmaster: Arena. New character with unique stats card.

Offered through the Frigost Kickstarter. Future availability unknown.

name: Plunder: The Commodore's Game
description:
The Commodores Game is an advanced rule set for Plunder. Plunder's Commodores Game is for those with a true pirate and gamers heart.

The Commodores expansion for Plunder is designed to increase the total number of maximum players from 4 to 6. It also includes additional rules that make the game more complex and even more exciting than the base game. In order to play the Commodores Game you will need a copy of Plunder and to down load and print the Commodore Expansion.

The Commodores expansion is a free PDF download from the games fan club website (www.plunderfanclub.com). The PDF downloads include additional Captain mats and ships for two new colors (Black and Silver), new rules sheet, and additional national flags, coins, and cargo counter sheets.

Expands:

Plunder
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Pirates, Print & Play

name: Starfire: Crusade
description:
"Starfire: Crusade" is a supplement for the Starfire (3rd Edition) board-wargame system. The Starfire series always contained a "Future History" of "historical" information and 'historical battles" in the future. This supplement for Starfire (3rd Edition) included the scenarios and "history" covering the Theban War (The designer, David M. Weber, also published a book of the same name, and this scenario book covers the events of the book).
The supplement was previously released for the earlier edition of the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment
publishers: Starfire Design Studio, Task Force Games

name: Marcus Claudius Marcellus: The Sword of Rome
description:
An expansion for SPQR, this module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr8. The leader counters are found in C3i Nr9.

One of the two Roman generals battling Hannibal in the first half of the Second Punic War. While Quintus Fabius became known as The Delayer for avoiding battle with Hannibal, Marcus Claudius Marcellus became known as The Sword of Rome for his battles with Hannibal which resulted in draws.

This module highlights Marcellus's battles:

Clastidium, 222 B.C.
Third Nola, 214 B.C.
Acrillae, 213 B.C.
Numistro, 210 B.C.

name: Agricola: Agricola Meets Newdale
description:
6 card expansion for Agricola originally available at Spiel 2019.

Every player selects a card that gives them a special ability that can be used once per game.
categories: Animals, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Pocket Aquarium
description:
Can you create the most harmonious aquarium?

Each fish in the tank has its own action. On each turn you can either flip a fish card so that it swims (and its action goes) in the opposite direction - or you can perform its action to move fish and various features around the aquarium.

Playing the 'feed the fish' card gives you a once-per-game special action, while a cat moves around the fish tank, acting as both a hindrance and a game timer.

At the end of the game, if you have all of the aquarium’s features in the right place, and score enough points by getting fish of the same species swimming happily together, you win!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Chaining, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Defenders of the Realm: Companions and Catacombs
description: The Companions & Catacombs expansion for Defenders of the Realm takes the realm to the next level in regard to questing as heroes can now enter the dangerous dungeon catacombs where great treasure is hidden. Heroes may enhance their combat abilities by obtaining this treasure, but beware; only the bravest and most valiant heroes can gain such hidden and guarded treasures, and many that seek them may not return. Fear not brave Heroes because you will not be alone in these new challenges for new allies come to your aid, companions that join in your battles and venture with you in the quest for treasure in defense of the realm. But darkness has a way of expanding as well. The enemy grows off the dark places and rises up in opposition of the heroes seeking treasure and allies. They too recruit from the dungeons, and send new challenges the heroes must face in the form of Spiders, Renegade Trolls, and brutal Warlords joining their forces. Companions and Catacombs may be added to any game of Defenders of the Realm to expand story and provide new opportunities and challenges for the heroes.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Piquet: Les Grognards
description:
Les Grognards 2nd Edition includes rules for 3 different game scales: Company scale (basic infantry unit is a company), Battalion scale (basic infantry unit is a battalion), and Grand Tactical scale (basic infantry unit is a brigade or regiment). Using the game scales in Les Grognards 2nd Edition, small actions from a few companies up to multiple Corps are possible. The three game scales allow experimentation with games of different scopes and scales with existing troops and mounting systems. All three scales use the same basing system; there is no need for rebasing.

Les Grognards 2nd Edition also includes Horizon Movement rules for the Battalion and Grand Tactical scale games. Horizon Movement eliminates virtually all measuring for movement. Horizon movement allows units to move based on the tabletop terrain and enemy unit's positions. Rather than measuring moves in small increments, moves are made based on limiting terrain or tactical situations. The result is a game that features dynamic, flowing movement rather than the same moves broken down into small increments as in standard measured movement games.

Les Grognards 2nd edition features completely new material, incorporating 5 sets of rules (Company scale, Battalion scale, Grand Tactical scale, Horizon Movement Battalion scale, Horizon Movement Grand Tactical scale) and 37 different army lists. The new lists allow the unique characteristics of a wide variety of armies to be represented on the tabletop. The armies covered in Les Grognards 2nd Edition include:

Expands:

Piquet: Master Rules for Wargaming
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Penki
description: Penki is a tactical, dynamic 5-in-a-row game. As with most 5-in-a-row games, each player strives to create a row of 5 pieces of her color. In Penki, however, there is a 3rd color which is wild, and all the pieces wait, hidden in a bag, to be drawn. Each Player owns 14 pairs of pieces, randomly drawn from the bag. On your turn, you either add a new board segment (of 2 spaces) to the growing gameboard, or you place one of your pairs of pieces onto one of the segments of the gameboard. Thus, in this game, your 5-in-a-row can include wilds.

name: Stupiduel Fantasy Expansion
description:
From the back of the box:

"Once upon a time there was a little expansion deck. This deck was full of marvelous creatures and magical artifacts which, in responsible hands, could have been used to create wondrous tales of fantastic adventure.

However, these cards wound up in your hands instead, and you're a raving mad stupiduelist!

This 60 card expansion to Stupiduel can be used to turn your original deck into a pure fantasy deck, or just shuffled right in. Either way, your Stupiduel matches will be transformed by its powerful contents, allowing attacks that could only be dreamed of, defenses that could only be wished for, and conclusions that will leave you laughing happily ever after!"

Expands

Stupiduel
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game

name: African Rails
description: A web-published variant of the well-known Empire Builder system by Mayfair Games. True to its name, this one takes place on the continent of Africa. This was designed by the same designer of the similar game, German Rails.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Immortal Fire: Greek, Persian and Macedonian Wars – Field of Glory Gaming Companion
description:
The third army list supplement for the Field of Glory miniatures wargame. This supplement covers the armies of ancient Greece and the Hellenistic world, along with their allies and enemies. There are eighteen separate lists, each with a sample starter army and point cost chart for making your own force.

The book itself is 80 pages printed in full color with photos of miniatures and paintings from various other Osprey books used throughout.

Armies included:
- Classical Greek
- Early Achaemenid Persian
- Thracian
- Lydian
- Late Dynastic Egyptian
- Kyrenean Greek
- Early Carthaginian
- Skythian or Saka
- Classical Indian
- Late Achaemenid Persian
- Syracusan
- Alexandrian Macedonian
- Early Successor
- Early Sarmatian
- Galatian
- Hellenistic Greek
- Graeco-Bactrian
- Indo-Greek
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Târgu-Frumos 1944
description:
This wargame is issued in Vae Victis 82.

It simulates the Red army (2nd Ukrainian front) offensives on Iasi and Târgu-Frumos (Romania, April and May 1944).

This game is using the same game system as Korsoun 1944 and Alsace 1944 .

name: Mythgardia
description:
Mythgardia - The Game of Heroic Adventure is Bob Harris’ follow-up to his classic fantasy board game Talisman. Mythgardia opens up a whole world of myth and legend, allowing players to weave a complete story around their characters as they enjoy an exciting, fun-filled game.

Mythgardia is set in a world made up of five Realms, each of which generates its own unique set of adventures. Characters travel around the five Realms, following clues which will lead them to the fabulous Crystal Treasures. These crystals are a source of immense power and characters will find themselves being pursued by the minions of J’Cabe, the evil arch-warlock who seeks to make himself master of Mythgardia.

After being launched as a limited collector's edition of 100 copies, each individually numbered with a signed certificate, Mythgardia is now available for purchase in a standard edition.

Expanded by: Mythgardia Expansion Set
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zhēng Shàngyóu
description:
This is a climbing game with many variations and therefore known by many names (Struggling Upstream, Pits, San Jia Xi, Huojian, Kuoppa). It's related to other climbing games like Dai Hin Min, Tien Len, Big Two and President.

The game is played with a 54-card pack including two jokers. Each player starts with a hand of cards and the object is to be the first to get rid of all your cards by playing combinations.

The game consists of playing combinations of cards: single cards, sets, single sequences and multiple sequences. When a player plays a combination, only a combination of the same type, length and higher rank can beat it - to beat a single sequence you must play a single sequence of the same length with higher ranking cards. Jokers are wild cards and can be used in any combinations. The Twos play a special role in this game and can be seen as semi-wild cards.

The player who gets rid of his cards first gets two points, the second player gets one point. You also get an extra advantage when finishing first or second, because the last and second to last player will have to give their best card away to them in the next hand.

Zheng Shangyou has a sizable luck element and the winner of a round has an advantage in the next round, but there is room for skillful play as the players learn how to best manage the cards they are dealt. The game plays best with five or six, but can be played by four or more. With 4 or 6 players, the game is usually played with two teams facing off against each other in partnerships.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Chlopska Szkola Biznesu
description:
"Peasant School of Business" is a board game inspired by the remarkable story of one of the Małopolska towns, which by its attractive formula - science in action - is to develop social skills and promote initiative. Interesting and engaging form of play helps players to understand contemporary economic phenomena (such as supply, demand, competition, trading companies, economic clusters).
The main task of the players is to collect as much capital as possible. The success of a player depends not only on ability to manage owned resources, but also on cooperation with the others.
Players take the role of weavers, blacksmiths, bakers and take part in the simulation of real market mechanisms - they produce, trade with other players at the market and collect the goods necessary to accomplish the business trips to various European cities. Background of the game is the socio-economic history of eighteenth-century Andrychów. The game may be played by 12-30 people of middle school age or older, directed by a moderator, which may be a teacher, organizer or the group tutor.


„Chłopska Szkoła Biznesu” to gra planszowa inspirowana niezwykłą historią jednej z małopolskich miejscowości, która poprzez swoją atrakcyjną formułę – naukę w działaniu – służy rozwijaniu kompetencji społecznych i promuje przedsiębiorczość. Ciekawa i angażująca forma rozgrywki ułatwia graczom zrozumienie współczesnych zjawisk gospodarczych (takich jak np. podaż, popyt, konkurencja, spółki handlowe, klastry gospodarcze).
Głównym zadaniem uczestników rozgrywki jest zgromadzenie jak największego kapitału. Sukces gracza zależy nie tylko od umiejętności gospodarowania posiadanymi zasobami, ale i współpracy z innymi uczestnikami gry.
Gracze wcielają się w role tkaczy, kowali, piekarzy i biorą udział w symulacji rzeczywistych mechanizmów rynkowych – produkują, handlują z innymi graczami na jarmarku i gromadzą towary niezbędne do zrealizowania wypraw handlowych do wybranych miast Europy. Tłem rozgrywki jest społeczno-gospodarcza historia XVIII-wiecznego Andrychowa, a plansza gry to mapa Europy z miastami, do których docierały w tym czasie bryki handlowe z lnianymi płótnami produkowanymi w ośrodku andrychowskim.
W rozgrywce może uczestniczyć od 12 do 30 osób w wieku gimnazjalnym lub starszych, a całością kieruje moderator, którym może być nauczyciel, animator grupy, opiekun.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: BattleTech: Shattered Sphere
description:
From the back of the book:

In early 3061, Prince Victor Steiner-Davion returned from the Clan homeworlds triumphant—but to an Inner Sphere that was radically different. The entire Ghost Bear population had relocated to the Inner Sphere; the St. Ives Compact was under siege; Katrina Steiner-Davion was sitting on the throne of New Avalon. Even with the overwhelming threat of the Clan invasion defeated, the Inner Sphere is still poised precariously between peace and war. Who will light the spark that will set BattleMechs marching and worlds aflame once more?

Drawing on information from five scenario packs, seven sourcebooks and more than a dozen novels, Shattered Sphere represents the ultimate guide to the people and places of BattleTech, as seen through the eyes of the characters who live there. Offering a brief, comprehensive history of the universe and an in-depth look at events from the Truce of Tukayyid through early 3062, this update is a must for any BattleTech fan. Shattered Sphere also includes detailed maps showing the current state of the Inner Sphere and the Clans.

User comment:

Although Shattered Sphere was released at something of an odd time as it fell halfway through the release schedule of the BattleTech Field Manual series. It provides a general update on the major changes and events affecting the various Houses, Clans and major Periphery powers from the 3050s through to around 3061; the detailed state and border maps are very useful for BattleTech and BattleForce 2 campaigns, and this sourcebook is one of the few to touch on two of the up and coming Periphery powers, the Marian Hegemony and the Circinus Federation.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Starmada: Fleet Ops
description:
Starmada: Fleet Ops is a "fleet-scale" game using the same database as Starmada: Admiralty Edition science-fiction starship combat game. S:FO is very similar to S:AE in many respects, but Starmada: Fleet Ops' flow is intended to be faster-moving and more abstracted.

Game scale is "grand tactical", each ship is a single counter on the map, and its statistics (damage level, weapons, and so on) are tracked individually, although not in as much detail as Starmada: Admiralty Edition. (Any ship you can build using Admiralty Edition's ship design rules can be represented in Starmada: Fleet Ops, making the two games highly compatible).Construction rules are included, and also guidelines on converting Admiralty Edition ships to Fleet Ops statistics. An entire fleet of ships can be represented on a single standard sheet of paper.

Play is simultaneous. Each player takes turns giving orders to his units by placing a marker on top of one ship to indicate the orders it has been given. Once all ships have orders, initiative is determined. The player losing initiative moves all his ships first (giving the non-moving player an advantage), but then fires first in the subsequent fire phase (gaining an advantage).

Movement and firing are both simplified and sped up from Admiralty Edition, reducing the amount of record keeping and the number of die rolls. Mechanics new to the Starmada system are introduced, including morale and command ships.

The product is available as either a download in Adobe .pdf format, or as a print-on-demand saddle-stitched book (44 pages). Additional material, including printable colour counters and map sheets, is available for free download from Majestic 12 Games' website for purchasers of either format.

name: Babylon 5 Wars: Raiders & Privateers
description: This 96-page book includes information on not only the Raiders, but also the Belt Alliance (a civilian freight defense organization), Police Forces (for the Minbari, Abbai, Brakiri, Drazi, Pak'ma'ra, and Vree), and a new "pirate race," the Llort! Also provided are numerous civilian ships, such as freighters, tugs, barges, tankers, escorts, liners, and the like. We've also included rules and background material (plus a few ships) for several large Raider bands, such as the Indpendent Mercenaries League and the Tirrith Free State. Not to mention the usual assortment of scenarios, weapons, rules, and everything else you love about B5 Wars supplements!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Dragones Y Mazmorras
description:
A Spanish-language card game that is a variant of Crazy Eights, based on the Dungeons & Dragons cartoon.

Each player is dealt four cards (or seven cards if there are only two players) with the remaining deck placed with the top card face-up beside it (if a five is revealed then it should be shuffled back into the deck and the next top card revealed instead). Players take turns placing one of their cards face-up on the revealed deck, matching either the number or colour of the previous card (e.g.: 3 matches 3 and red matches red). Fives are wild and the player placing it decides its colour and number. If a player has no cards that will match the current card or wild cards then he must draw another from the unrevealed deck until a legal play can be made, but if there are no remaining cards then he passes instead. The player to discard all his cards is the winner.

The deck's red suite is The Last Illusion episode, the green suite is The Traitor episode, the yellow suite is Day Of The Dungeon Master episode and the blue suite is The Treasure Of Tardos episode.

There are 32 playing cards plus a card explaining the rules.

The box's artwork is based on the box's artwork from Quest for the Dungeonmaster.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Nightfall: Bloated Corpse Promo
description: The promo Bloated Corpse is a ghoul that was originally developed with Nightfall: Dark Rages, but was never formally released. It is now being made available for Print-n-Play. Players may print the full sized image within the image gallery or download the new Print-n-Play PDF available on the main Nightfall game's page.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Flapjacks & Sasquatches: Lumberjacks expansion
description:
These 15 wacky characters will add a whole new level to your game. Deal 1 Lumberjack to each player at the start of the game and they can play it whenever they want!

Example Lumberjacks; Nelson "Free" Love, Chainsaw Sue, Chet "Awesome Axe" Studman, Hairy Harry.

name: Myth: Journeyman Modules
description: A box containing the printed materials for all 8 Myth Modules offered during the Journeyman kickstarter. Miniatures are not included.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Last Night on Earth: Old Betsy Faithful Hound
description:
Now you can play as fan favorite Old Betsy the dog from Last Night on Earth. The Last Night on Earth 10 Year Anniversary Edition comes with a miniature for Old Betsy to represent her on the board in place of the counter when her card is played. With this Hero Character Sheet, Old Betsy becomes a playable Hero to take on the Zombie outbreak!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Scarlet Envelope I: Newspaper – Introduction to Mysteries
description:
Scarlet Envelope is a series of Canadian-made mail-in games with an escape room feel. Chapter One includes 13 games (envelopes) full of engaging brainteasers with web & video integrations.

"Newspaper: Introduction to Mysteries" is the first game in the 13 series that gets you familiar with codebreaking and gives you teasers of the storyline-based games ahead of you.

All thirteen can be played separately and in any order but there is one overarching element in the whole series (in each game you search for one hidden letter to collect a password to something in the thirteenth game.)

"Did you know that a Secret Society has been watching you? Now, you’ve been selected for a test. You will receive a Scarlet Envelope full of mysterious items that seem to be from the different worlds...and times. Make sense of all the items and prove yourself worthy of joining this obscure secret society."

“Newspaper: Introduction to Mysteries” envelope includes:
One Cryptic Newspaper
One map
Two posters
Two vintage letters
A mysterious ticket
Videos, audio, and web pages
More than 13 puzzles to solve
Instructions and Online Hints

name: Lost Worlds: Man with Short Sword and Dagger
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Meow Mayhem
description:
