The players becomes the characters of "Dr. Stone" and cooperates to achieve the purpose of each episode. There are many mysteries and surprises during the game, and you can solve them by combining materials and making equipment to find ways to achieve your goals.

It is a story driven cooperative game that can be enjoyed not only by those who watch the anime or read the manga, but also by those who haven't watched it.

The purpose of the game is to create a "goal item" in each episode within the time limit. In a world that has lost science, casual things doesn't seem to fulfill a purpose. However, with the knowledge of Senku and the cooperation of his friends, there is nothing impossible!
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Family Feud (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
No one knows how the feud started between two of the largest families in Carcassonne. Some say it was a boundary dispute, others say it was due to a cow. No one knows for certain. But the one certain thing is that the two families will have nothing to do with each other and will go out of their way to keep their distance from each other.

New tiles with pennants of a new family.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Cudgel Duel: Franco's first counterstrikes at the Ebro, Aug-Sep 1938
description:
"Cudgel Duel: Franco's First Counterstrikes at the Ebro, Aug-Sep 1938" is a FREE Print and Play wargame; the first one depicting the second phase of the Climatic Battle of the Ebro. The battle composed of a series of vicious counterattacks that ended, after much blood spilling, pushing the Republican army to the left bank of the river it had crossed 4 months before.

The game is a Battalion level simulation of the battle, played on a hexagonal grid with hexides spanning 500 meters and 8 hour turns. The turns consist of successive divisional activations and separate air and administrative phases. The scenarios depict five of the bloody counter-offensives that took place between August and October 1938.

Status markers and air operations are handled in separate charts. Maneuver, morale, intelligence, enemy reaction and divisional assets play a significant part in the battle management. Combat resolution is interactive and fluid, maximizing unpredictability.

The game includes a set of rules, one scenario booklet, one A2 map, three air operations charts, ten corps asset charts, and three, two sided, counter sheets. One six sided die and, optionally, two opaque cups are also required.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – Rulebook
description:
The galaxy is in flames. The Emperor’s glorious vision for Humanity is in ruins, His armies locked in brutal civil war. The greatest of these bitter combatants are the towering god-engines of the Adeptus Titanicus. Those Titan Legions that remain loyal to the Emperor of Mankind fight boldly to stem the tide of treachery, holding the line on countless worlds as the Warmaster’s forces advance inexorably on Terra. The Traitor Titan Orders march at the vanguard of the Warmaster’s hosts as they seek to bring the Imperium to its knees in the name of their twisted cause…

Adeptus Titanicus is a tabletop game of devastating combat between awe-inspiring god-machines, set during the civil war that tore the galaxy apart. Two players take control of a variety of Titans – colossal, bipedal war engines covered in thick armour and weapons which can level a city in a single salvo. It's a strategic challenge in which you pit your skill and cunning against your opponent in a battle to the death; a test of tactical skill demanding the management of the resources at your disposal, determining the optimal reactions to the evolving state of the battlefield.

This hardback rulebook is your guide to the game, packed with all the rules you need to get started. Grab this, a handful of Titans, and some accessories, and your conquest of the galaxy can begin!

CONTENTS
This 96-page hardback book contains:

The Imperium of Mankind: an overview of the galaxy, the Titan Legions, and the Horus Heresy
Notable Engine Wars: A record of infamous Titan battles from the Age of Darkness
Basic Rules: The key rules you need to play the game, from rounds and phases to movement, combat and damage, plus the Titanic Clash mission to get you started
Advanced Rules: Expanded rules for experienced players, including Orders, Stratagems, and how to use squadrons of Titans and support Banners of Imperial Knights
Optional Rules: Additional ways to play that add complexity for a richer experience, including transferring power, overloading void shields, and stray shots
Assembling a Battlegroup: How to build your army, including a variety of maniples and personal traits for your Princeps Seniores
Fighting a Battle: An explanation of Open, Narrative, and Matched Play, advice on choosing missions, setting up the battlefield, and selecting Stratagems
Missions: Six missions which can be used for Open Play or Narrative Play games, each based on an historic battle
Matched Play: How to play balanced competitive games, including the Meeting Engagement mission, different types of deployment, and victory conditions
Legions of the Adeptus Titanicus: Descriptions and rules for Legio Gryphonicus and Legio Tempestus, each with its own Legion Trait, specific wargear, and choice of Princeps Seniores’ personal trait


The book also includes a range of artwork, including annotated schematics of a variety of Titans, and colour examples of Titan and Knight heraldry.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pocket World Cup: The Rise of Antarctica
description:
Global warming has transformed Antarctica from a winter wasteland into a holiday hotspot. As visitors flock to this newly-formed island nation, the governing authorities are looking to make a splash on the global stage and entice people to take up permanent residence. What better way to showcase this beautiful country than by becoming a world power in the beautiful game? Take the reins of the national football squad, use a recruiting loophole to pick some of the best players from around the globe, and lead Antarctica to World Cup glory in this challenging card-drafting, dice-chucking game for one!

In Pocket World Cup, you will play the role of team manager leading Antarctica through three years of World Cup qualifying. Each year you will draft 3 new players to your team and face 3 opponents in an attempt to earn momentum. Games are resolved by rolling dice for both sides, with each player offering additional dice or the ability to manipulate the dice in play. The players will get better as you progress from one year to the next, but so will your competition. If you earn enough momentum after three years, you will qualify for the World Cup: a 24-team single-elimination knockout tournament.

For a greater challenge, you can play in Dynasty Mode: a campaign of four complete cycles of qualifying games and World Cups in which you earn victory points based on how far you advance each cycle. Earn enough and your name will be etched forever in the Antarctican Hall of Fame!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mushroom Sorcerer
description:
There hangs the twin moon
among the skies
When plenty pours her elements
Nighttime splendor it is!

Elementis, a land blessed with mystical elements and ancient magic, is guarded by The Great Sorcerer with his astonishing power throughout the years.
In every duo luna year, the Great Sorcerers’ Tournament is held at the Enchanted Forest where the winner will be awarded the secret to magic mastery as a successor in title.
The competition is dangerous and courage is no guarantee for survival – Attack or defence, spells will be casted and battles are inevitable ! Dazzling blast of magic between the GU towers will not cease until the last man stands and wins the seat as The Great Sorcerer !

There are 3 phases in each round:
1. Twilight
A sip of potion stimulates sorcerers’ sense of elements, giving them different powers for the rest of the night. Choose your potion wisely!

2. Night
During Night phase, sorcerers can perform 1 of the 4 actions:
a. Grow GU to gain element(s) and level up your sorcery and power.
Flame elements give your flame servants which destroy everything as their masters commanded.
Stone elements give your stone servants which protects your territory.
Water elements create drops, an essential substance for GUs’ growth, bringing the forest prosperity and abundance.
Thunder elements form mana, providing energy for sorcerers to cast spells.
Moon elements, the source of ancient magic. Sorcerers gain ancient knowledge by studying moon elements. Once a sorcerer controls a sufficient
amount of moon GUs and moon elements, one becomes the most powerful sorcerer and wins the game.
b. Ancient and powerful spell scrolls are scattered around the forest. Pick up and cast them wisely to create a chain of combo to destroy your opponents.
c. Waging war against other sorcerers is another way to gain influence. Let your opponent know who is the great sorcerer!
d. Summoning element to gain immediate assistance and resources.

3. Daybreak
Sun rises, sorcerers get rest in the day, recharging their magic, powers and prepare the works for the coming night.

Only the sorcerer with the most influence or moon elements win the game!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Race, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Dive!
description:
Dive! is a card game for 1 to 2 players. Your goal is to deploy a team of divers, earn gold to improve their equipment, and ultimately recover more priceless treasure than your opponent.

You start with a simple 10 card deck and over the course of the game you can:


Purchase Equipment cards to add to your deck and improve the effectiveness of your dive crew.
Freedive cards for a risky boost to diving capability at the cost of permanently losing them.
Acquire Treasure to gain immediate bonuses and ultimately decide the winner in this all out race to riches.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Epic Zoo
description:
EPIC ZOO is a new project which focuses on creating a zoo with fantastic animals, with a quick dynamic to learn that does not include violence in its mechanics, which makes EPIC ZOO the ideal game for all audiences.

EPIC ZOO is a game in which you must plan your expansion strategy and overcome obstacles.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy
mechanics: Events, Market, Open Drafting, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Portland
description:
Each player has his own deck of 52 cards. Each deck is shuffled. You are playing against the other players, over six rounds, trying to build the best combinations. Waste cards early and miss big scores at the end!

—description from the rulebook

At the beginning of each round, each player deals out 5 cards in a row. Then, in turns, the players choose to either draw a card from their personal deck and add that card on top of any card in their row, or pass, dropping out of the round. When all players have passed, the round is over. The 5 card rows are compared and the best poker hand wins points according to a table determined by player count.

Played with a standard deck of cards, published in Reiner Knizia's book Blazing Aces!: A Fistful of Family Card Games.

name: AucA
description:
Welcome to you little goose! Today is a great day, the Kingdom of Perigordiä is inviting you on a big adventure. It is said that the most heroic goose will be covered with golden feathers. Multiple tasks await you : collecting ingredients from the Kingdom specialities to prepare recipes, opening treasures or fulfilling the village requests.
Set the pace and be sharp on your journey.

Auca is an exploration game. The aim is to collect tiles to earn a maximum of golden feathers (victory points). To this end, find recipes and the necessary ingredients for their making, search for treasures and collect as many ingredients from the Village tile as possible.

—description from the designer

name: Little Factory: Suburbs
description:
Mini-extension of 4 cards to add to the game.

Rules:
Stockyard: Lets you exchange 1 Sheep with a 1 Cow, or vice versa.
Recycling Center : Lets you spend 1 Barrel to gain 1 Wood and 1 VP.
Supermaket: Lets you spend 1 or more Resource cards (of any level) to gain a single Level III resource card worth less than or equal to the value of the cards you spent.
Hardware Store: Lets you spend 1 Clay and 1 Wall to gain 3 VP.

name: Wars of the Republic: Ancient Roman Wargaming 343–50 BC
description:
From the First Samnite War and the eventual conquest of the Italian Peninsula, to the defeat by Hannibal at Lake Trasimene, and final victory over the Gauls at Alesia, Wars of the Republic is a miniature wargame that allows you to campaign with the legions or stand firm against Roman expansion and fight throughout the ancient Mediterranean.
This book contains all the rules required to fight battles during this period, including multiple army lists to reflect the changing nature of the Roman military and the varied opponents they faced, be it Gaul, Italian, Carthaginian, Iberian, or Greek.

–Description from the publisher

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Panther
description:
The Panther is a powerhouse in every sense of the word with great mobility and firepower allowing you to really run the tank hard on the battlefield. All of this does come at a slight cost however – Weak Flank means that it is susceptible to shots coming in from the side and rear which means you may want to buff it’s initiative stat. Enhanced Suspension is a cheap way to gain a additional point in the movement phase, whilst driver Phil Stulpnagel can improve it even more and adding the sort-after Smooth Ride ability.

—description from the publisher

name: Mixtape Massacre: Escape From Tall Oaks – Get To The Van
description:
Expansion pack for Mixtape Massacre: Escape From Tall Oaks.

The Get to the Van Pack is a new game mode for Escape From Tall Oaks that offers players an alternate route of escape. Work together searching the town, finding the needed items to get the Tall Oaks Rec Center van working again. Fight off slashers, rescue your friends, and get ready to put the pedal to the metal!

Contains:

1 New Survivor
1 Character Profile Card
1 Final Rescue Token
1 Van Token
4 Supply Cards
4 Van Item Tokens
1 Rule Card

name: Escape the Box: Die verschwundenen Superhelden
description: This box transforms into nine rooms - not just one Escape Room, but an entire Superhero Tower stands between you and your Exit. And what is it? The base of the superheroes seems to be abandoned. Time for new heroes to prove themselves. Find the missing heroes and escape the big Escape Room together. Solve all the puzzles and uncover the secrets of the fastest and strongest people in the world to master the mission of your game characters. With up to four players, you'll explore the Heroes' Union base, filled with dangerous artifacts, captured supervillains and alien technology. But don't let the villains hoodwink you. Who knows who is responsible for the disappearance of the superheroes?

name: French Toast: Promo Cards
description:
16-card promo pack included for Kickstarter backers (not in the box, shipped separately).

6 "Basic" cards: Beard, Brain, Panda, Shirt, Tiger, Tooth

10 "Advanced" cards: Blood, Coffin, Goblin, Gravestone, Mummy, Museum, Ninja, Surfboard, Triangle, Vampire
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Real-Time, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Targeted Clues, Team-Based Game

name: Something Wild! Star Wars: Boba Fett
description:
Something Wild! Star Wars: Boba Fett is a fast-paced, light card game. Play numbered and colored character cards to make sets and runs, just like in Rummy. Power cards specific to the included character add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay. The first player to score three powers wins.

You can combine multiple Something Wild! games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to a game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Spitfire: The Fight for Air Supremacy
description: Spitfire the fight for air supremacy, is a solitaire roll and write wargame. Putting the player in the cockpit of a Spitfire, belonging to 11 group during the Battle of Britain. The player will have to engage and destroy German fighters and try to reach German bombers before they drop their bombs on British airfields. The aim of the game is to protect British airfields and reduce German bomber production. The RAF are counting on you to take the fight to the skies beware the Hun in the sun. TALLY HO CHAPS
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Operation Praying Mantis, April 18 1988
description:
“Time is now against Iran.” –Chairman and de facto commander-in-chief, Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani’s comment following Operation Praying Mantis.

Following the destruction of Iran Air Flight 655 by the US, fully loaded with pilgrims on their way to Mecca for the Haj, the Iranian military vowed revenge against the “Great Satan”. With Grand Ayatollah Khomeni gravely ill, there was no one in charge within the Iranian government or military who could or would thwart this dangerous escalation of force. On April 14 the FFG (guided missile frigate) USS Samuel Roberts struck a mine at the edge of the international maritime channel near the Gulf of Bahrain while escorting a fleet of oil tankers. While no one aboard the stricken vessel was killed or seriously injured, the mine blew a gaping twenty-foot wide hole in the ship. Only the quick and skilled action by its crew kept USS Samuel Roberts from sinking. It was quickly determined by investigators that the Iranians had deployed the mines, and National Security Advisor, General Colin Powell advised President Reagan that a massive demonstration of force was required to demonstrate once and for all that Iranian armed interference with the flow of ship traffic in the Persian Gulf would not be tolerated.

Operation Praying Mantis was the largest US fleet action since the Second World War. While the US had a preponderance of force, any error or serious loss could possibly embolden the Iranians, especially the hard liners who resisted any end to the war with Iraq or compromise with the US-led coalition that opposed them. Operation Praying Mantis is a solitaire play game with the active player taking on the role of the commander of the US naval force charged with implementing the operation. The game’s rules govern the Iranian response. Can you do as well or better?

Each copy of Operation Praying Mantis is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch map
112 single-sided, unmounted counters
One player's aid sheet
6 pages of rules

Players will also need a six-sided die and one standard deck of playing cards to play the game. A custom card set that replaces the standard deck of playing cards, has rules reminders on pertinent cards, and features graphics by Bruce Yearian is available from High Flying Dice Games.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kryptik Trading Card Game
description:
The game of Kryptik can be played by 2 players in our standard format, 4 players in our more casual Krucible format, and requires nothing more than some Kryptik decks to get started. No need for dice, tokens, special mats, or boards. This immaculate card game design allows players to adopt the game more easily and gives players/store owners the option to put on draft or sealed deck events with (literally) just a booster box and some friends.

Each game of Kryptik represents your life on Kryptik Island. You are a citizen with 66 years to prove your worth to the Overseers, and these years are represented by your six 11 year cards. You must work towards victory by slinging spells and commanding your citizen allies to attack your opponent in an effort to destroy all of their 11 year cards. Hit them one more time after you destroy their final 11 year card and you win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Etno
description:
Up to 4 players collect and place tiles in this board game inspired by Bulgarian embroidery and ancient symbols. Create patterns, fulfill objectives and become the winner thanks to good planning, creativity an spatial thinking.
You collect tiles from the market, activate actions place tiles on the board or keep them for later and win points by achieving symmetry, color and shape objectives.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Pattern Building, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Sopalavras
description:
Remember when your mother scolded you for playing with your food? Well, now she'll want to play too! Sopalavras is a game based on the famous alphabet soup: the more you move the noodles, the bigger the word you will form.

Six letter tiles are opened at the start of the round. Players try to use the revealed letters to mentally form words with at least three letters. The letters of the words already formed on the table can be used to create new words with the letter tiles of the round. When a player forms a word, he must say aloud the NUMBER of letters that word has. From there all players can keep trying to form words for as long as 1 minute. During this time, whenever a player is able to mentally form a word with an equal or greater number of letters than previously spoken, he must say that number aloud. The player who assembled the highest word wins 1 point or 2 points if he uses all 6 letter pieces in the round. The game ends when a player scores 5 points, winning the game.

name: Escape Quest: Pour une Poignée de Néodollars
description:
Escape Quest is a game book in which you must solve puzzles to advance in your adventure. Each page has its clues: combinations, labyrinths, word games, hidden images ... Your logic and your sense of observation will be put to the test!

Los Angeles, 2062. Nuclear war and economic disaster have left all power in the hands of massive corporations You are just a young, self-taught hacker making ends meet in the sprawl, until one night you receive a cryptic message from a mysterious sender: “Join us”. You are then suddenly swept into a race for your own survival, and perhaps that of all the other users on the network ! Sides become blurry; which lines will you cross ? Is the ultimate hacking code worth your life, or just a few neodollars more?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Deduction, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Don't Panic Games, Egmont Polska, Ynnis Éditions

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Poison Ivy (New 52)
description:
With this new profile, Poison Ivy has developed her toxin’s power to its ultimate level, and is now capable of dealing a mortal blow to those foolish enough to get up close and personal.

This iteration of Ivy is more prone to melee attack damage than her previous corebox iteration, but she has some new heavy protection, who will ensure that she only suffers what they cannot take on her behalf. Keeping her protected is our recommendation.

Poison Ivy (New 52) can be played, with the Carnivorous Plants Rex in Versus mode.

She also can be played, with the corebox’s Carnivorous Plants in Adventure Mode’s missions:


Plants Invasion
Jungle Madness (Wayne Manor expansion)
Every mission from the Suicide Squad expansion’s campaign (Crocodile Day and the others), where she can be accompanied by her Carnivorous Plants OR her Carnivorous Plants Rex.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Nobody
description:
Bruce Wayne is Nobody’s nemesis.

This assassin’s camouflage armor provides good protection, but its stealth abilities allows Nobody to simply fade out of his enemy’s sight and then strike that fatal blow.

Killing close up or at a distance is an easy task for this martial arts master and moving at heights is a breeze due to his superb agility.

Nobody can be used in the corebox Adventure Mode mission "Like Father, Like Daughter" and is fully recruit able in Versus Mode missions.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Green Team Wins: Gaming Community Promo Pack
description:
Collection of 30 cards for use in the game. There are 10 different new cards in each of the three categories. All of the cards are related to board gaming.

The card content was created through a collaboration with: Gaming with Sidekicks, One Board Family, Board Game Spotlight, and Tantrum House.

—description from the publisher

name: Сказание (Skazanie)
description:
Сказание ("Skazanie") is a fast and dynamic game for 2-4 players. It is easy to learn and explain. This game will take its players on a journey through the ancient Slavic lands and ages long-past, and show them a world of powerful gods, mythical creatures and omens.
The game is played by drawing battle cards and magical cards. Each round consists of rolling a die to determine the player's strength and then playing a battle card, which adds even more strength to the die. Magical cards are utilised to further enhance a player's strength, or to affect negatively the opponent/opponents. The winner of the round is the player with the highest strength after each player has chosen their battle card and magical cards. The game ends when there are no cards left in the drawing piles. The player with the highest score (most rounds won) is considered the winner.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Take That

name: The Artemis Project: First Contact
description:
You have discovered an ancient tablet. If this is deciphered, you will unlock coordinates to new planets where information can be gathered. But beware! Space is a dangerous place.

In The Artemis Project: First Contact, players will roll dice and determine which laboratories to activate. They might invest in cloning, launching items into space, or deciphering the Ancient tablet. Each action taking you one step closer to unlocking planets, establishing a network of satellites between them, and making contact! With time, you will build structures on the planets, all with the goal of harvesting knowledge.

After 16 seasons (rounds) of gameplay, the winner will be the person who accumulated the most points.

—description from the publisher
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: Chamber of Wonders: Don't Gamble With Strangers
description: KS exclusive expansion: 3 new contact cards, 2 areas/buildings and 6 dice.

name: Watch Hockey Get Drunk
description:
It's time to WATCH HOCKEY and GET DRUNK! The perfect hockey drinking game for hockey lovers who enjoy drinking. Gather your friends around a live hockey game on TV and bust out this game to deal out drinks with trivia, challenges, group votes, and even secret actions that only you know to watch out for during the live game.

If you're not into the adult beverages you can easily swap it for something else. The game will still be fun to play. Maybe drink soda instead. Being forced to drink a lot will lead to a burp fest which can be funny. Or maybe choose a more interesting drink like prune juice or milk. Something you'll get sick of really fast and motivate you to play harder.

How drunk will your team get you?
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Arkanolodzy
description:
"Arkanolodzy" is a cooperative card game for 2-4 players.

This game uses 22 major arcana tarot cards.

Players take turns playing cards one at a time, aiming to play all the cards.

Each card has unique abilities which may sometimes help or interfere the players.

If all players successfully play all cards, all players win.

However, if any player is unable to play a card on their turn, all players immediately lose.

-description from designer

name: QUIZscape: Die Zeitreise-Agentur
description:
A box full of surprises, three exciting time travel adventures and a unique combination of quiz questions and escape feeling - that's QUIZscape! The game box is a time machine with which the players must complete three adventures. The novel game concept by Arno Steinwender alternates various puzzles with quiz questions: Wrong answers increase the time pressure! And the game is full of surprises. The title translates to "The Time Travel Agents".

The first stop on the journey through time takes the players to 18th century France. The famous writer Jules Verne is on the brink of making a huge mistake - can the players stop him in time?

The second adventure takes the players right into the legendary Aztec Empire where a group of illegal time-travel-tourists causes chaos.

In the third adventure, the players find themselves in the middle of the Roaring 20s.

The game is suitable for beginners and offers a quick start. veryone can start puzzling right away in just a few steps.

How to play:
The players play together through 3 different adventures. In the process, they have to answer quiz questions and solve puzzles. Additional clues and secret messages are hidden in the box. But be careful: time is running out, and time is deducted for each incorrectly answered quiz question.
Can the players find the clues and solve the questions and puzzles?

name: The Great Turkish War: The Balkans 1683-1699
description:
The Great Turkish War: the Balkans, 1683-1699 is a low- to intermediate-complexity, two-player, strategic-level wargame simulating the fight for the Balkans and the Eastern reaches of the Holy Roman Empire in the late 17th century. In 1683, the Ottomans launched their last major offensive on Vienna. The siege failed thanks to the timely arrival of reinforcements from Poland and the Empire. During the next decades the Holy Roman Empire, Russia, Poland, and Venice engaged the still-powerful Ottomans in the Balkans and in the Aegean. Better leadership and military advances allowed the Austrians to inflict several decisive defeats on the Ottomans and conquer most of Ottoman Hungary. For the first time in centuries, the Turks were in strategic retreat in Europe.

Each game turn represents 1 year. Each hex on the map is approximately 60 km (36 miles) from side to side. Each combat unit represents 3,000 to 6,000 combatants depending on unit type.

—description from the publisher

Published November 2023 in S&T magazine #344 (Jan-Feb 2024)

Note: Players will need to provide two six-sided die to play.

name: Mosaic: GenCon 2022 Promo Pack 2
description:
5-card expansion promo pack containing 5 Technology Cards not in the base game:

Bridge
Ceremonial Burial
Fire Fighting
Corvus
Crane/Wench

All are marked as promo cards with an star in the top right corner.

name: The Shivers: Fangs!
description:
Expansion #1
Series C

A werewolf and vampire descend on Fogmoor Manor, in search of a powerful artifact. But a secretive force lurks in the shadows, pulling the strings and getting the Shivers up to their necks in trouble and chills!

This expansion adds The Creepy Crypt Pop-Up Room, 4 new episode guides, 8 new story cards, and 12 new NPC standees.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle

name: The Shivers: It's All Fun and Games Until...
description:
Expansion #2
Series D

Requires base game and Expansion 1.

A few ghostly former residents of Fogmoor Manor pull the Shivers in for some light-hearted games, but the fun quickly turns diabolical as the family becomes trapped at the mercy of a devious child!

This expansion adds The Naughty Nursery Pop-Up Room, 4 new episode guides, 10 new story cards, and 14 new NPC standees.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle

name: Gli Insospettabili
description:
Gli Insospettabili is a co-operative game in which a Witness and one or more Investigators jointly conduct an investigation to identify the Culprit among the faces of different characters. To do this, however, players will not rely on the Culprit's physical characteristics ("Do they have glasses?", "Do they have blond hair?"), but solely on what they believe to be the Culprit's habits and personality. As you play, you will realise that it is wrong to judge by appearances, but that we do so much more often than we would like to.

One player will play the Witness while all the others will be the Investigators. The Witness will try to guess the Culprit from among the 12 on the table by providing clues that
based on appearance alone. Can you find the Guilty by eliminating the right Suspects?
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Almanac: Treacherous Trails
description:
Travel between Almanac: The Dragon Road and Almanac: The Crystal Peaks and craft a trip that no one has ever taken. The Treacherous Trails pack is a unique deck of encounter cards that will bridge both books of Almanac: The Dragon Road, and The Crystal Peaks so you can play them together!

—description from the publisher

This was originally available through Kickstarter, but was later sold separately. This expansion includes:

15 Treacherous Encounter cards
12 Contract cards
10 Encounter cards
4 Advanced Starting Caravan cards
1 Trail Guide card

name: Real Queen
description: Alternately, the two opponents place a marble on a space of a 7x7 grid. As soon as a player has at least four of his own marbles in a consecutive row, he captures one (or more, in the case of longer rows) of his opponent's marble(s), but must take back at least two of his own with which he formed the winning row, thus suffering a positional disadvantage. An oversized marble called Queen may only be used from the sixth move onwards. If it is part of a winning position, it will earn an additional marble. If the opponent succeeds in a winning position adjacent to it, he has won immediately. As soon as you have no more marbles in your supply, you can move your marbles anywhere you like, but the queen marble is allowed only to move to an adjacent square. You lose if you have only three marbles left on the board.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: The Huntsman Society: Invenire Invisus Edition
description:
Hunting lost treasures is not a job. It is a way of living - a wild way of living. Become a legendary huntsman who finds the most epic treasures and try to get your honorary portrait hung up in the Hall of Fame of The Huntsman Society. Create a team of explorers, travel to unique and dangerous locations and try to grab the rarest treasures you will ever see in your lifetime.

Be aware, treasure hunting is not for the fainthearted. You will need to gather a lot of strength, courage and inventiveness in your team, while strategically keeping an eye on your opponent.

The Huntsman Society is a storytelling, deckbuilding cardgame, where you will need to form a group of explorers, add equipment (stuff) and find the right vehicle(s) to travel to a location where a secret treasure lays hidden. You and your opponent can play event cards on your teams to make their lives easier or harder. In a turn you can send explorers on their adventures, let them overcome negative events, help them by playing positive events or restocking them with needed means. All by playing different cards from your hand. You will then throw a D8 to see if your team is the first to find the treasure at a location. At the end of your turn you can restock your hand with up to 10 playing cards. Every treasure found represent a certain amount of points, whoever collects the needed amount of points (you can decide on that at the beginning of the game with your opponent, making the playing time variable to your liking) wins the game and becomes the greatest Huntsman of all time!!!

The game features 164 unique storytelling artcards that can be combined in many different ways, making for extensive storytelling and new adventures being made every time you play.
The game is best played out loud, making the adventures come to live.

The cards are filled with little quirky jokes and pop-cult references.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Lucky Beach
description:
Lucky Beach is a fast and easy game where players have to reveal beach-themed platelets and to collect as many beach treasures as possible. But hidden beneath all the treasures are crabs and sharks. Crabs immediately steal your treasure away - and with that valuable points - while the fourth drawn shark immediately stops the game.
After three rounds, players count their treasures and the player with the most varied treasures wins!

name: Lützen 1813
description:
The Battle of Lützen 1813 is a grand tactical wargame simulating the confrontation of May 2, 1813 which marked the beginning of the first phase of the German campaign. The Russian-Prussian coalition army is in an offensive attitude, Tsar Alexander and his entourage considering a victory over a desperate Napoleon as probable, his army of conscripts suffering from a weakness in cavalry.
The objective is therefore to obtain a significant victory which will seal the fate of the Confederation of the Rhine under French influence since 1806. Ney's III French corps plays the role of perfect prey in the initial coalition plan which is a kind of Ambush Aiming for the Partial Destruction of the French Imperial Army.
Napoleon, aware of the coalition's intentions, is looking for a decisive victory to put an end to this coalition, the aim of which is to overthrow him has not yet been announced. He must destroy the opposing army. But such a providential victory rests on a bold maneuver of refusal from his right to attract the enemy, take Leipzig and fall to his rear. But without effective light cavalry to inform him about the coalition movements, Napoleon advanced in a certain fog...

Lützen 1813 (Vae Victis 169) uses the same system as Bautzen 1813 published in VaeVictis 150.

One round = 1 hour
One counter = 1 division or brigade
Complexity: 6/10
Solo playability: 8/10
Duration: 2 to 3 hours

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Mini Escapes: Ultimo Viaggio in Antartide
description:
Emily Mound is on the hunt again, but this time she must do so under extreme conditions, among the desolate glaciers of Antarctica. An alien mystery is hiding, waiting to be revealed....

Mini Escapes: Ultimo Viaggio in Antartide is the third episode of Mini Escapes and contains 3 foldable Escape rooms of 45-60 minutes each. They are playable individually, but all of them together will immerse you in a compelling story! Check the difficulty of the scenarios on the back of the box, gather with your group of friends, and scan the QR code to start your game.

Each Mini Escapes is structured around a large "folded" sheet that fits in a pocket, to be carried and played anywhere! Open it following the instructions, with the helpful app at hand, and get the wheels turning!

Important: You need to use your smartphone, PC or tablet to play Mini Escapes.

–description from publisher

name: Requiem: Cosma Promo Miniature
description:
A promo resin miniature included with Ashes Magazine: Modena Play 2022 #7 from Ludus Magnus Studio. It contains rules to be used in Black Rose Wars, Black Rose Wars Rebirth, Black Rose Wars Lex, Nova Aetas Renaissance and Chamber of Wonders.


Exclusive Promo bicolor PVC Miniature: Cosma
1x Mage Card, 3x Personal Spell Cards (to play Cosma as Mage in Black Rose Wars)
17x Action Cards, 1x Event Card, 1x Reward Card (to play Cosma, as a prey in a Hunt mission in Nova Aetas Renaissance)
1x Contact Card (for Chamber of Wonders)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Renaissance

name: SIXEM
description:
You’d better roll FAST to beat family and friends in this high intensity dice game.

Give the spinner a whirl to name the pattern, and the frenzy begins! The first player to match the pattern with six Xs in a row wins! Pick your dice to win or to sabotage by removing Xs from your opponents’ boards.

Six dice. Six rows. Endless kicks as you roll to six!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Take That

name: Dorfromantik: Expansion Content from The Duel
description:
The game material for the expansion for Dorfromantik: The Board Game comes in the box of Dorfromantik: The Duel.

There are 4 special tiles, 7 new order tiles, 4 more success cards and more counters.

The success cards are in German language.
categories: City Building, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: OMSHANTI
description:
2 Player tabletop game with an instant magical hook... Balls that Glide!

Omshanti is easy to play. It involves 2 players racing to get their marker home by gliding the game’s 3 balls along the roll out playing pitch. This skilful and satisfying action of gliding the balls with precise speed to land in your target zone, is the key to the games instant and long term appeal.

—description from the publisher

name: 六華 (Rikka)
description:
Rikka is a game that simply recreates the experience of the popular traditional game Mahjong. The aim is to complete the "role" faster than anyone else by exchanging the 6 tiles in your hand with the tiles on the field. There are only three types of roles, and the feature is that anyone can play easily.

When it's your turn, just draw one tile from the field and discard one. Although it is a simple action, you can change the hand you are aiming for by switching the tiles in your hand up and down, and you will notice that there are many options.
The game ends when someone completes a role, and they take scoring chips according to their role.

The person who collects 10 or more scoring chips will gain fame as a fireworks master!

name: Explorers of Navoria: Forgotten Lands
description:
New paths lead to forgotten lands, and with that comes a host of exciting possibilities!

Explorers or Navoria: Forgotten Lands brings a huge range of new content that changes how the game plays. Players will now have asymmetrical powers, and new starting equipment. There is also a new worker location and a brand new deck of cards.

Bonuses at the end of the explorer tracks are now replaced with variable scoring objectives, and there are additional faction bonuses for reaching the end of the explorer tracks first.

Additionally, each round will have a unique scoring objective. Will you play the short game and aim for the current objective, or plan ahead and try to score big later in the game?

Explorers of Navoria also comes with all the components needed to play the game with five players. PLUS it now has a solo campaign, that has three difficulty levels and variable side missions, making each solo game highly repayable.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Ratjack
description:
Welcome to the Ratcity Casino! Here, rats, weasels and rodents of all kinds gather to play Ratjack. Paws are sweaty, whiskers are quivering, the cards are dealt... it's your turn to play.

Each deck in Ratjack has 12 cards with values from 1 to 12 each with a special ability. A central draw pile is created by picking and shuffling together 2 decks. Players start with a card face-down in front of them and a single card in hand.
When their turn comes, they draw a single card from the central deck and either :

Place a card face-down in front of them
Play a card face-up in front of them and activate its ability
Discard a card to flip over one of their face-down cards and activate its ability


At any point in the game, a player with more than 25 in value in front of them is taken out. Card abilities are interactive effects which allow to manipulate cards and their value.
Players win victory points by taking out their opponents, be the last player standing and exactly reach 25!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That
publishers: Frosted Games, Studio H, White Goblin Games

name: Dreamscape Kingdoms
description:
Become one of the Dreamscape Weavers, mighty overlords who seeks to expand their influence over the eternal realm of Dreamland. Deploy your loyal minions to the Dreamland where they will scatter and mark your territory according to orders you gave to them. Only the most influential Dreamscape Weavers will grant the power to rule the dreamlands. There are many Dreamscape Kingdoms to fight for. Would you prefer to deploy your minions to bigger terrain of Lumina or Zephyra or would you like to send them to safer but smaller ones like Nixia or Ventia? It is your decision to make, in every round unexpected things can happen leading to your enemies taking over your lands! Also don't forget about the Nightmare Machine that can get in your way. Will you master the challenge and become the most powerful Weaver at the end of the game?

Dreamscape Kingdoms is a roll and write print and play game prepared for 1 to 4 players, age 8 and up in which you will become Dreamscape Waver and fight for the most influence over various kingdoms. You will Roll the Dice, draft one of them and use it to send your minions to various positions gaining influence over the map. Places you captured will give you power of influence depending on how many terrains you got and how many minions and terrain you have captured in one of many Dreamscape Kingdoms. The game takes 30-60 minutes to play, but it is full of satisfying decisions to make! If you like Territory Control Games you should try this one for sure!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection

name: Skulls of Sedlec: Expansion Collection II
description:
A wallet collection of three previously released 6-card expansions for Skulls of Sedlec:


Executioners
Castle Guards
Poets
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Unfathomable: From the Abyss
description:
In From the Abyss, a new expansion for Unfathomable, the SS Atlantica and its journey to Boston are submerged in even deeper peril. New, horrifying monsters emerge from the depths of the Atlantic Ocean to assail the ship, and the waters of the ocean itself have grown violent enough to sweep the passengers overboard. New treacheries are here to sabotage the ship, and with the mythos deck doubling in size, fresh dangers will threaten the Atlantica at every turn.

Fortunately, the humans aboard this ship have some new tools at their disposal. In addition to eight new playable characters, players now have access to ally cards that move around the ship independently and help keep it afloat. New prelude cards can alter the conditions at the start of the game, providing even more variety so that no two games ever play out the same way. With new skills, items, and the brand-new boon cards, the struggle for the SS Atlantica has never been this fierce!

A new expansion for Unfathomable, featuring expanded content and several new mechanics:

Rescuing passengers now grants players access to allies, who can provide aid to the humans in all sorts of useful ways.
Three new monsters known as “horrors”—the Shoggoth, the Drowned Spirit, and the Grasping Tendril—assail the ship, each of them incredibly dangerous and difficult to defeat.
New prelude cards come in three different varieties and change the conditions at the start of the game, adding unfathomable levels of replayability.
With additional playable characters, items, skills, and more, this expansion builds upon the base game to bring players more of everything that makes Unfathomable such a thrill to play!


—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Fantasy Flight Games, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: SETI: Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence
description:
In SETI: Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence, a eurogame for 1–4 players, you lead a scientific institution tasked with searching for traces of life beyond planet Earth. The game draws inspiration from current or emerging technologies and efforts in space exploration.

Players will explore nearby planets and their moons by launching probes from Earth while taking advantage of ever-shifting planetary positions. Decide whether to land on their surface to collect valuable samples, or stay in orbit for a broader survey. Additionally, by directing your telescopes to gaze into distant star systems, you may detect traces of alien signals or undiscovered exoplanets, and collect promising data to examine and study back home.

Back on Earth, you can invest in upgrading your equipment so you can analyze incoming data more efficiently, boost your telescope signal capacity, or increase your supply of resources—all to expand the scope of your search that could lead to a discovery of extraterrestrial life forms.

You will also make use of over 200 cards to aid your efforts or focus your research in a particular direction for additional bonuses and rewards. Each card has unique effects and illustrations and depicts real-life technologies, projects, and discoveries (like the ISS, Large Hadron Collider, Perseverance rover, Voyager probe, and many more).

Finding traces of extraterrestrial life is only a matter of time—utilize the resources you have at your disposal strategically and you may well end up being the one to make the biggest scientific contribution towards advancing our understanding of alien life within our galaxy.

SETI: Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence pays homage to space and planetary exploration, astronomy, the ongoing search for signs of life in the vastness of space, and efforts to understand the nature of life in the universe.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Income, Multi-Use Cards, Resource to Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up

name: Built in a Day
description:
Great civilizations built great things. Most of these great structures took years to build. Now you can take on the role of these great civilizations and build something great in just a day!

Built in a day is a competitive tile laying game for 1-4 players. You can play as Greece, Egypt, Babylon, or China as you compete with the other players to build one of ten floor plans. The end of the game is triggered when one player completes their building but the player with the most uniform building will win.

name: Hindenburg's War: Decision in the Trenches, 1918
description:
Hindenburg’s War: Decision in the Trenches, 1918 (HW) is a strategic-level, two-player wargame of low complexity that covers the fighting on World War I’s western front during that final year of the war, from the start of the first German offensive on 21 March through Armistice Day on 11 November. The game’s sub-systems are crafted to present a supreme-commander’s-eye-view of the war: it is therefore almost fully strategic in its perspective, with only the most pastel of operational undertones added to enhance historical tone and texture.
Each hex on the map represents 9.31 miles (15 km) when measured from side to opposite side. Each full turn of play, other than the first and last, represents half-a-month. Every combat unit in the game represents one division of infantry or one brigade of tanks.

Components: Two 22" x 34" map & 456 counters.

name: Vin mystère
description:
Mystery wine
a friendly wine tasting game
Mystery Wine offers you to discover a bottle of wine by part by focusing on its visual properties, its odor, its taste, its grape variety, its country of origin and its age.

Taste, bet, discover, and who knows, win the game!

100 mystery wines to discover
To play, go to the SAQ to get a bottle for the party, armed with the fabric cover and one of the 100 mystery sheets available in the box.

The employee of the SAQ can scan the barcode in the upper corner of the card and on the card and bring it into its cache. So everyone can play!

Created by Jessica Harnois, sommelier.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Vin mystère
un jeu de dégustation de vin convivial
Vin mystère vous propose de découvrir une bouteille de vin par partie en misant sur ses propriétés visuelles, olfactives et gustatives, sa pastille de goût, son cépage, son pays d’origine et son millésime.

Dégustez, misez, découvrez, et qui sait, gagnez la partie!

100 vins mystères à découvrir
Pour jouer, rendez-vous à la SAQ pour vous procurer une bouteille pour la partie, armé de la cache en tissus ainsi que d’une des 100 fiches mystère disponibles dans la boite.

L’employé de la SAQ pourra scanner le code-barre dans le coin supérieur de la fiche et sur la fiche et vous l’apporter dans sa cache. Ainsi, tout le monde pourra jouer!

Créé par Jessica Harnois, sommelière.

—description from the publisher

name: TOTEZ
description:
Seek, steal and hoard the scattered idols before time runs out! Press your luck in this fast-paced card game for 2-6 players.

TOTEZ... in the continent of Melixavar, the Totezca Empire blossoms. It is time for the Festival of Tokens – a ritualistic challenge where the faithful compete for the favour of ancient gods. You are a High Priest of the Stars, leader to many and one of the competitors.

During the opening ceremonies (setup), the amount of tribute demanded by the gods (goal) is revealed. This will vary depending on how many priests (players) are competing. Every day (turn), you will seek idols (god cards) scattered across the field (deck) or steal them from other priests. During the festival, all tactics (action + utility cards) are allowed! You may pillage, sneak, hoard and block others from gaining ground. Press your luck and collect as many sets of idols (tokens) as you can before time runs out (all cards are discarded).

At the end of each month (round), all idols collected are tallied and standings revealed to all competitors. The priest to reach or surpass the tribute demanded by the gods, wins their favour (game).

name: Play Soccer
description:
Play Soccer is a fun and simple card game inspired by video games and football cards. You will have to form the line-up that best combines the skills of your players to score the most victory points and win the game.

At the start of the game each player receives 10 player cards and 1 goalkeeper card to place in their playing area to create a 1-4-4-2 formation.

Each turn you can take a player card from the transfer market and replace it with another card from the line-up. Each player has different skills: tackling, crossing, passing, shooting and foot dominant. Depending on where each player is in the line-up and how he is combined with other player cards, victory points will be awarded. In addition, goalkeeper cards function as goals that can bring extra points.

The game comes to an end when the cards in the player draw deck are used up. Whoever has the most victory points wins the game.


Play Soccer es un divertido y sencillo juego de cartas inspirado en videojuegos y cromos de fútbol. Tendrás que formar la alineación que mejor combine las habilidades de tus futbolistas para lograr la mayor cantidad de puntos de victoria y alzarte con la victoria.

Al comienzo de la partida cada persona recibe 10 cartas de futbolistas y 1 carta de guardameta para situarlas en su zona de juego creando una formación 1-4-4-2.

En cada turno se puede coger una carta de futbolista del mercado de fichajes y sustituirla por otra carta de la alineación. Cada futbolista tiene diferentes habilidades: entrada, centro, pase, tiro y pie dominante. Dependiendo del lugar que ocupe cada futbolista en la alineación y de cómo se combine con otras cartas de futbolista, se obtendrán puntos de victoria. Además, las cartas de guardameta funcionan como objetivos que pueden aportar puntos extra.

La partida llega a su fin cuando se acaben las cartas del mazo de robo de futbolistas. Quien tenga más puntos de victoria, se llevará la victoria.
categories: Card Game, Puzzle, Sports, Video Game Theme
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Matching, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: On to Richmond American Civil War Miniature Rules
description: Brigade level CW miniatures rules.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Swamp Devils from Blood Bayou!
description:
They came from the swamp! Finny fiends dedicated to one goal - the return of their dread and eldritch masters to the mortal plane so that they might subjugate the human race forever!

But that's against the law in these parts - and so our handsome leading man Sheriff Harkins heads into Blood Bayou with a posse in tow. Soon he will be joined by the mysterious Professor Saunders, his glamorous daughter Charlotte, and a ragtag band of outlaws, scientists, and character actors. Will they close the portal in the final reel, or will they be a light snack for hungry Elder Gods?

Designer David Cuatt's Swamp Devils From Blood Bayou is a love-letter to a monster movie that never was, with a fast-and-fun chit-pull combat mechanism that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

One player controls the desperate humans, and one the Swamp Devils and their dread masters, the Abominations. It's an I-Go-U-Go turn sequence. Many of the human characters, and the Abominations, have special abilities that break the rules in some fashion. There are multiple victory conditions for each side-- do the humans want to perform an arcane ritual to banish the Swamp Devils, or research a more purely scientific solution? Or maybe brute force will do it, by hunting down the Abominations and showing 'em what-for. On the other side of things, the Swamp Devils might want to concentrate on infiltrating the town, or on killing off the humans with top billing.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Sunrise in Moloka'i
description:
This casual narrative legacy game presents a series of events that happen on the Hawaiian island of Moloka'i in the early morning. Each chapter will tell the story of a different character on the island and give the player a chance to help the character overcome a challenge. After completing all the challenges, score your results and use them to complete the story in the epilogue, the story of the sunrise.

This game was developed as an entry in the 2019 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest, where it won several awards, including:

#1 Best Legacy Game
#2 Most Innovative Mechanic
#3 Most Thematic Game (Island, Vignette)
#4 Best Rulebook
#5 Best Solitaire Game
#8 Best Overall Game


—description from the publisher

name: Beverage
description:
Worker placement with a bidding element.
Players take on the role of a CEO in a beverage company. You, along with your rivals have agreed to help fund the creation of a new stadium in your city. However, only the company with the highest reputation will be allowed to sell their drinks inside.

A round starts with bidding for how much money you will get to use in a round. This money is then used to pay for actions around the board.

Once the local stadium is complete, the game will end. A cutthroat game from Japan; Beverage combines the nostalgic with the modern.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Worker Placement

name: President Zeus
description:
Geopolitical problems are so much easier to solve when you can hurl lightning at them. All of the Greek Gods in this game have special powers and can deal with international situations in their own way.

Not only can you, as one of them, gain influence and create fantastic achievements, but you can use powers of other Gods too — as long as you give them influence. In the end, the one that generates enough influence to replace Zeus as president is the winner!

—description from the publisher

name: Crazyhouse
description:
Crazyhouse is a chess variant very similar to bughouse chess, but with only two players. It effectively incorporates a rule in shogi (Japanese chess), in which a player can introduce a captured piece back to the board as his own.

* A captured piece reverses color (useful to have 2 sets on hand for this variant) and goes to the capturing player's 'reserve', or 'pocket'. At any time, instead of making a move with a piece on a board, a player can 'drop' a piece, in his reserve, onto an empty square on the board.
* Promoted but captured pawns are dropped as pawns.
* Pawns must not be dropped on the 1st or 8th ranks.
* Drops which cause immediate checkmate are allowed. Unlike in shogi, this includes pawn drops.
* A check that would cause checkmate, in regular chess, can be answered if the defender can make a legal drop which blocks the check.

name: La casa delle mannaie
description:
In this horror-themed game ("La casa delle mannaie" means "The house of cleavers"), players enters the old Crin manor, scene of a bloody carnage in 1974, trying to retrieve some of the old precious coins that the eldest son of the Crins collected.

But the curse of the house will corrupt the minds of people who enter searching for the gold, making them ready for do anything to get all the coins.

A player can win being the last man standing, or regaining his/her sanity and escaping the house, or having the less wounds and most coins at the end of the seventh turn.
mechanics: Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Sudden Death Ending

name: Rikken
description:
Rikken is a cardgame popular in Noord-Brabant (The Netherlands) and parts of Belgium. The 4 player cardgame is related to Whist and Bridge. In addition to the general rules, each region has its own set of minor rules. The games dates +/- 1950.

The game is played with 52 cards (a deck without jokers). Each round starts with the player left to the dealer making the first bid. There are many different bids possible, due to the different rules per region. However, the most commen bids are (in order):

- Pass: the player does not make a bid
- Rik: score 8 (with a mate)
- Piek: score exactly one (alone)
- Miseré: score 0 (alone)
- 9 or 10 alone: score 9 or 10 (alone)

After the bidding ends (players can over-bid eachother), the winning player announces the following:

- requested ace: the player who won the bid requests an ace. This must be an ace that he does not have himself. The player who does have this ace will be his mate for the current round. If the bid is a "rik", then the 2 players together have to score 8 and the other 2 players try to prevent this. If the player plays alone (for example "piek" bid), he does not request an ace and just plays alone versus the 3 others.
- choose the trump ("troef"): the player who won the bid also choses one colors to be the trump. The trump cards are worth the most for this round (similair to "Hearts").

The round starts with the player left to the dealer playing his first card. The next player has to play a card of the same color. If that is not possible he can play any other card. The player with the highest card in a matching color scores. However, a "troef" card tops all other colors. Meaning players can "steal" a turn by playing a "troef" card. The round ends when all cards are played.

name: Oh! My Fish Head
description:
You are a talented Fisherman. Do your best to get more fish and Bonus Catch including precious treasure or Rainbonus Fish. Try to connect more Fish Cards within the limit time and utilize gene mutation fish to get more chance to win！

How to play:

In your turn, draw 1 Fish Card and place it under any front row Bobber. If you place the card as the 3rd position under a Bobber Token, you will get the Bobber Token and all Fish Cards under the Bobber.

You have to place all Fish Cards that you got this round into your Fishing Rod Area. (Each player owns 3 Fishing Rod Areas) You can‛t keep them for next round. Each Fishing Rod Area can only place the cards with same color.

If you get a Fish Card that you can‛t connect, you can break your Fishing Rod during connecting your fish. Turn the Fishing Tackle Tokens of this area to Scoop Net side. The player who get Scoop Net can draw Bonus Catch from Bonus Catch Sack.

If you complete a fish, it means the fish is on the hook now! Face them up in Complete Fish Zone. These Fish Cards will be
counted as points in the end of the game.

When the game reaches the 7th round and all players complete Catch Action, the game ends. Each Fish Card get 1 point. Check the "longest" fish for each color and give Trophy Card to the onwer. If you get Trophy Card of one color, each Fish Card of that color will get 2 points.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Bambam Booboo
description: Bambam Booboo is an abstract strategic tile placement and movement game for 2 players only. Players first place all their (bamboo) tiles, then move or again place their tiles, all the time trying to create 1 of 3 patterns (consisting of 4 tiles each) that will win them the game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Rootword
description:
In Rootword, each player builds and scores words by playing roots, extending the roots with more letters, and then finishing them off with yet more letters. Longer words are worth more, so extend your roots as long as you like, but watch out! Any root still on the table can be stolen by another player if they can extend it. (from the rulebook)

Letter Cards Deck (104 cards)
Turn Summary Cards Deck (6 cards)
Rules Document
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Jiku Kansho
description:
Jiku Kansho is a game about controlling the future by affecting the present and the past. Players choose and keep special properties which potentially affect the future. These properties would bring you more properties, avoid an unexpected future, or block your rivals. When the farthest future is reached, the player with the most valuable properties wins the game. However your aim isn't just to have more and more properties. The value of a property will be chosen by the future. So, choose your future!

What's the meaning of the title Jiku-Kansho?
The direct translation of the title is 'Interfere of Time and Space'. Jiku = Time and Space, Kansho = Interfere.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Phase Order

name: Magic: The Gathering – Ninth Edition Core Set
description:
Ninth Edition Core Set was a "Core Set" expansion for Magic: The Gathering.

The expansion featured 350 cards. It also featured randomly inserted premium black-bordered versions of all cards in the set. There were also 9 fixed cards in the Core Game (Starter Set), which made the entire expansion set 359 cards.

Ninth Edition Core Set was sold in 15 Card Booster Packs (Random Cards), 5 Theme Decks, a Fat Pack, and a Core Game (2 Player Starter Set).

The 350 cards available in the Booster Packs included 110 Uncommon, 110 Common, 110 Rare, and 20 Basic Lands.

The Core Game (Starter Set) contained 2 x 33 Card Fixed Preconstructed Starter Decks to play a guided start game. It also included a 14 Fixed Card Advanced Booster Pack. The 14 card advanced booster pack was designed to be added to the two starter decks (7 cards each) to make 2 x 40 card decks for play after playing the guided start game. The Core Game also included items like paper foldout playmats w/cardboard life counters, Player Guides to play the guided starter game, and a Rulebook to introduce new players to Magic: The Gathering.

The Core Game's two 40 fixed card decks included 64 cards from the main 350 expansion set, and 16 cards from 9 cards included only from the Core Game.

The 5 Theme Decks each had 40 Fixed Cards from the main 350 expansion set:


Army of Justice (White)
Custom Creatures (Green)
Dead Again (Black)
Lofty Heights (Blue)
World Aflame (Red)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Wreck Raiders: The Shark
description: A kickstarter exclusive mini-expansion for the game Wreck Raiders where you can add a shark to the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Beer & Pretzels
description:
The perfect light-strategy Steam and Age of Steam map that's also a complementary map to the new Beer & Pretzels standalone game. This expansion is only available through preorders.

If you need a break from the euro-hassle of victory points and A/P prone players who are trying to optimize the number of shares they take, then this is the map for you. No VPs. No income or share track. And best of all, no expenses. You get cash money when you make a delivery. And whoever has the most money at the end of the game wins. Simple enough that casual gamers can get Steamed. This is the anti-18xx train experience that even 18xxers will find engaging.

Part of the Bézier Games 2009 Essen package (which includes Age of Steam Expansion: Alabama Railways, Antebellum Louisiana & Four Corners, Age of Steam Expansion: 1867 Georgia Reconstruction, South Carolina & Oklahoma Land Rush & Age of Steam Expansion: Beer & Pretzels).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: How to Host a Murder: Archaeologically Speaking, It's the Pits
description:
A MATTER OF FAXE ARCHAEOLOGICALLY SPEAKING, IT'S THE PITS
Arthur E. Faxe, the eccentric entrepreneur and amateur archaeologist, sails this month for ancient Mesopotamia in search of human fossils and in the hope of proving the Darwinian Theory of Evolution. Faxe has chosen a region of the Tigris-Euphrates Valley known since ancient times as Vages for the site of his expedition. This area is distinguished by an immense and prominent boulder that can be seen for miles and is known locally as the Rock of Vages. A small cleft, or opening, at the base of the rock is the site of an unusual collection of fossils. The cleft, discovered in 1854 by French archaeologist, Henri Formie, is described in scientific literature as Rock of Vages, Cleft Formie. By arrangement with the local government, Faxe and his entourage will establish an extensive camp in an abandoned military fort near the archaeological site and overlooking the Tigris River.

Faxe advises, "We are endeavoring to locate evidence in fossil form of the existence of an ancient human or near-human ancestor. I have spared no expense to see that my staff and guests are provided with the most modern of equipment necessary for their research and the essentials necessary for their comfort."

Purveyors of goods to the expedition advise that no less than fifty cases of fine wines and champagnes will accompany Faxe along with appropriate linen, silver and china, tables, chairs, canopies and tents, as well as a quantity of armaments for hunting and defense against bands of brigands which are known to roam the area. A domestic staff of thirty will be on hand, as well as an archaeological research team of seven.

The expedition, by arrangement with the Turkish government, will occupy an old fortress situated near the site of the dig. The fort, unused by the present government but once a key military post, is called Fort Ap Aachih.

CHARACTERS
Terra Sunder, Major General E. B. Sawtedd, Lester A. Fayre, Lady Melissa N. Lynke, Anne T. Ickwitee, Hamilton MacTorr, Ashley R. Sonnyste, Conrad Iver

name: 18SS
description:
18SS is a Japanese 18xx game, apparently without a historical location. While the rules are as-yet-untranslated, it appears to be not dissimilar to the rest of its family - a combination of stock manipulation, route-building, and capital management.

A few details: there are 14 companies, one central "big" city, highly variable off-boards.

More details to come as translation efforts begin.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Resident Evil Deck Building Game: Alyssa Ashcroft Promo
description:
It was given at League Play Dec 2011

Alyssa Ashcroft

Level 1 (2): When Alyssa explores, if she is only using 1 weapon, you can pay 20 ammo. In that case, that weapon gets +10 damage during this turn.

Level 2 (5): During your turn, you can name a card type. In that case, reveal the top card of your inventory, if the revealed card was the named type, draw it and you get +1 explore during this turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #9
description:
The Mayfair Games Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #9 is composed of 2 expansions:

Patrician: The Messengers (part 1)
The patricians have messengers to stay informed about the activities of the others. By that they can achieve additional prestige points or lose some.

Hot Tin Roof: Deluxe Catwalks
Adds 4 tiles and the following rules to the base game:

1. During setup, each player must take 1 deluxe catwalk in his own color.
2. As soon as ALL players have earned at least 1 fish tile from the fish market, you may place your deluxe catwalk instead of 1 of your regular catwalks. Any cat that crosses a deluxe catwalk must pay the owner 2 instead of the usual 1.

This is available in Game Trade Magazine (Issue 174 - Aug 2014).

name: Polonka 1660
description:
The Battle of Polonka (Połonka) took place near Połonka (modern Belarus) during the Polish-Russian War (1658-1667) on 29 June 1660 between Polish-Lithuanian forced, led by Paweł Jan Sapieha and Stefan Czarnecki and Russian army, led by Ivan Khovansky. Thanks to the well made battle plan, tactical advantage and much more experienced and skilled troops, battle was a big victory of Polish-Lithuanian units, despite the fact that both sides have almost the same number of solders.

Game uses "Husaria" system and covers all three stages of the battle, including initial skirmishes and full battle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: WISP
description:
WISP is the new trick-taking card game that is recognisably different from some established trick-taking games. The core differences include the following aspects:


You can compete as a team or individually.
There are no "normal" cards that are hierarchically equal. So you can get into trick-taking incredibly quickly.
It will always be dealt the same number of cards.
The announcement of a trick to be taken is an inferior element, which exists only in the team variant.


Welcome to the world of mythical creatures and have fun dueling!

name: Escaping Earth
description:
Escaping Earth is a semi-cooperative building game with bluffing elements suited for 2 to 4 players. Each player builds a functional civilization and/or confederation rocket to fly into space. The game is won by the player who has the most surviving astronauts in their ship.
A civilization ship must be able to fly. Otherwise, there is no winner of the game.
During building the civilization ship you can follow different strategies:

Build a civilization ship together to place astronauts there.
Sabotage building the civilization ship to push your own confederation ship.
Push building of both ships.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Events, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement

name: Talisman (Third Edition): White Dwarf #179 Characters
description:
In the run up to the release of the Talisman (Third Edition): City of Adventure, Games Workshop released two new Characters as part of an advertising feature in their house magazine, White Dwarf #179.

These Characters were the Ogre and Dark Elf.

The cards featured miniatures taken from GW's tabletop game, Warhammer.

The Ogre was released again in 2002 as part of the Talisman (Third Edition): Lost Characters PDF on the GW website.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Carthago: Merchants & Guilds – Support of the Guilds
description:
Promo Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 for Day 18.

The Support of the Guilds mini-expansion offer players permanent in-game abilities in addition to earning victory points at the end of the game! The 6 new tiles may be used in any combination with the Achievement Tiles (AT) from the base game.

The tiles offer additional ways for players to earn points at the end of the game or, in exchange for the potential to earn extra points, players can take an additional turn during the game.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Trading, Worker Placement

name: On Pointe: The Ballet Board Game
description:
Experience life as a ballet dancer, from the Barre to a Star. Earn your pointe shoes and tutu; collect gems, treasures and the tiara.

In On Pointe players use dance moves as shown on the deck of cards to move through the game from the first dance studio through rehearsal and eventually to the stage. Players stop at certain intervals in the game to collect gems, which are worth 3 points and treasures, which are worth 2 points.

Each player has a score card where they accumulate the items for later end-of-game scoring. Points are also awarded for landing on the Pas de Deux squares, the Prima Ballerina square where one player will get the tiara and the final stage square for the bouquet and bow.

In addition to the cards, each player has five 'Position Tokens' each of which can only be used once and then is turned over after executing the given 'power-up' move or action.
