description: A set of the 6 character sheets which give each playable vampire a one time per game ability. These were handed out at conventions or as a bonus for pre-ordering the base game through Renegade Games website.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck
publishers: Cranio Creations, Origames, Renegade Game Studios

name: Flesh and Blood: Classic Battles – Rhinar vs Dorinthea
description:
Designed to welcome new players to the world of Flesh and Blood, Classic Battles: Rhinar vs Dorinthea includes two 40-card decks ready to play out of the box, Cold Foil hero and weapon cards, Rainbow Foil equipment, full art mentors, a quickstart playmat, and a 48 page illustrated lore booklet telling the tale of these heroes and how their classic battle became stuff of legend.

A beautiful product for new players, casual gamers, collectors, and fans of Rhinar and Dorinthea alike.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: AXO
description:
AXO is a game of perspective where you will optimize your hand of cards, carefully deciding which use to score AXO Points and which make available to the other players.

Complete your cards filling the Area of Application on them. Exploit the effects of the Polyomino cards that you will be able to obtain, activating them at the right moment to win the challenge against your rivals and beat them to the punch!

The game ends when a player reaches 9 AXO Points, but the winner will be the one with the highest score.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Bingo, Grid Coverage, Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Chili Mafia: Goodfellas Expansion
description:
Chili Mafia is a fun 2-8 player set-collection party card game that plays in 20-40 minutes. Play individually or in teams, and build chili pepper gangs to score the most points.

Feel like turning up the heat of the base game? The Goodfellas Expansion is just the right choice for you then! There are new characters on the scene, each with their own special ability.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mafia

name: Third Option: Global Clandestine Operations
description:
Third Option is a solitaire game played on a mission mat where the player selects, deploys, and maneuvers teams and assets representing U.S. clandestine services with an emphasis on paramilitary operations against adversaries around the world. A “Phase” system is used along with dice, cards, and counters to play out varied missions. The world map is divided into the six Areas of Operations for the United States Military Central Command. Within these geographical areas, the Special Operations Command known as SOCOM, and the U.S. Intelligence apparatus execute highly covert actions against hostile forces who threaten the national security interests of the United States and its allies. Missions that require the use of highly covert methods and plausible deniability by the government are carried out by the Central Intelligence Agency, Special Activities Center (SAC) also known as the “Third Option”.
As the player, you take control of the highly secretive Special Activities Center division in order to plan and execute missions in dangerous, volatile, and unpredictable areas across the globe. The careful and detailed planning, reconnaissance, and execution of missions assigned will determine the success of the individual missions and/or a combination of missions to make up operations. Gameplay is divided into three easy-to-follow Phases clearly identified in the rulebook, flowchart, and Mission Mat for easy reference.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Diggy Diggy Dwarf
description:
After hearing about the discovery of diamonds, the dwarves immediately set off to establish a new mine in search of the treasures beneath the earth.

Each player controls a dwarf and attempts to explore and expand the mine, collect treasures, and thwart the other dwarves through clever play of their cards.

During the game, players will construct their card decks, gather new and improved action cards, and purchase valuable jewelry using the ores they discover. Without scruples, they will fill in the shafts dug by others, and mischievous fingers may occasionally snatch a gold card or two. After all, in the end, only one dwarf can claim the title of the richest dwarf!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hidden Victory Points, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Memory, Modular Board, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Cattitude
description:
In the Cattorian era, the members of the cat elite like to show off their sophistication by collecting birds without eating them.
Have your noble cats collect as many birds as possible, but beware of cats that can’t control their instincts: the birdoholics. Score the most points with your palace to win this tactical bluffing game!

Cattitude is a 2 to 5 player card game about bluffing and set collection. Players receive cards with birds in their hand and they try to match as many cards with the same bird with each other and one noble cat. Each turn players give cards to their neighbours through a bluffing give and receive system. Giving away the best cards without giving to much and not reveiling what you want to keep yourself is the key to winning the game. The game ends when the stack of cards is empty. The player with the most birds wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Matching, Set Collection

name: Cascade
description:
Goal
Be the first to complete your 4x4 grid of cards with each row and column in increasing order. Duplicate numbers can be placed next to each other, Aces are low, and a card’s suit doesn’t matter.

Setup
Deal 4 cards to each player. Each player places their 4 cards along the diagonal of a 4x4 grid in any order.

How to Play
On your turn, either:

Draw the top card of the deck, or
Take a card from the discard (all previously discarded cards are available)


Then, with that card, you can either:

Discard it, or
Place it anywhere in your grid. If you place it on top of a previously placed card, discard the previous card.


If you place a card diagonally adjacent to another card of the same number, take another turn.

You can’t place a card that would break the increasing order of its column or row.

The first player to complete their grid wins!

—description from the designer

name: Coca-Cola: Polar Rollers Game
description:
Share a smile and pass a pair of Coca-Cola Polar Bears in this lively push-your-luck game! Each turn adds bigger rewards as you roll the bears to match and score. You can stop anytime, or keep rolling for more points...just don’t get frozen out! Enjoy at your next game night!


Roll the wooden Polar Bears like dice to press your luck and score points!
13 double-sided tiles feature all sorts of different ways to score * and are worth more points as the game heats up!


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Matching, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Ahoy: New Horizons
description:
The sea is vast, and there’s always more to discover. As swashbucklers and soldiers on the high seas, you never know what lies ahead, beyond the horizon. New factions, treasure, and creatures fill these waters!

Rumors have been making their way through the port and local tavern: tales of a military regime more fast and vicious than the Bluefin; a rebellion with absurd but effective tactics; tall tales of a gigantic monster with a never-ending body; and a fleet of pirate ships robbing and pillaging with abandon. What to believe?

Ahoy: New Horizons adds four new factions to the asymmetric seas of Ahoy: the Blackfish Brigade, the Shellfire Rebellion, the Leviathan, and the Coral Cap Pirates.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Minecraft Explorers
description:
In Minecraft Explorers, players explore the blocky landscape together looking for hidden treasure.

On your turn, you have action points to spend as you wish. You can explore different landscapes to discover what's on the back of a tile. Pickaxes and swords make some explorations easier, so perhaps you want to get them. Try to uncover the treasure you need to win.

Ideally you can avoid monsters such as Zombies, Creepers, and Endermen because at the end of each turn, you must reveal a monster card, and if this monster is already in play, your group will be overrun and more monsters will appear. Face the horde bravely because as soon as the monster cards are used up, you lose the game. Do you best to fill your chests with treasure before that happens.

name: Memo Animals
description:
Animals have fled and hidden in the bushes, try to find them! In this game you will be training your memory – you are going to look for a pair of identical animals or a group of different animals. The player who gets most victory points for completed tasks (both simple and difficult) becomes the winner.

There are two types of tasks:

simple (1 point), that require to find a pair of identical cards;
difficult (2 points), that require to find a specific group of 4 cards.


On your turn, you open cards one by one. If the first two cards you've opened match each other and a simple task, you can complete this task by taking the Task card.
However, if you decided to continue opening the cards, it means that you are aiming at a difficult task now and cannot gain a simple Task card even if the cards will be matching.

After finishing your turn, close all the cards without changing their position.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Resident Evil Deck Building Game: Cindy Lennox Promo
description:
It was given at League Play Dec 2011

Cindy Lennox

Level 1 (1): When you gain a card with a "herb" it its name, you get +1 buy during this turn.

Level 2 (5): At the beginning of your turn, if Cindy is at full health, Cindy deals an additional 20 damage during this turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Video Game Theme, Zombies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Cards Against Humanity: Nerd Bundle
description:
The Nerd Bundle comes with six different themed packs you forgot to buy when they came out plus ten all-new cards we desperately crammed in at the last second.

Comes with the Fantasy Pack, Geek Pack, Sci-Fi Pack, World Wide Web Pack, A.I. Pack, and Human Pack.
An unbelievable deal on Cards Against Humanity themed packs!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Noch mal! Deluxe
description:
Noch mal! Deluxe uses the same gameplay as Noch mal!, which has also been published as Encore!.

On a turn, a player rolls the three color dice and three number dice, then chooses a color and number pairing that allows them to mark off an area on their personal player board. All other players then choose a color-number combination from the dice that remain. By filling all spaces in a column or of a color, you score bonus points.

Noch mal! Deluxe contains erasable player boards as well as a 3D dice tower that's set up inside the box bottom. What's more, Noch mal! Deluxe contains a co-operative variant played with the same rules in which players need to complete one of the five missions by game's end, whether color bonuses, completed rows, blocks of four, stars, or the spelling of "NOCHMAL". The game contains the original solo variant as well as a solo challenge using the new missions.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wanted Earth
description:
From the beginning earth has remained unnoticed…until now. Various alien races desire earth for their own reasons and will do anything necessary to dominate the planet and its inhabitants. For the first time in history humans have a common enemy. Are you ready?

Wanted Earth is an epic miniatures strategy board game for 1-7 players. Fight as the heroes defending the planet or try to conquer Earth as the invading alien race. For a different experience and to expand the game to include more people, play with the PvP rules where the heroes not only fight the alien invaders but against one another!

Every game is a different experience. Discover unique abilities and play styles with each hero, hero combination, and alien race that you play. Each game consists of an initial six rounds of play for the heroes to prepare to battle the enemy Overlord followed by six rounds to defeat him/her. Solve enigmas to slow down time or bring in new heroes if one has died, buy weapons and armor to prepare, and use your hero abilities to gain every advantage possible.

As you immerse yourself in the Wanted Earth universe, you will discover out of this world art, amazing miniatures, and powerful character abilities. It’s a great gaming experience without all the confusing rules, millions of tiny pieces, and long and tedious setup. It can also be played in 60-120 minutes!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Book of the Astronomican
description:
This 112-page book includes:

43-page 3-part campaign by Rick Priestley
Whitescar Space Marines Army List
Hylgar's Hellraisers Imperial Army Army List
Valerius Borodin Rogue Trader Army List
Claw Nebula Pirates Army List
Luggub's Drop Legion Ork Army List
Eldar Pirates Army List
Some new Imperial Characters


Expands:
Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.S.S. Avenger Expansion Pack
description:
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

I.S.S. Avenger Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 14 expansion packs from WizKids Games. The I.S.S. Avenger is part of the Mirror Universe faction.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Brass Dragon Expansion Pack
description:
Publisher blurb:

Wave 8 Expansion Pack

Bring the heroes, villains, and monsters of Dungeons and Dragons to life in this latest fantasy miniatures game series! Each Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens. Take flight with D&D Attack Wing today!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: La Guerre du Bien Public, Monthléry 1465
description:
La guerre du Bien public 1465 (War of the Public Weal) is a historical simulation from March to December 1465. The Public Weal is lead by the King's of France brother, Charles Duke of Berry, but in reality the Count of Charolais (future Charles the Bold, Duke of Burgundy). The Weal comprises the Duchies of Armagnac, Bourbon, Britany, Burgundy and Lorraine. Opposing them, King Louis XI of France has a strong army but smaller allies such as the Duchies of Milano, Savoy and the County of Foix.

One player plays the role of the Public Weal and the other King Louis XI.
The objectives are to take control of the differents territories (with Paris as a very important one), win pitched battles or major sieges, and neutralise the opponent's allies.

This is both a strategic & tactical game with armies and garrisons evolving on the main strategic map and units fighting on a tactical map featuring a typical XVth century battleground.
Units are men-at-arms, pikes, bowmen, crossbowmen, and early cannons, from 2,000/1.750 men at full strength, 1,000/750 horsemen or 200 cannons of all calibers. The ambience of that period is added with tactical chits (charge, harassment shots, raining arrows, ditch, fence, pike hedgehog, cannon battery) and events such as rain, snow, minor ally, no fight or betrayal, no wing deployment.

The complete sequence of a turn:
I/ France
1) Reinforcement, replacement
2) strategic move
3) attrition phase
4) combat phase (battles & sieges)
II/ Public Weal
Same sequence
III/ Diplomatic phase
Check for victory
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Chit-Pull System

name: フリップオーバー (FLIP OVER)
description:
User summary
フリップオーバー (FLIP OVER) (Furippu O-ba-) is a Japanese game. In FLIP OVER, players play a must-follow trick-taking game.

Before the game begins, determine whether each trick will earn you positive or negative points. Place trick indicator chips with blue number face-up if this trick counts positive, or red-number face-up if negative. The winner of the first trick scores one point or loses one point, two points if second trick, and so on.

Trump cards are determined by rank; if a card's rank is equal to the trick number, it is a trump this trick.

When players play all through the trick numbers, flip over all trick indicator chips. Players retrieve all cards they have played, and play again with the same hands, with reversed positive / negative condition.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins the game.

Publisher's summary
マストフォローのトリックテイキングゲームです。
切り札は、１トリック目では数字の１、２トリック目は数字の２…というようにトリック数と同じランクが切り札になります。

ゲームを始める前にトリックを示したチップを（規則に従って、またはランダムに）数字の順番に並べます。4人プレイでは10トリック行うので、チップも1～10まで10枚あり、その数がそのまま得点になります。チップには青の面と赤の面があり、青の面はプラス点、赤の面はマイナス点になります。１トリック目の勝者は１のチップを、２トリック目の勝者は２を…獲得していきます。

10トリック終えたら、得点を記入してから、チップをテーブル中央に戻し、裏表をひっくり返し（青と赤が逆になる）、同じ手札を使って再度10トリック行います。

2ゲームの合計点の高いプレイヤーが勝者です。

name: IT Startup: Corrupted data
description:
IT Startup - Dirty Tenders introduces 32 new, unique cards. It is self-playable for 2 players, and when combined with the base increases the maximum number of players from 4 to 6. Extends the game with a new employee mode: Project Manager. It also introduces a new game mode: building your own deck.
—description from the designer (translated)

Samodzielny dodatek IT Startup - Brudne Przetargi wprowadza 32 nowe, unikalne karty. Jest samodzielnie grywalny dla 2 graczy, a po połączeniu z podstawką zwiększa maksymalną liczbę graczy z 4 do 6. Rozszerza grę o nowy tryb pracowników: Project Manager. Wprowadza również nowy tryb gry: budowanie własnej talii.
—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Disarm The Base
description:
Disarm The Base is a quick, co-operative game based on direct action. Players need to find and disarm war planes on a base, both avoiding the guards and disarming all the planes before the deck runs out.

Play takes place on a game board representing the base. Tiles representing different war planes are placed face down in hangars on the board. Each turn, players take up to four actions, which include moving around the base, playing cards from their hand, or giving or taking cards. Players then draw cards from a deck, resolving red cards immediately and taking other cards into their hands. Red cards do unfavorable things such as closing gates, placing guards in hangars, and turning on lights; cards in hand allow actions such as unlocking hangars, opening gates, turning off lights, and (of course) disarming planes. At the end of your turn, a guard on the perimeter of the board moves one space.

Players win if they disarm all the planes and at least one player escapes the base. To do that, players need to move around the board, use a code card or a crowbar card to open a hangar, enter the hangar, use a code card or a bolt cutter card to disarm the plane, leave the hangar, find the rest of the planes, and finally get out of the base back to where the banners were left! Players don't know which hangars contain planes, and every plane differs. If the deck runs out of cards, the supply runs out of guards, or more than one player is discovered by a guard, the players lose.

name: Ladybug Lunch
description:
It's up to you and your ladybug helper to rid your beautiful flower of those pesky aphids.

In this rummy variant, created for families, players collect different sets of coloured ladybugs. For each set laid, your ladybug is moved to a leaf. All aphids that are on that leaf become ladybug lunch and can be removed from your flower. The first player to rid their flower from all the aphids is the winner!

name: Krimi Total Fall 6: Der verfluchte Schatz der Piraten
description:
The 6th in the KRIMI Total series. This time the setting is Broken Island in the Caribbean and players are trying to find the long lost treasure of Broken Island. But as the keeper of the treasure has been found dead, a curse now lays over the island. What happened?

Released: Essen 2007. Ages 16 and up.

name: Marvel Dice Masters: Melinda May Promo Cards
description:
Promo cards created for the Rainbow Draft Weekend 2, including full art card, sketch variant (blank) card and die.

Melinda May: Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D. card text:
While you have another active character die, Melinda May has Iron Will.
Teamwatch - Deal 1 damage to target character die or opponent.
MAX: 4
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Denmark
description:
Age of Steam: Denmark was designed for commercial publication but is now made available as a free print-and-play expansion for the Age of Steam base game.

This map is intended to be played with 3 to 6 players, with the map reputedly playing best with 3.

Denmark has a both a new economic system (an extension on the one seen in Age of Steam Expansion: South East Australia), plus an entirely different Locomotive action and system of managing and upgrading links.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Charado
description:
Charado is a game of forming shapes from play dough, and having your partner(s) try to guess what shape you were trying to form. Fundamentally similar to "Clay Mania" and "Clay to Win" and clearly inspired by "Charades" and "Pictionary".

Teams try to work their pawn across a grid of colored squares, with each color of square representing one of four categories of 'subject' (Creatures & Things, Actions, People & Gadgets, and Grab Bag) that one teammate must sculpt for the others' guesswork and amusement.

name: Micro Rome: Aegyptus
description:
Micro Rome: Aegyptus adds the Roman province of Aegyptus (Egypt) to the game.

This 7 card expansion allows you to add the Nile River, the Pyramids of Giza, the Sphinx and much more to your Roman holdings. However, all of these additions come with an increased winning score and their own decisions to make concerning your path to victory.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Layering, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Christmas Tree: The Decorating
description:
Christmas Tree: The Decorating is a quick 2* player game of building and decorating a Christmas Tree!

Each turn, a player places 1 card to build the communal tree and scores their matching bulb clusters and adjacent ornaments.

Cards are double sided, can be played upright, upside-down, and in some cases, on-top of other cards! The direction of the tree's orientation is not predetermined either. When the last card is placed and scored, the player with the highest score wins!

*Build bigger Trees (3-4 players) with an additional copy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Знаменосец
description:
In the board game players bearer squads consist of 20 soldiers and placement of the order is completely random. In total six different types of soldiers, among whom is an officer-bearer, who could command the whole ranks. The game used a system of ranks and strength of a warrior, depending on the state of health.

  Before the beginning party players are laid out face down tiles of soldiers under the original arrangement. After that, all tiles are revealed and the game begins.
For his turn, a player must move a warrior and a tile to tile a single attack of the enemy. Bearer can move itself, and can also move the entire vertical or horizontal column of soldiers who are with him.

The winner is the player who destroyed the first of three standard-bearers of the enemy.
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: YIAY: The Board Game
description:
YIAY (Yesterday I Asked You) is the game that settles the debate on who's the funniest in your friend group! Play with a group of 3-8 people and compete to get the most laughs!

Draw from 8 different categories and a total of 400 cards to decide the next rule. Each category places a different rule on how you have to answer the prompt. It could make you draw, write riddles, rhyme, or even think of slogans! The possibilities are endless when you’re making up your own answers!

There are two ways to play. Players take turns being the Host. The Host rolls the die and selects a card from the matching category. Everyone then has 60 seconds to write or draw their answer! Everyone else in the group answers based on what they think the Host will like best. The Host collects and reveals everyone's answers, then chooses their favorite!

Or, everyone submits answers, including the Host. The group uses the voting cards (that's the cards with the numbers) to pick their favorite answer. The pressure is then on for the Host to prove they're the funniest!

If you win the round, you keep the prompt card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins!

-description from publisher

name: Ghost Hunter: Witches
description:
This Halloween the land has been blighted by an unnatural curse. Crops have rotted in the fields, feral beasts stalk the villages and children wake with night terrors.The ever vigilant members of the Infernal Club have discovered the source of the corruption. Witches!!!As one of the club’s supernatural enforcers it is the players' duty to conduct a witch hunt and capture as many of the coven as they dare.

Ghost Hunter: Witches is a card game for 2 or more players (up to 6 with one deck or 12 with two decks). Players must lay down higher and higher Witch cards until one can lay a set of three capturing all the cards on the table at that time. A player who cannot keep up with the witches being laid will be forced to pick up the stack and add it to their hand. Every captured card is worth points at the end of the game. Many cards have special rules that effect the order of play, who may capture or other game dynamics. Some cards are marked as 'innocent' meaning that if they are captured, which is often unavoidable, they are worth minus points at the end of the game. When the first player has gotten rid of all of their cards the game ends, then the player who has the most positive points wins overall with the others being ranked behind them based on their scores.

The deck can be integrated with all the other Ghost Hunter decks like the blues Spirits deck or the red Vampires deck.

So assemble your trusted associates, light your torches and prepare for the wickedness of Ghost Hunter: Witches.

name: MasterSweets
description:
MasterSweets is an easy to learn, fast to play, family-friendly card game with great repeatability.
MasterSweets has four different game variants: competitive, player elimination, cooperative and solo.

In the main competitive variant of the "MasterSweets" you will take up the role of one of the 16 fancier confectioners(each with different special ability), competing to present the best confectionery delights.
"MasterSweets" Gameplay
Beginning with the starting player, players take turns in clockwise order. On his turn the player has to take one of the following actions:

1 – Take a card from the market into his hand.
2 – Take the top card of the drawing deck.
3 – Alter a recipe from the cookbook by exchanging one of the ingredient cards in his hand with a card from the cookbook.
4 – Play a special card from his hand.
5 – Perform the special skill of his role.
6 - Complete a recipe. Give all the ingredients compiling a recipe to complete it.

Each recipe gives a certain number of points which equals the sum of the points of ingredient cards that compiles the recipe. At the end of the game the player who has collected the most victory points, wins.

In the elimination game “Clash of Sweets” each player will create their own unique cookbook and will try to steal their opponents‘ recipes. This way, he reveals other players‘ culinary secrets and their unique cookbooks decreases. After the last recipe from a player’s cookbook is stolen, the player must leave the game. The last surviving player with recipes that have not been revealed is the winner.

In “Clash of Sweets” the active player allowed actions are:
1 – Take a card from the market.
2 – Take the top card of the drawing deck.
3 – Play a special card.
4 – Exchange an ingredient card from his hand with a card from another player’s cookbook.
5 – Improve a card in his cookbook. This way a recipe form the cookbook becomes more difficult for stealing.
6 – Steal an opponent’s recipe.

In the cooperative variant - “Sweets workshop” a royalty has noticed our masters of the sweets. She wants them to make incredible sweets for her birthday. Now the players must combine their efforts and team up in order to exactly fulfill all the royal’s requirements.
In “Sweets workshop” each player will hold the cards in his hand facing the rest of the players. The other players will give him clues about his cards.

In “Sweets workshop” the active player allowed actions are:
1 – Point a card from the cookbook and then discard a card from his hand. If the discarded card is of the same type as the one that has been pointed at, turn the cookbook card face down.
2 – Discard a card from his hand and exchange the position of 2 cards from the cookbook.
3 – Discard 2 cards from his hand in order to discard a card from the cookbook. Replace the discarded cookbook card with a new card from the drawing deck.
4 – Discard a card from his hand in order to give a clue to another player, what cards he holds in his hand. The active player must indicate – by pointing – which cards he is offering a clue about. Two types of clues are allowed:
A) A clue about one, and only one value. For example: “You have ‘5’ point cards, here and here and …”.
B) Point a recipe in the cookbook. Afterwards, the active player should point out all cards from one team-mate hand that are of the same type as at least one card from the selected row or column. For example: “Here and here and here … you have the same cards like in this recipe”.

At the end of the game, if all the cards in the cookbook are face down, then the queen is happy and all players win together. Otherwise the game is lost.

To be a true master of the sweets, you need a lot of workouts. The best workout is when you are confronted with your own best achievements.
The solo variant “Lonely in the kitchen” is the same like “MasterSweets” for two players. The goal in the “Lonely in the kitchen” is the player to collect more victory points than George “The cake” (his fictional opponent) at the end of the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Zap!
description:
Self-titled as the "brilliant but vicious" new game. Each player races to move two pawns to their spaces at the end of the board. The board includes several special spaces which can help or hinder your progress. Getting jumped by your opponent moves your pieces back a space.

To make things more interesting, each pawn has a special movement. A Starka can move one space diagonally but can jump in any direction. A Schnook can move one space forward, left or right.

The board includes the following special squares:

BLACK moves opponent's farthest ahead piece back to any unoccupied square in row his hindmost piece is on.

GREEN is a free move.

YELLOW lets you place your piece on any other connecting yellow square in the same block.

RED makes you lose a turn.

BLUE can be jumped as if it were another piece.

name: Dragon Quest Dungeon
description:
This game is a fantasy based game with strong gameplay ties to Battleship.

Each player secretly sets up his own dungeon; there's a stand-up cut-out castle to use as a shield between the players. You place the square-shaped walls all over the place in your dungeon, along with stairwells to the smaller 2nd level of the dungeon. You also place your monsters and various treasures for the other player to discover, fake treasures (mimics) and your boss monster. You cannot place the weapons in such a way that they're impossible to get to (either cut off by walls or the boss monster). Your then tell the other player which space the entrance to the dungeon is.

Each player in turn calls out the space he wishes to move to. You must call out each space one at a time. If there is a wall there, the player's turn ends. If the space is clear, they may continue on. If there is a monster, it must be fought. If the player is victorious, he gains a reward card for defeating it and may continue on; otherwise his turn ends. If there is a treasure chest, the player may examine it. If it's a treasure, he may keep it and move on. If its a mimic (a monster that looks like a treasure chest), then he must fight it as if it was a monster.

Play alternates between players until one player gets all 3 necessary treasures and then fights and kills the boss monster; that player is the winner.

There is minimal text on the components; as long as one player knows the rules and what the cards do, it is easy to show the other player (the cards with JPN text on them have distinctive pictures to make it easy to remember once told what it does)..

name: Logistics Command
description:
Produced by the Westinghouse Labs Weapons Division, possibly as a sales or training aid.

A simple two-player board, card and dice game of force building and maintenance set during the Cold War.

Each turn each player (Red and Blue) must use his budget to buy new combat units (air, land or naval) or support units (bases, repair depots, etc) and maintain his existing units.

Each unit is rated for combat effectiveness, MTBF (Mean Time Between Failures), MTTR (Mean Time To Repair) and Cost. Generally, Blue units are more reliable and have a higher combat effectiveness but cost more and take longer to repair. When a unit does break down the player can then use any of his support units to try to repair them.

Each turn a card is flipped to represent the political action for that turn. A crisis requires a minimum force level of a certain type (land, sea or air) to avoid a prestige penalty. A Showdown occurs just once and ends the game - the player with the highest amount of ready force wins the game.

The game is thus a trade off between keeping sufficient force level to win the Crises and sufficient force mix to win the final Showdown.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Diplomacy: Ard-Ri Variant
description:
Ard-Ri - Celtic for "High-King" this variant starts off fast and bloody. With no neutrals and the ever-raiding Vikings, you neighbor could be your only hope or the nail in your coffin. This is a 5 or 6 player map variant set in the pre-Christian Ireland, and uses the familiar rules of Diplomacy ®.

This Stupendous Game includes:
Rules, Four part Game Map, and 6 Conference maps.

Important Note: this game no longer comes with counters, but the price has been reduced to reflect that fact.

This game is a Diplomacy ® Variant
For best use with Diplomacy ® By Avalon Hill ™
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Stalingrad Attacked!
description: "Stalingrad Attacked!" is one of Lou Coatney's FREE wargames at his site as long as you follow his guidelines. It is actually '2' Wargames in one, "Fall Blau, May-1942"-the German's Summer Campaign, and "Operation: Uranus", November-1942-the Soviet's Counter-offensive resulting in the encirclement and destruction of Germany's "6th Army" and various Minor German Allies.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Advanced Tobruk System Basic Game I: Infantry
description: An introduction to the Advanced Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1940-43 system for newcomers consisting of one 11” x 17” color map, basic game rules for infantry, three sheets of color counters depicting infantry, their NCOs and officers, as well as their weapons. This game provides an easy-to-understand subset of the system rules that can be assimilated in less than an hour.

name: Port-Os
description:
In this game you are a pirate and with your ship you have to explore the archipelago, find the lost treasures and return to the bank on the main island.

Beware the other pirates who try to rob you, and also the many monsters you encounter on your way.

The first to collect 30 treasure points is the winner.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jagdpanzer
description:
Jagdpanzer is a set of rules for World War II armored combat. The game mechanics are straightforward and uncomplicated. The anti-tank combat is a simply system that provides decent, realistic results.

The basic rules are very basic, but there are several optional rules that can be added for chrome.

The scale of the game is 1 inch = 25 metres, 1 turn = 1 minute. The figure scale is 1:1 for tanks and guns with infantry represented as squads.

The rule booklet combines the rules with a great deal of organizational data and many pages of data on every AFV, gun, and airplane that was used in World War II.

name: Warfare in the Age of Discovery
description: This is a set of miniatures wargaming rules for the Renaissance, (1470-1680). It also includes rules for the English Civil War.
categories: Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: American Girl 300 Wishes Game
description:
The object is to match wishes with the player who would find them most desirable.

Players are dealt "wish" cards which describe personal accomplishments, careers or fun experiences. Each player then anonymously gives one or two wish cards (depending on # of players) to each of the other players by sliding them into their wish diaries. After wishes are passed out, each player examines the wishes they have received and ranks them from least to most desirable. Finally, everyone shares the wishes they received and how they ranked them (often good for a few laughs).

Originators of the wishes score points according to how they were ranked by the recipient. After three rounds, the player with the highest score wins.

name: Battlefield Cribbage
description:
From the website:

Battlefield Cribbage [BFC] is a game for people who love strategies, probabilities, and risk. While preserving the purity of cribbage, BFC adds a new dimension. The cards are played openly, and the players are like generals making orders on a battlefield. Unlike cribbage where your hand can be greatly influenced by the luck of the cards, victory comes to those who can implement strategies. BFC requires the strategy of chess and provides the fast paced thrill of cribbage."

The rules are provided free, and the game can be played with a standard deck of cards.

name: Cribble
description:
A fascinating game of skill and chance playing two of everyone's favorite card games-cribbage and poker. Where the players decide whether to play out their hand as a cribbage game or slip into high stakes poker.

The object of the game is collect the most chips in a variety of ways. By means of green Cribble cards. By strategic use of the Blue Cribble cards. By avoiding penalty cards and red pegs holes. By pegging around the Cribble track to be the first to reach the last hole and collect the Cribbage pot. And by call Cribble to play high-stakes poker for individual poker pots.

name: The Road to Osaka
description:
Subtitled: Samurai Skirmish Rules, 1100-1620

This is a 32-page rulebook for skirmish warfare (one figure = one warrior) for late Medieval Japan. The book has nice black and white drawings, rules for movement, different classes of fighters, melee and missile combat, mounted combat, and even includes movement charts for limiting the turn radius of mounted warriors at different speeds. The only dice used are d6s.
categories: Medieval, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Met het Mes op Tafel
description:
Based on the popular Dutch Tv-quiz.
Players secretly answer questions and try to bluf the other players away by pretending to know the most answers.
categories: Bluffing, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Napoleonic Wargaming
description:
(user summary)
Another book evolved from 'Wargaming : An Introduction'.

consists of three Parts:

Part One Historical Background
Part Two The Art of Napoleonic Warfare
Part Three The Napoleonic Wargame

The ruleset is very similar to the Napoleonic ruleset contained in the 'Introduction' book. But army compositon is now limited to 8 units (10-15 units in the 'Introduction'). Armylist is also expanded to 20 armies (from 9 in the 'Introduction').

name: Wars Ancient
description:
Wars Ancient is a game system created to handle three dimensional wargames with historical miniatures. It is a generic system that can be adapted to different setting. From one version to the other the rules change accordingly to the type of units available, strategies and potential special rules.Wars rules system wants to be quick and enjoyable offering the possibility to run amusing battles where creativity and imagination can easily make up for lack of scenic elements. This edition is set for simulation of ancient period battles.

The game is played on a board of 32' x 40' inch

The goal is to reach 15 victory points, to achieve this we need to eliminate the enemy detachments, or take the enemy camp. The new system is to have the opportunity to create their own armed randomly. This allows to always have a different strategy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Records of Three Kingdoms 190-280: Guandong Coalition
description:
Guandong Coalition is a bonus scenario in Board Wargame #8. You need to have "Records of Three Kingdoms 190-280" to play it. In this new scenario, we add a new strong force "Dong Zhuo".

Guandong Coalition is a short scenario of "Records of Three Kingdoms" that can be played to completion within an hour.
You need to own the game "Records of Three Kingdoms" and have its components to play this bonus scenario. It can be played by either two or four players. In the two players game, one player plays the role of Dong Zhuo and one player controls the whole Guangdong Coalition (represented by Wei, Shu and Wu forces). In the four players game, one player plays the role of Dong Zhou, the other three players play the role of Wei, Shu and Wu respectively.

There are three factions in this scenario.
Dong Zhou Alliance are formed by Dong Zhou and Lu Bu (enter game in Turn 1).
Guangdong Alliance are formed by Tao Qian (Liu Bei enter game in Turn 1), Sun Jian (Sun Ce enter game in Turn 1), Cao Cao, Yuen Shu, Yuen Shao, Zhang Yang.
Liu Biu, Liu Yan, Ma Teng, Gongsun Zen, Gongsun Du, Zhang Lu (enter game in Turn 1) and Liu Yao (enter game in Turn 1) formed the Neutral Faction.

Players conduct Canvass – Ally actions to try gaining control of the Independent Forces. Guangdong Alliance must destroy Dong Zhuo forces before the game end. The Term "Independent Force" and "Neutral Faction" are used interchangeably.

name: Guld & Bly
description:
Guld & Bly is a skirmish miniature game set in the old west.

Each player puts together a band of 3-6 miniatures according to scenario based skirmishes or to a campaign setting. The latter allows for advance of your gang as they gain more skills, money, and of course weapons to help them in their endeavors.

Contains 15 scenarios.

name: Gangs City
description:
You are a gang leader and your aim is to become the Patron of the city. In order to do this, you will recruit and use your henchmen to manage traffic and take control of the neighborhoods, in short, anything that will get you up into the Mob.

Gangs City is based on a mechanism of laydown tiles where the characters perform different actions (fight, recruitment or traffic) according to the direction of their tile and where their location. During a turn, you place your characters, one by one, trying to assess the tactics your opponents to not let yourself overwhelmed by the other gangs.

name: France 1914
description:
France 1914, is a relatively simple, straightforward simulation of Germany's long-planned but only nearly successful attempt at a quick victory in Northwest Europe in 1914.

It is corps-to-army level with 10 day turns until the end of November.

Mata Hari is in it, as are The Taxicabs of Paris.

It plays in an hour or two.

France 1914 is FREE to print off and play at http://www.coatneyhistory.com/France1914.htm , but do look up Patrick Tremoureux's professional redos of the map and units here under his (trem_pk) entry on BGG.
categories: Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame, World War I

name: A Brilliant Combat: The Battle of Manila Bay
description:
“Our fleet engaged the enemy in brilliant combat, protected by the Cavite and Manila forts. They obliged the enemy, with heavy loss, to maneuver repeatedly. At 9 o’clock the American Squadron took refuge behind the foreign shipping, on the east side of the bay. Our fleet, considering the enemy’s superiority, naturally suffered severe loss…. There was considerable loss of life.” –Spanish Admiral Montojo’s telegraph to Madrid during the battle.

A Brilliant Combat is the “sister” title of Death Before Dishonor: The Battle of Santiago that was the 2013 CSW Gold Level Donation reward. Like its counterpart the game uses a very simple and fun to play design that models the history well without a lot of record-keeping, and is also very solitaire play friendly. The game features the historical battle, several what-ifs, as well as scenarios that posit the Spanish Reserve Fleet sailing to take back the Philippines, or the German Asiatic Squadron challenging Admiral Dewey’s for control of the archipelago.

Each copy of A Brilliant Combat has one 11 by 17 inch map, one sheet of 77 single-sided, un-mounted counters, one players’ aide sheet and a 4 page rule book. Graphics are by Bruce Yearian. A Brilliant Combat sells for $11.95 plus shipping. Mounted counters can be had for an additional $5.00.

name: Fierce fight! Leningrad Blitzkrieg
description:
This is a fifth game of the Struggle of Army group Manstein series.

The game starts June 22 and ends September 10 in 1941.
The map covers from Konigsberg to Leningrad.
The game uses the same engine as its predecessor. Each player selects his chits each turn, then draw chits one by one and activate part of the force designated by the chit.
The victory is measured by VPs and mainly got from the control of major city hexes.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Blocky Mountains: A Little Game Adventure – Save the Goose
description: Save the Goose is A Little Game Adventure for Blocky Mountains, designed for solitaire play. The challenge presented to the player is to save the goose by being able to surpass the fox that has abducted it, on each and every route.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Secrets and Schemes
description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Lysa knew more than she had dared to put in her letter. She might have the very proof that Ned needed to bring the Lannisters to ruin, and if it came to war, they would need the Arryns and the eastern lords who owed them service." –George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

Secrets and Schemes is the first Chapter Pack in the "Wardens" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game.

Lords and ladies across the Seven Kingdoms have fought for the Iron Throne. Many have died. Still others have held back, aloof and apart. In Secrets and Schemes, you will discover sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) that touch upon the schemes these patient individuals have concocted. Additionally, you’ll learn how they make their opening moves with a host of new Knights, attachments, and the agenda, Aloof and Apart, which encourages players to revisit some of the game’s most expensive, powerful, and recognizable characters.

As the first chapter of the Wardens cycle, Secrets and Schemes also begins its exploration of the House Arryn trait and the introduction of the Castle plot type, which offers powerful rewards, but only when your plot enters the used plot pile. Additionally, a number of card introduce powerful new “Limited Response” abilities, which add new dimensions to this game term by moving it to the center of more meaningful decisions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Rail Baron Rivals
description: Rail Baron Rivals is a game where you and a rival baron are competing to have the most cash after 12 years of development in the golden age of railroading in the U.S. Northeast. Each year is represented by a turn in which you will roll 5 special dice that are used by one or more railroads to build track, expand cities and improve infrastructure. You may invest in any of these companies by acquiring shares - the more shares you have of the successful railroads the richer you will be. If you can get the right combination of shares and each railroad has increased in value then you have won the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Simulation, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: World at War Compendium Volume 2
description:
The World At War Compendium Vol. 2 is packed with over 85 full-color pages of World at War content!

Based on the Line of Fire material from issues #8 through #13, this iteration of the Compendium includes a tankful of scenarios—over 30! It also contains the continued history of World War III as it happened, battle reports, articles, Jeff Schulte’s clever HQ variant, a new 11”x17” geomorphic map, and 130 counters—featuring 21 new counters for Luxembourg forces that battle it out with Poles and Soviets in a brand-new five-scenario modulette, Ardennes Again. An Order of Battle for all counters in the Compendium rounds out the content.

Counters include formations of US Marines, an expanded Team Charlie, the Soviet 3rd Tank, two new Luxembourg formations, and Chinese and Vietnamese forces that fight it out in a six-scenario modulette, Jungle Blood & Sweat.

The World At War Compendium Vol. 2 is a must-have feast for all World at War enthusiasts!

The World At War Compendium Vol. 2 does NOT include SADF/FAPLA scenarios and components that have been published in issues #8 through #13 of Line of Fire. These will be republished later in a complete module.

WORLD AT WAR COMPENDIUM VOL. 2 ARTICLES

Articles and Battle Reports
Editor’s Page
World at War Timeline
Go Big
The Swedish Army in Operation Garbo
Red, White and Orange
Diesel and Dust
The Über Bout
The Battle of Bendorf

Variants
A New Cue for the HQ
Theme and Variation: Six Ways to Play an Old Scenario

Scenarios
Lancers to the Front
Brothers in Arms
Tank Battle
Nynäshamn
Taxis of War
The Other Guys
The Mainz Event
The Sting
Solidarność and the Fifth Partition
Spring Cleaning
Tanks, Mr. Rico! Zillions of ‘Em
New Moon on Monday
Hill 252
Modulettes
It’s the Oil, Stupid!
To the Shores of
Speed Bumps
Meeting in the Sands
A Place Called Fulda
Fateful Dawn
Escalation
The Main Event
Jungle Blood & Sweat
Black Flags
Foot Blitzkrieg
Into the Fire
Blunted Spear
Meatgrinder
To the Paddy Fields Beyond
Ardennes Again
Bottom of the Barrel
Sitting Ducks
Crossroads
Counting Trees
Incisions

Order of Battle

Components:

85-Page Magazine
30 Total Scenarios + 6 Variants for “First Moves” from Eisenbach Gap
Battle Reports and Articles
HQ Variant
Four Modulettes:
Ardennes Again (NEW!)
A Place Called Fulda
It’s the Oil, Stupid!
Jungle Blood & Sweat
One 11" x 17" Geomorphic Card Stock Map
130 Counters
All in a Zip-lock Bag

The World At War Compendium Vol. 2 is a magazine, with maps, scenarios, and die-cut counters for the World at War game system. It is not a separate game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Takeout
description: Takeout is a social set-building card game for 2-4 players. In Takeout, players are a group of young backpackers in a tiny noodle shop down an alley in China. Although none of you speak Chinese, you’re determined to sample authentic Chinese cuisine. The object of the game is to get one dish of each flavor (sweet, sour, salty, spicy and bitter) and a cold drink into your meal, before any of your friends do. Use your superior chopstick skills or a Mandarin-English phrasebook to attack your friends.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Ancient World: Citadel of Ivories Promo
description:
Promo tile for The Ancient World, made available through the Dice Tower 2015 Season 11 Kickstarter.

Rules: When you send a citizen here, roll a die. If you roll a Titan, you get 1 knowledge. If you roll a coin, you get 1 coin. If you roll nothing, you get nothing.

Although technically compatible with The Ancient World (Second Edition), this tile and two others like it are not included in the latter edition because other new elements in the game cover the same ground in better ways.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Siberian Dice
description:
This game originates from isolated indigenous tribes of Siberia. It was recently discovered by "mainland people" and immediately caught attention of Lame Heron Games. This superficially simple game turned out to be a marvel of an alien mathematical genius. It is unusual and elegant beyond words, it is very easy to learn but very hard to excel at.

Its unbelievably concise rules, while being simple enough for a child to learn, generate a strategy as complex as the best known "western" games.

The core of the game's mechanics is the notion of dice-perfection:
A die is perfect when the number of pips on the face of the die equals the number of dice neighboring it, regardless of those dice ownership and pips.

The drama of the game is that this perfection status (and therefore the goal) is very fragile.
The conflict of the game is that manipulating their own dice only players affect the status of the opponent's dice as well.
The trickery of the game is that the goal is impossible to achieve using only your own dice.

name: PitRush
description: PitRush is an action-packed game of skill in which players try to capture the pits of the game board with their disks in order to earn the most points. Players take shots by flicking their disk with their finger. Opponent disks can be struck off, and pits can be taken over by stopping on top of the disk in the pit. Players score points based on the distance of the hole they occupy (or cover) from their shooting location on the edge of the board.

name: Poland Strikes!
description:
From Yaah! magazine #4 published by Flying Pig Games:

Poland Strikes! is a standalone module in the Sticks and Stones series. The first entry, published by Flying Pig's sister company Tiny Battle Publishing, saw Soviets and Yankees fighting over precious land in Germany in post-nuclear 1987. While the USSR is distracted by all of this, Poland decides to settle the score with Hungary after years of escalating tensions along the border. With three scenarios and 88 counters gorgeously illustrated by wunderkind Christian Sperling (Neuschwabenland), it's a cold-war-goes-hot tactical combat game by the undisputed master of the genre.

name: Zombicide: Survivor Jovem Nerd
description: Brazilian gaming personality, Jovem Nerd (http://jovemnerd.com.br), has made an appearance during the zombie apocalypse. This survivor/zombivor character is a promo that was made readily available in Brazil.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Cool Mini Or Not, Guillotine Games

name: The Robot That Totally Saved Cleveland
description:
Using a 5 card hand, players take turns attempting to build a robot that will be used to defeat the Evil Dr. Head Case and his Mutant Monsters.

The robots are made up of three cards. A head card, a body card, and a feet card. The cards work together to build robots in fun combinations. As the players build the robots, they can end up with names like "A funky‐right ol'‐pulverizer" or "Mr Electric the‐crushing‐bubble bot". Players also have the option of attaching 1 add‐on card to the robot. The add‐on cards are things like "Lazers for Eyes", "Bulletproof Boots", and "Razor Sharp Dentures".

The game is quick and simple to learn. Once the players have a round or two under their belt the game is fun and everyone enjoys building the robots.

There are a few other features to the game like the "Bargain Center" which allows players to grab a "Crumpled" head, or an "As seen on tv" body part to finish out their robot in a pinch. Using the bargain center parts might seem like a disadvantage but be careful. That player might be holding the "Dick Jone's Rust Remover" card which allows them to polish it up and make it shiny and new.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Matching, Trick-taking

name: Darkrock Ventures: Expansion Pack #1
description:
Darkrock Ventures: Expansion Pack #1 includes ten new cards to enhance your Darkrock Ventures experience!

Contains ten brand new, unique cards to add to your Darkrock Ventures base game:

5 New Research Cards
5 New Corporate Sponsors card
1 Proof of Purchase card (not used in gameplay)

name: In the Trenches: Rising Sun
description:
Description from the publisher:

Rising Sun is the second battle pack for In the Trenches, and the focus is on the often overlooked role played by Japan in The Great War. There are three historical scenarios pitting Japanese infantry and cavalry, fighting alongside the Brits, against the Germans. There is also a hypothetical scenario that places the Germans on the offensive.

Designed by John Gorkowski, In the Trenches enables players to game historically accurate simulations of tactical operations from the Great War. ITT challenges players to move and fight with company-level formations made of separate platoon-sized units during five minute, impulse-based turns. The historically accurate maps are scaled to 100 yards per hex. This approach recreates WWI command and control problems and inspires historically accurate play without forcing decisions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Colortopia
description:
Welcome to the Colortopia, a realm of happiness filled with colors where people like to put all kinds of colors on themselves and in their life, too. It's time for the Color Festival to come around! The Color Contest is one of the biggest days of the year; everyone is ready for it. Let's see who will win the title of the Color Master?

Colortopia is a real-time game of good sighting and some logical reasoning in which players rotate and flip their color cards to complete different color patterns based on color mixing and color contrast to earn color chips. The color chips can even be mixed to become a new color and get you more points! Whoever has the most points at the end is crowned the Color Master and wins!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Puzzle, Racing, Real-time

name: The Impregnable Fortress
description:
A World War 2-themed board game centered around the Battle of Singapore in January 1942. Two players struggle for dominance on a hex-grid map encompassing Singapore and Southern Johore, with one player controlling the invading Japanese forces under General Yamashita, and the other controlling the defending Commonwealth forces under General Percival.

Players can play using four levels of difficulty, using various optional rules and add-on cards for greater strategic depth and challenge. The game features thirty historically accurate incidents or individuals related to this battle, and players will be able to make use of tanks, artillery, aircraft, anti-tank guns, combat engineers, mines, and recon troopers in the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Dungeon Time: Zulkro Schädelsang Promo Card
description: The Zulko Schädelsang Promo Card allows you to remove a hero from another player from the game and randomly draw three hero currently not used. Give one of them to the player whose hero you discarded.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting

name: Ghost Hunter: Angels & Demons
description:
Angels and Demons is the 5th deck to be added to the Ghost Hunter cannon. In this card game you must compete to capture the angelic and the diabolical a like.

The cards feature gothic art of angels and daemons from holy lore as voted for by the backers. This theme is replicated in the special rules which sees each Angel matched with an opposing Demon. You as a Ghost Hunter must choose which to specialize in capturing, for the best bonuses in your final score.

Ghost Hunter: Angels & Demons is a card game for 2 – 6 players that should last between 10-30 minutes. Players take it in turns to lay higher and higher cards on a central stack. If a player can’t lay an equal or higher card on the stack then they have to pick it up. If a player manages to lay a group of 3 cards at once then they get to capture the stack. Plenty of the cards come with special rules that you can manipulate to turn the game your way. The first player to play all of their cards ends the game and then players count up the scores of all of the cards that they captured minus all of the cards that they didn’t manage to get rid of. The player with the highest score wins the game.

The rules are simple but the strategies can be complex. Skill and luck play their parts in equal measure in this short but engaging card game. It pays to get rid of your cards and be the Ghost Hunter who ends the game but victory is never assured until the final scores are counted.

It is a standalone game but can be combined with the other Ghost Hunter decks for variation.

—description from the designer

name: Wings of War: World War 2 – Dewoitine D520
description:
Take your Wings of War game into the third dimension! Each historically-accurate, fully-painted miniature represents an aircraft from Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II. All miniatures come complete with maneuver deck and variable-altitude stand.

This French fighter aircraft, used largely for training purposes, saw limited combat.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: British vs Pirates: Volume 2 – South Sea Alliance
description:
Full faction add-on introducing the South Sea Alliance faction to expand British Vs Pirates: Volume II with in addition to the French Navy and Buccaneers factions.

This add-on features two new ship classes to the game such as the Junk and the Turtle Ship.

This add-on features:


20 D6 dice (purple)


Ship miniatures (purple):


2 Sloop
3 Junk
4 Turtle


Additional miniatures (purple):


1 Fort


Cards:


1 Fort Card
27 Skill Cards
9 Ship Cards
6 Captain Cards


Tokens:


6 Crew Tokens

name: Blood Bowl (Third Edition): Naggaroth Nightmares
description: The twisted and degenerate Dark Elf race is infamous for its cruelty and violence - perfect for Blood Bowl! They take great delight in giving everyone else a thorough thrashing.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Get Off My Land!: Kickstarter Exclusive Promo Cards
description:
Kickstarter backers of Get Off My Land! received 4 copies each of 2 different Kickstarter exclusive cards, the Farmhand and Crop Rotation.

The 8 cards were not included inside the shrinkwrapped base game box, but accompanied the base game in a separate ziploc baggie. This promo was also sent to individuals who pre-ordered the game if they signed up to receive the promo cards from First Fish Games at a convention.

The Farmhand cards provide 2 fences OR allow a player to pay $2 to the bank and then choose and perform 2 of the listed actions: log, go to market, and harvest. It also has either 1 or 2 bullet holes.

Crop Rotation provides 2 fences OR lets a player place their farmer on any market card in play or replace another farmer with their own. Then in addition, swap the position of any 2 market cards they control. The card also has either 1 or 2 bullet holes.

To use these promo cards simply shuffle into the deck of fence cards.

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Collector's Edition
description: The Collector's Edition has the same two ship decks as the Traveller Customizable Card Game: Two Player Starter Set, but the ship cards come foil stamped. There's also an additional 90 cards (the same 60 as the Starter Set, and then 30 more), rule book, special counters, and the Norah Wells promo card.
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Nova Solis
description:
Nova Solis... The legendary home of the Ancients...

A tiny pocket reality containing untold treasures untouched since the Ancients’ departure from our universe.

When a functioning gate was first discovered it became a race for the great races of the galaxy to be the first to mount an expedition and claim the riches of Nova Solis. In our greed we did not stop to consider why the Ancients abandoned Nova Solis until we encountered the Entity...

Its attacks came from out of nowhere and decimated our defenses... Great fleets of ships made from shadow pouring out of enormous tears in the fabric of space.

Its power is growing and the black hole is becoming more active... Even worse, many of the stars near the Nova Solis gate are becoming unstable... We have to get out of here but we can’t let this thing enter into our universe... Our only hope is to recover the ancient knowledge and to seal it inside!


Nova Solis is a 4X (eXpand, eXplore, eXploit, eXterminate) space and resource management game for 1 to 6 players. The game is a hybrid blend of thematic gameplay with Euro mechanics and may be played in the following modes:

Survival - Where the players must work together to flee the entity or be destroyed.


Standard - The player who gains the most victory points is the overall winner.
Co-Op - Players work together as a group and no player combat is allowed.
Solo - A single player controlling 2-6 races against the entity.


Exploration - Where the players compete against each another to claim the most victory points

Players choose 1 of 6 asymmetrical empires to lead their expedition each with their own unique technology focuses and secret objectives. During the game the players will scan and explore stars placing them onto the modular board to obtain empire bonuses and strategic resources. These in turn are used to power the various technologies.

Throughout the game, the players will be attacked by the AI controlled Entity which grows stronger as the game proceeds. Left unchecked it will eventually consume the players in a supernova explosion. To defeat the Entity, the players must obtain enough victory points and ancient artifacts while combating its forces. Combat makes use of a highly strategic dice face-building mechanic allowing players to customize their forces over time.

Because in survival games each player accumulates their own set of victory points while contributing to the overall total required to defeat the Entity, Nova Solis gives each player a reason to play independently of the group-think that plagues other games with cooperative mechanics. Of course the players can still play cooperatively if desired or settle into exploration mode for a more standard 4X romp.

—description from the designer


Awards


Finalist at UKGE 2018 Wyvern's lair competition
Finalist Board Game Design Lab - Design Challenge!
categories: Civilization, Economic, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Robotech: Cyclone Run
description:
The alien Invid have conquered Earth and it’s a race against time for the Rebels to reach Reflex Point, the heart of the Invid! Using luck and skill, explore the planet destroying as many enemies along the way as you can!

In Robotech: Cyclone Run, you’ll roll dice to draft different Robotech Heroes, allowing you to move your Cyclones across the 3x3 tile cassette, scoring points for each Invid ship you destroy and location you discover along the way. Who can do the most to save Earth?

Robotech: Cyclone Run is a small area, fast-playing, competitive dice-based game, and sequel to Robotech: Ace Pilot. The game takes minutes to learn and can be played almost anywhere. Your favorite Robotech heroes help you destroy the Invid invaders and race to Reflex Point!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

name: Pixel Tactics: Mythology Heroes Promo Set
description:
Pixel Tactics: Mythology Heroes is a special Pixel Tactics minipack that features Mythology Heroes! Featuring new characters with new abilities.

Leader Name - Hero Name


=====================Amaterasu - Sun Goddess
Cthulhu - Old One
Kali - Ender
King Arthur - King
Quetzacoatl - Great Serpent
Sherlock Holmes - Detective
Son Wukong - Monkey King
Zeus - Thunder God
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Halfling Team Card Pack
description:
A deck of Blood Bowl reference cards for Halfling teams such as the Greenfield Grasscutters. In addition to a number of player datacards for each Halfling player and their available Star Players, there is a selection of blank player cards that can be used to create or keep track of your own players for your team.

There is also a team roster card that will help you keep track of your team’s progression, with a match record on the reverse side.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Unia Lubelska
description:
During the game players play the parts of supporters and opponents of Polish-Lithuanian real union in the XVI century. Both sides aim to gather more votes on the Sejm in Lublin in order to force their ideals. The side which has more votes at the end of the game, wins.

The main game mechanics is deckbuilding. Players start with their basic decks and are able to gain new cards from the central display. During his turn a player decides which cards to play for their effect, and which to leave for bidding phase. The highes bidder is allowed to take first pick from the display of new cards.

Players main objective is to accumulate votes, and when all 21 votes are distributed among players the one with majority wins. In four-player variant two teams compete and one of them wins.

Players also fight for endorsement from priesthood, magnates and nobility to gain special cards providing them with once-per-turn effects.

name: Baby Dragon Bedtime 2nd Edition
description:
Like most infants, baby dragons hate going to bed! But now Mumma Dragon has declared it bed time and the dragons haven't got their hoards in order. They'll need to scramble as fast as they can to grab the gold and go to sleep, while making sure they get more gold than their siblings!

Baby Dragon Bedtime is the world's first real-time deckbuilder. Players all act at once to move through their decks to find cards that let them peek at the cards face down on the table and then pull them into their hand - assuming they are valuable gold of course and not dustbunnies!

Play takes only about a minute but players have been known to play for hours. And it makes a great family game as kids and adults can play together.

In this Second Edition, we've changed how some cards work to streamline play and added three new cards which you can add to increase chaos: The Crash, The Swoop and the Mama's Coming! Plus all new incredible art from Luke Parsons.

72 cards plus rules.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Real-time
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Memory

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Aircraft and Aces Ork Air Waaagh! Cards
description:
This pack contains the following cards:

- 19 Ork Aircraft cards that are ideal references for use in-game for your Dakka Jets, Fighta Bommers, Eavy Bommers and Grot Bommers. Also includes the 'Vulture' and 'Big Burna' reference cards.
- 26 Aircraft Upgrade cards
- 34 Aircraft Weapon cards
- 6 Ground Defences cards including Flak Platform and ’Eavy Flak Kannon
- 8 Ork Aces cards, including the infamous Toofraker and Da Black Barun

You will need a copy of the Aeronautica lmperialis: Wings of Vengeance boxed game or the Rynn's World Air War Campaign book to use the contents of this card pack.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Quota
description:
In Quota, players play a game within a game, anytime, anywhere. Simply give each player a card with two quotes, which they have to sneak into conversation without getting caught. Play during game night, a dinner out, a camping trip, and more. Each quote is worth points based on its difficulty. The winner at the end of the night then gets an agreed-upon prize.

Playing is simple- draw a card with two quotes, keep them secret, and carry on with your evening. Then, when the time is right, sneak a quote into conversation. If you get caught, then get a new card. If you don't, and the conversation carries on, show your card and get the points, drawing a new card. What will your score be at the end of the night?

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Chaos Battletome – Slaves To Darkness
description:
Devout worshippers of Chaos, the Slaves to Darkness bring war to the tortured lands of the Mortal Realms.

Crush the Mortal Realms beneath the iron tread of Chaos with Battletome: Slaves to Darkness – your guide to the mortals, daemons and monsters who walk the endless Path to Glory. Inside this tome of dark and forbidden lore, you'll discover the dark world of the Slaves to Darkness - the innumerable allegiance of tribes and warrior-bands who fight ceaselessly to gain the favour of the Dark Gods. Rich background, sumptuous art and a number of short stories by acclaimed Black Library author Aaron Dembski-Bowden bring the world of the Slaves to Darkness to life as never seen before. When you're inspired to start your own conquests of the Mortal Realms, you’ll be able to field an unstoppable Slaves to Darkness army with allegiance abilities, spell lores, warscroll battalions and more that allow you to build a dizzying array of armies. Perhaps you’ll field an elite force of Chaos cavalry, riding with Archaon himself. Maybe you'll field a collection of tribal warriors and warbands from the Eightpoints, drawn together by a charismatic Darkoath leader. Or perhaps you’ll fight with a force dedicated to one of the sinister Chaos Gods. With all this plus painting guides, Path to Glory rules and more, Battletome: Slaves to Darkness is a fantastic resource for any Chaos collector.

This 120-page hardback battletome contains:

Rich lore that explores the origins of the Slaves to Darkness, their worship of the Chaos Gods, and their goals in the Mortal Realms
Four thrilling short stories by Black Library author Aaron Dembski-Bowden
Tips and advice for painting and collecting your own Slaves to Darkness army
Warscrolls for all Slaves to Darkness units, presented here for ease of reference
Allegiance abilities for Slaves to Darkness armies, plus sub-faction rules that allow you to dedicate yourself to the Ravagers, Cabalites, Despoilers and the Host of the Everchosen


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: District Commander Binh Dinh: Vietnam 1969
description:
Brian Train's District Commander is a series of operational games on counterinsurgency situations. The players alternate activation of groups of units (stacks) to perform discrete operations (missions) through the expenditure of Task Points (TP). Some missions are Tactical Missions - straightforward military tasks such as performing patrols, ambushing or attacking enemy forces, or moving from one place to another - and these may be performed multiple times by a stack during a turn. Other missions emphasize the "non-tactical" end of the campaign, establishing friendly influence, control, and infrastructure in an area, reducing the enemy's claim to the same, and recruiting or training troops. These missions take more time to perform and so unlike the tactical missions may be the only mission performed by the stack during the turn.

Missions are resolved by play of secretly-held Chance Chits, each with ratings that are better or worse for certain types of operations. Chits are played simultaneously and the ratings compared, modified by units, assets, and the current board state to determine the outcome. Using the right chit at the right time - knowing when to save a good chit for later and when to use it, and trying to determine if your opponent is going all-in or holding back - will require steely judgment in an atmosphere of doubt and deception.

All this is done in pursuit of objectives handed down to you by your superiors (i.e., chosen randomly) and kept secret from your opponent - objectives that may even change over the course of the game. Within this framework, the two sides - Government and Insurgent - play very differently, with the Insurgent player, in particular, depending on bluff and deception to achieve their goals. A large number of variant rules allow you to turn the game into a sandbox for exploring counterinsurgency doctrine and practice.
