The second volume is District Commander Binh Dinh, set in the jungles of Vietnam circa 1969. This is a period of transition that sees Government forces shifting their focus from pitched battles to providing population security and pacification. Mr. Train gives each player very different tools - here, we have rules for Agent Orange, the Phoenix Program, and the Ho Chi Minh Trail, among others - with which to pursue a sometimes shifting set of operational goals in a highly-customizable sandbox.

-description from publisher
categories: Modern Warfare, Political, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simulation

name: Starving Artists: 2019 Kickstarter Art Packs
description:
Stretch goal art packs from the 2019 Kickstarter:
'Surrealism' - Adds 3 new canvases from Alice Bailly, Morton Shamberg and Max Ernst
'Impressionism' - Adds 3 new canvases from Claude Monet, Mary Cassatt and Edgar Degas
'Abstract' - Adds 3 abstract/futurism canvases from Giacomo Balla, Frantisek Kupka and Benedetta Cappa
'Asia Art' - Adds 3 new canvases from Korea, Japan and China
'Welcome Back Pack' - Adds the 6 cards that didn't make the cut during the first Kickstarter campaign
'Crystallo Creatures' - Adds 6 cards to celebrate the Kickstarter campaign of solo game Crystallo

As well as 3 additional backer chosen cards
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: Omen: Champions of the Nile
description:
This game introduces 11 new units to the Omen Saga. It also includes 6 new structures to combine with previous Omen sets. During end of game scoring, players gain VP as indicated on their completed structures.

Also includes 2 rules cards and 1 metal Favor token.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Lost Worlds: Skeleton with Scimitar and Shield
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


Skeleton with Scimitar and Shield
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Rockstar Portfolio Manager
description:
In Rockstar Portfolio Manager, players are promising multi-asset portfolio managers, shortlisted by a billionaire as candidates to manage his wealth. They are each given seed capital by the billionaire and have to build the largest value investment portfolio over the market cycles to prove their worth.

Every round unveils a new scenario (a random market cycle), to which players have partial information due to a game mechanism called "initial research". During a player's turn (within the round), they resolve the payoffs associated with the scenario and their investment portfolios draws and plays action cards. They also have the option of re-balancing their portfolio to best position it for maximum investment gains in the future scenarios. When the last player for the round has finished their turn, the scenario is discarded and a new scenario card is unveiled in a new round.

The game ends when there are no scenarios cards and the last player has finished their turn. A player wins by having the largest portfolio value.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Income, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Investment, Open Drafting

name: Floor Plan: Tom & Zee Client Promos
description:
One Build Client(Tom) and one Design Client (Zee) for Floor Plan.

Tom:
Game Room - Dining room with a 1x3 arrangement of furnishings connected to a closet. 8 points
Tom's Own Taco Stand - Kitchen with a window to a tree connected to 2 other rooms. 6 points

Zee:
Lazy River - Pool containing a stone surrounded by water. 8 points
Moving Walkways - A deck adjacent to 3 or more trees where each section touches exactly 1 or 2 other deck sections.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builders Pack.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Meeple Circus: Tiny Acrobats
description:
A new way to play Meeple Circus! Tiny Acrobats combines the excitement and thrills of Meeple Circus, with new streamlined scoring and rules set. Using a combination of new components provided in this expansion and components from your copy of Meeple Circus, The Wild Animal & Areal Show and Show Must Go On! Here's a whole new way to enjoy Meeple Circus.

Provided in Tiny Acrobats:


25 public demand cards
2 sizes of ruler (one for the giant edition and one for the regular size)
New rules set


What is used from the base game and expansions:

Meeples
Scoreboard "The Clap-o-meter"
5 Circus Rings
5 Score Tokens

This addition to your Meeple Circus collection can be played with the standard-sized meeples or the GIANT sized meeples. The measurement scoring is different from the original game which is why we are including two sizes of rulers folded on heavy card stock in the box.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Stacking and Balancing

name: Tanto Cuore: 10th Anniversary Kickstarter Promos
description:
The Tanto Cuore 10th Anniversary Kickstarter promos. Currently there are seven private maid promos and three new general maid promos.

PR52: Annet Thane (New - Private Maid)
PR53: Ignis Carpenter (New - Private Maid)
PR54: Edith Shirring (New - Private Maid)
PR56: Helene Fontenil (New - Private Maid)
PR57: Catherine Léger (New - Private Maid)
PR58: Chiffon Loudenne (New - Private Maid)
PR59: Cecilia St. Clair (New - Private Maid)
PR60: Frederica Schutz (New - Private Maid)
PR61: Lenor Abreu (New - Private Maid)
PR62: Lynn Ex Compy (New - General Maid)
PR63: Macy Apfel Compy (New - General Maid)
PR64: Wina Does Compy (New - General Maid)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: 15 Days: Mid-season
description:
This mini-expansion for 15 Days is part of the "Achievements" series of Matchbox Collection mini-expansions, and as such should only be opened and used once the 3 criteria on its envelope have been met; because of this...

SPOILER ALERT:

This expansion adds a new set of Animal power cards to the base game of 15 Days, expanding the variability and replay-ability of the game.

name: Curry the Favor
description:
In Curry the Favor, players take on the role of two friends that take turns buying each other lunch specials at a local restaurant. However, they always want to impress the other and give a better meal than the one that was last given to them.

Every turn in Curry the Favor, you will buy your friend a meal, trying to “one-up” the meal they last bought for you - in some aspect. But, you will want to spend your money wisely, because the player who received the most valuable meals in the end wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Ladder Climbing, Matching, Memory, Open Drafting

name: Штука (The Thingy)
description:
The Thingy is a party game based on charades and searching details on paintings, each depicting a scene packed with various objects.

In Each round, one player describes the hidden item with charades, words, drawings, or yes/no questions. Other players try to find the item on the picture among hundreds of other objects and snatch the thingy first as soon as finding the answer!

The player who was the first to find the right item moves their token on the scoring board ahead. The player who reaches the end of the scoring path first, wins.

Various paintings and numerous task cards to play over and over again.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Matching, Pattern Recognition

name: Operation Causeway: Formosa 1944
description:
Operation Causeway: Formosa 1944 is an operational-level two player wargame covering the planned but never executed Allied invasion of the Allied island of Formosa in World War II. Had the operation been executed, it would have been the largest amphibious invasion of the Pacific Theater of Operations. The Allied objective is to gain control of Formosa with a minimal number of losses. The Japanese objective is to inflict sufficient cost in terms of manpower and delay to make the invasion counterproductive for the Allies.

World at War #83, April-May 2022

name: Penalty Challenge: Teams
description:
This is a "Teams" version of the former "Penalty Challenge" game. In this version every player will be dealt a complete team of 11 players, with a similar set of shooting directions and star players.

Players will also be given specific goalkeeper gloves to manage during the game, so in this version the goalkeeper will have a more strategic role and in every shot the defending team will decide whether to wait to see the shot direction or to risk moving to one direction and be able to use a neutral glove and occupy more goal spaces.

The mechanism is the same as in "Penalty Challenge" the original game, the team shooting will put a shooting card pointing at the intended goal and after the defending team place their goalkeeper the shooter will be revealed. If the goalkeeper guesses the direction, they will put gloves to cover the circles inside the goal. Those circles has numbers and the shooter needs to choose one empty circle and roll the die to match with one of the number of that circle. If that happens it will be a goal, otherwise the shot will be blocked.

First team obtaining 5 goals will be the winner of the game!

name: A game about drawing creatures, complimenting the drawings, then complimenting the compliments.
description:
50+ cards that tell you attributes you need to draw ('creature features') and offer compliment guidance on the other side.

Draw 1 communal 'creature feature' and give 3 cards to each player. Everyone draws a creature with four 'creature features', ending with some weird creatures.

Secondly, everyone has to compliment everyone else's creatures.

Finally, each artist has to compliment one of the compliments that were given to them.

—description from the designer

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark 2021 Card Update Pack
description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of cards for Stark players.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Irukandji
description:
Irukandji is the first game in the SNACKBOX Mini Game Series.

You have swum a long way out, and it is now time to head home. Race back to the beach without coming across one of the most venomous jellyfish in the world: the Irukandji.

Irukandji is a game of tile laying and tile playing. Swim well, use the conditions, and watch out for the Irukandji.

Be the first player to get to +2 (points) on the scorecard, by scoring each swim to The Beach.

Take turns moving from tile to tile, dealing with the ocean conditions as you go while trying to avoid the hidden dangers. Aim to get back to The Beach first, and collect the Beach Ball token, if you can.

—description form the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Race, Score-and-Reset Game, Tile Placement

name: World Stitchers
description:
Animal spirits are building a new world by plucking floating pieces of land from the sky and stitching them together with mystical thread. These powerful spirits are the World Stitchers, and even though they are working together to create a new world, only one of them will have the honor of naming it.

Play as one of the animal spirits in this modular, competitive tile-laying game for 1-4 players. Expand the world, gather the energy that's released when new pieces of land are connected, and raise massive natural spires from the ground to impress the other spirits.

World Stitchers is very easy to teach and quick to set up. The game comes with several interchangeable modules to add complexity and variety as you see fit.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Family Dinner
description:
It's dinner time and you're spending it with family! Some of which you haven't seen in a long time. As we all know, big family dinners always bring chaos. Even the happiest of families get wacky during big gatherings.

In The Family Dinner you’ll be playing as a dysfunctional family, having dinner together for the first time in a while. Each player acts as a member of the family. Play takes place over a number of courses with Ingredient Cards being used to drive the conversation and to shape what food is served. As you play you will be drawing a family tree that includes all players and extended family. The family is all here, let's start eating!

—description from the publisher

name: Dream a Tree
description:
Help the squirrels to build the tree of their dreams by using all branches. A game where helping is the key to win!

The goal is to use the most tiles possible to build the biggest most beautiful tree. Start the game by placing the two "owl" tiles on the playing surface, making sure you leave enough room to grow your tree in all directions. New tiles must match all adjacent sides with the existing tiles. The game is over when you can no longer add a tile because there is no legal placement or there are no more tiles. The prize is admiring your creation.

name: Hour of Need: Jade Kid
description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive expansion was given to backers as a free gift for pledging for the campaign.

The box contains 2 miniatures representing her as a hero or a bystander. It also includes a hero deck, a card divider, and a bystander card.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Scotland Yard: 40 Jahre Jubiläumsedition
description:
In Scotland Yard, one of the players takes on the role of Mr. X. Their job is to move from point to point around the map of London taking taxis, buses or subways. The detectives – that is, the remaining players acting in concert – move around similarly in an effort to move into the same space as Mr. X. But while the criminal's mode of transportation is nearly always known, their exact location is known only intermittently throughout the game.

Scotland Yard: 40 Jahre Jubiläumsedition features a cult retro design and includes an adventure book in which the reader decides how the story continues. Can the young detectives catch Mister X?
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Dragons & Ladders
description:
Immerse yourself in the medieval fantasy world of Dragons and Ladders! A reinvented version of the classic Snakes and Ladders game in which you play as heroes as they storm a castle and the fabulous treasure it contains. But beware! This castle is well guarded by monsters of all kinds! You will have to fight and use your powers strategically in order to reach the Treasure Room and defeat the three-headed dragon.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Race, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Rada Pięciu
description:
A two-player card game based on BCU (Baniak Cthulhu Universe) - well-known in Poland streamed RPG sessions.
In this game your goal is to arrange played cards on the board in such a way as to lure the opponent to your side of madness.

At the beginning, each player must build their investigator deck up to a maximum of 20 cards with a mix of enemies, vehicles, items, artefacts, gods. Remember that they should be connected with each other by at least one of the three keywords.
Investigators and enemies have high attributes; while vehicles move other cards; items, spells and artefacts are weaker but can perform special actions; and outer gods bring huge changes in the world (board), but require an opened gate.
Cards (in a well-assembled deck) will resonate with each other causing mayhem on the board and creating un-obvious traps.

Players alternately play one card at a time, trying to turn the opponent's cards to their side (light or dark). We do this with the attributes on the sides of the cards and their special abilities.
You cannot hide cards in your hands, you must play either from the top of the pile or from the two available slots in the stash. So the cards are open to both players and we can try to anticipate his movements. But so is he! Whoever gets more followers at the end wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Square Grid, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dinosaur Train
description:
Dinosaur Train Card Game is the sequel to the Whale Train Card Game similar to Mah Jong or Rummy
The goal of the game is to make a set of all 9 cards in your hand. The rules are like Mahjong, you connect pictures on the cards to complete a dinosaur or train.

Two carnivorous dinosaurs and three herbivorous dinosaurs make one set. There is no set number of trains, steam locomotives, and bullet trains. Vehicles can be chained together to make them longer and longer.

If you arrange them in the same colour or make a long train, you can play a role.

Do you aim for a big role and wait patiently, or do you aim to get up early?

name: TONKS
description: TONKS is a fast and fun game of miniature mechanised mayhem, where each player controls an individual tank battling it out in a free for all. The game features fun upgrades and lots of opportunities for customisations, kit-bashing and wild colour schemes. For very brave hobbyists, there is the ‘TONKS OF LEGACY’ campaign, where tank commanders can risk it all seeking fortune and glory.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Die Nadel im Heuhaufen
description: Oh dear! There’s a hole in Harry Hamster’s sack and all the food is spilling out into the hay where the other animals are just waiting to grab their favourite treats. Let the cards fly and search for the animals and their favourite food in the haystack. The animals earn you points and if you find the needle, the hamster can sew up the hole in his sack.

name: DADOS PATO MAR
description:
Play your Ducks' skills, trick and trick your friends while earning your Blue Ices in this fun game of dice, hidden roles and pompadour!
During the game, each player will pour a glass of alcohol and place it on their DUCK card, using it as a coaster.
It is played in successive turns:
Players will be able to use the ability of a duck or roll and assign a die to a player. When a player collects three identical dice, he or she will perform the dice type action between adding a blue ice, taking a drink, or taking two drinks.

Golden rules: if for any reason you raise your glass you must take a drink, and you win a red ice.
In this game you can lie and declare that you have another duck and use his ability normally, other players may doubt your declaration. If you lied take a red ice, if you told the truth whoever doubted takes a red ice and you play the skill normally.

If you receive three red ices you are out of the game, you must drink your entire drink at once.

The game ends when someone manages to collect three blue ice, it is the winner or there is only one player left at the table, it is the winner.

Spanish---
¡Juega las habilidades de tus Patos, engaña y haz tomar a tus amigos mientras ganas tus Hielos Azules en este divertido juego de dados, roles ocultos y copete!

Durante el juego cada jugador se servira una copa de su bebida favorita y la ubicara sobre su carta de PATO, usandola como posavasos.
Jugaran turnos sucesivos:
los jugadores podran usar la habilidad de una pato o lanzar y asignar un dado a un jugador. Cuando un jugador junte tres dados iguales realizara la acción del tipo de dado entre: ganar un hielo azul, beber un trago o beber dos tragos.

Reglas de oro: si por cualquier razon levantas tu vaso debes tomar un trago, y ganas un hielo rojo.
En este juego puedes mentir y declarar que tienes otro pato y usar su habilidad con normalidad, otros jugadores pueden dudar sobre tu declaración. Si mentiste toma un hielo rojo, si decias la verdad quien dudo toma un hielo rojo y tu juegas la habilidad con normalidad.

Si recibes tres hielos rojos estas fuera del juego, debes tomar de una vez toda tu bebida.

El juego se acaba cuando alguien logre juntar tres hielos azules o quede solo un jugador en mesa es el ganador.

name: BattleGoats: Reinforced
description:
BattleGoats is a modern combination of Memory & War where players alternate turns in card battle to determine a winner using the highest number value. Every card in the game has a unique ability or modifier causing number values to change as the game goes on. The person with the last card in play wins. Rules are easy to pick up and games play in as little as 5-30 minutes.

BattleGoats: Reinforced is a full reprint + expansion which replaces the original base game entirely. It is a standalone game, not just an expansion to the original.

Reinforced adds 1 new Hero, 21 Goats, 2 Equipment, and 2 Creatures to the mix! All copies of BattleGoats going forward will be Reinforced, meaning they will contain all 81 unique cards ready to battle out of the box. (Reinforced includes all of the original 55 cards, plus the 7 added via Kickstarter Stretch Goals.)

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Math, Memory, Number
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Red Sand, Blue Sky: Death in the Arenas of Rome
description:
from the Designer: "These were the words that signaled the beginning of the violent spectacle known as the “games’. Held in arenas all over the Roman Empire, these bloody combats offered the gladiators fame, fortune, and the chance for freedom. But while these benefits were attained by a fortunate few nothing short of a quick death awaited most.

And now with Red Sand, Blue Sky, you can recreate the excitement of these combats that for thousands of participants was anything but a game.

Whether you seek fame as a solitary gladiator or operate a gladiator school with many fighters the choice is yours. With RSBS you can play either solo or with others and with any figures you may already have. RSBS provides big fun for a small price. Hmmm, big fun..small price? What a concept!"

Roman gladiatorial combat with miniatures that can be played solo or with lots of players.

Re-implemented by:

Red Sand, Blue Sky: Heroes of the Arena

name: Millennium Chess
description:
Millennium Chess is played on an 8 by 15 size chess-board, and each player controls nearly twice as many pieces (two queens, two kings, four bishops, etc.). Most of the rules of the game are the same, with some special rules regarding capturing and check-mating the kings. A player's first king can be left in danger of capture and actually captured - once the first king is captured, the remaining king can then be put in check and check-mate as in normal chess.

From the brochure and web-site:

"Millennium Chess was developed to improve the skills of the average to excellent chess player. This is accomplished by maintaining the basic dynamics and structure of the of the game, while increasing the number of strategic moves.

By expanding the size of the battlefield and increasing the number of pieces, a chess player's mind is forced to accept a greater strategic load. This subconsciously builds one's 'chess muscles'."

name: Lepanto 1571: A Sea Turned Red by Blood
description:
October 7th, 1571
The calm Aegean sea is going to be, once again, the scene of one of the most important battles in history. The fleets of the Ottoman Empire and the Holy League, created by Pope Pius V, are ready to clash in the waters in front of the little town of Lepanto. At the end of the day, after one of the fiercest battles in the long history of naval combat, the Ottoman fleet breaks away following the loss of more than 150 ships and 30.000 men.
Now the sea is red, a sea turned red by blood.
400+ counters, 6 player aid cards, 3 maps, a rules book and a playerbook with examples of play.
—description from the publisher
categories: Nautical, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Lucent
description:
Enter the world of Lucent as a Geomancer, vying for a shard of divine power. Build a vibrant pyramid together by placing gems to channel your energy, wrestling over control, and cutting off the routes of your foes. Be the last to place a gem to claim the power and dominate your enemies.

Lucent was designed with the aesthetic in mind. As gem cards are played out, they create a rich tapestry. There are four themes available:

Classic - Featuring elemental gems on a light background, Night - featuring elemental gems on a dark background, Cosmic - featuring celestial bodies among the stars and Bestiary - featuring mythical beasts on stylized parchment.

The game is quick and easy to learn. Divide the deck evenly among all players, then build a pyramid by placing cards that match one of the two cards beneath them. Slowly options get cut off and players become unable to make plays.

—description from the designer

name: Heropath: Dragon Roar – With Allies
description:
"Now I shall haunt you, until you know the wrath of the flames, for this is my vengeance."

If the Giant was told one year ago where his life would take him, he would not have believed it… and no one would have even heard of the goblin-slaying Giant. The Giant was a peaceful farmer who was content with his life, he bothered no one, and no one bothered him. That all changed after that one cursed winter… when the goblin raid started from the Caves of Doom – it was that same night when the goblin's fury torched 1,000 straw huts, and the air was filled with fear. It was from that same fire and pain that a hero and a legend was formed, the Giant who stood against evil and returned the favor twice over.

Expansion 1: The Giant
1. In this expansion we added one more hero and one more hero board which allows a total of 5 participants – which of course intensifies the game experience and allows more people to participate.
2. In order to improve the game experience we added a team of sub-heroes called "Allies". Each hero can convince (by increasing his faith) an ally to join him to his journey.

The main advantage of this expansion is the variety it gives to the game.



Such as: new cards, new tactics, extra accessories and even extra enemies.
Also there are special "Allies" dice that improve significantly the hero performance.
Beyond that – the hero does not fight alone anymore; he has a team of fighters who add interest to the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Anno Domini: Reisen und Verkehr
description:
Each Anno Domini game consists of 340 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other. Anno Domini: Reisen und Verkehr contains historical events related to voyages of famous people, transport, traffic motorization, etc. Like all Anno Domini sets, this game can be played as a standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

In Anno Domini: Reisen und Verkehr, each player receives nine cards (or fewer, if you want the game to be shorter) and may look only at the descriptions. In turn, players place a card on the table, trying to place their card in chronological order to those already present. Instead of adding a card, a player may claim that the order in which the cards have been placed is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.

If the order is correct, then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order is incorrect, then the previous player – who accepted the order as correct or made it incorrect through her own placement – receives three cards. The first player with no cards remaining in hand wins.

name: Sheriff of Nottingham: Master Smuggler
description:
Master Smuggle is a single card worth 10 gold. It reads: 'Set this card aside before the game. At the end of game, give this card to the merchant who delivered the second most contraband.

The promo appeared in 2017 and was later made part of the 2018 promo pack.

—user summary
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Neither Fear Nor Hope!
description:
A 14-scenario expansion pack playable in the Advanced Squad Leader rules system, dealing with the history of the 2nd SS-Division, known as "Das Reich", from Battalion to Panzerdivision.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Anarchy in the Monarchy
description: This is a climbing card game that uses between four and eight suits, depending on the number of players, and is themed around the French Revolution. The player who gets rid of his hand of cards first receives 5 points, the second 3 points, and so on. Players switch positions at the table after each round based on their performance in the prior round. The first player to 30 points wins. Several special cards that can affect the game play are included.

name: Buried Beneath
description:
Buried Beneath is a Solo, Worker Placement, Hero Defense game that fits in a mint-tin container.

Once a renowned and respected adventurer, you’ve long since retired to a peaceful town, tucked way up in the mountains. You spend most days relaxing out in the sun or at the tavern, regaling local villagers with your heroic triumphs of the past. Today though, is not shaping up to be like most days...

Unknown to you, a primordial horror had been slumbering beneath this very town, but something has stirred it from its eternal resting. And to make matters worse, the energy emitted by the awakening has drawn the attention of the local monster population, who now amass outside the village.

You will be placing villager meeples at varying village locations to either gain stat points or perform actions like moving, attacking, using skills or rallying the Villagers to perform additional duties. A villager's location should be picked carefully, because invading monsters will be advancing towards the village center, causing villagers in their way to flee in terror!

After defending the village for 4 waves, the ancient horror buried beneath you emerges from underground, ready for a fight!

To win, defeat the final Boss after defending the village from 4 waves of monsters!
You lose if your Hero is defeated, all of your villagers have fled or you let at least 4 monsters reach the village center.
mechanics: Modular Board, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: D.E.I.: Divide et Impera – Mad & Max
description:
The Mercenary duo called Mad and Max really do honour to their names!
Both are bold, daring and completely crazy ones, on their Snowbug (a heavy customized snow buggy) they run through Old London’s icy roads, offering their abilites to those Leaders, foolish enough to hire them!
No difference if they’ll be on scouting or demolition missions, nothing scares this duo: for booze and some food, they’ll do everything!
Mad & Max is a Mercenary unit, that can be integrated in any game of Divide et Impera.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Ukrainian Crisis & The Little War
description:
Prolific designer Brian Train (The Scheldt Campaign) has created a number of games on unusual, under-gamed topics, often utilizing unique and innovative mechanisms. Hollandspiele is proud to be bringing two of Mr. Train's most interesting designs to your table in a single box.

Ukrainian Crisis simulates the Russian intervention in the Ukraine beginning in 2014. Diplomacy, propaganda, and international prestige play just as big a part in the proceedings as military force, if not more-so: it's entirely possible for the situation never to result in armed conflict at all. Each of these various elements feeds into and off of the others, resulting in a complex and decision-rich strategic situation. Event cards provide opportunities to turn things to your advantage, or to collapse in folly. The game is driven by the allotment of Resource Points chits. These chits are divided into three categories that each provide a random range of Resource Points: Minimum (1-4), Medium (2-5), and Maximum (2-12, trending toward 7). Each player has a finite number of each type of chit. This not only means that the commitment of chits among different activities within a given turn is important, but that as the game progresses, the choices you made on previous turns limits the range of options available for the end-game. While the decisions are rich and nuanced, the game system is relatively straightforward, making it a great introduction into "pol-mil" gaming.

The Little War is a smaller game about a smaller conflict: the week-long 1939 border war between Hungary and Slovakia. This is more of a straight-forward military engagement, but that doesn't mean it's any less interesting, clever, or innovative. The Little War is driven by an ordinary deck of playing cards (which you'll have to provide yourself). On each turn, six cards are drawn from the deck. One player gets the Hearts (movement) and Diamonds (combat), the other the Spades (movement) and Clubs (combat). The luck of this draw might favor one player this turn, but this will result in it being more likely to favor his opponent on the next.

Together, these two games provide hours of entertainment for adventurous gamers.

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Two Towers Journeybook
description:
The journey continues! Fight out the battles and encounters of The Two Towers book and film on your own tabletop, painting the miniatures and building all the terrain you need as you go. this book is a supplement for Games Workshop's The Lord of The Rings Strategy Battle Game - you will need a copy of the rules in order to play.
(publisher website)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Nubia: Egypt's Black Heirs
description:
Nubia is a solitaire game where you rule a Black African civilization of three Christian kingdoms in the Nile Valley: Nobadia, Makuria, and Alodia. Your culture is an heir to the glories of Ancient Egypt and the legendary Kingdom of Kush, but long gone are the days when you were conquering and ruling Egypt. In the game, it is A.D. 1172 and Nubia is under siege! For 400 years, you will battle to defend civilization against the fierce pagans of the Funj, and a jihad of marauding land-hungry Arabs. Deploy your famous archers, build fortified monasteries, send the Crown Prince into battle, and marry off your daughters in a desperate effort to stem the tide.

This fast-play, fun, and educational solitaire game uses a system created by Darin Leviloff. “Mek” markers on five converging paths represent hostile Arab and pagan armies that surround your kingdoms. The paths all meet in Soba, your fabulously wealthy capital at the juncture of the Blue and White Nile rivers, where the danger of a “Collapse” exists if any of those armies makes it that far. In addition, three tracks representing medieval Nubian society (Nobility, Kingship, and the Army) greatly impact the overall situation. A card draw determines which paths and tracks move against you this turn, while the cards teach you about the history of ancient and medieval Nubia. The number of “Efforts” which you can use to move them back in your favor (if the Effort die roll succeeds) depends on the personal talents of your current Uru (king) and his chief advisor, the Metropolitan Bishop of the Coptic Orthodox Church.

Managing Efforts is key to the game, and you never have as many as you want. You can obtain more by selling off land and using your bishops for political gain instead of their natural religious calling: a short term strategy that can cost you victory points in the end. Each risky gambit is aimed at averting a system-wide social collapse, which can end the game suddenly. Your success (or failure) in holding off the five hostile armies helps determine how many noble families are still on your side when a Collapse approaches, so the better you play the game, the less chance the Collapse gets off the ground.

As the game draws to a close, the Portuguese are searching Africa for the fabled Christian “Kingdom of Prester John.” Those legends may refer to you! Can you hold medieval Nubia together long enough to make contact with them and win the game?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Mythos Tales: Auf Ewig
description:
December 23, 1928
A fire was set at the Arkham University Library and a Book with delicate content stolen.

This additional Case for Mythos Tales was created by the German Publisher Pegasus Spiele to demonstrate the System at the Spiel18 in Essen, without to spoil the actual content of the Base game. It was later available for a limited time from December 7 to 9, 2018 as a free print and play version.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: The SS Abyss: Hungary 1945
description: Covers the last SS attempts to break through the Russian defenses surrounding trapped German forces at Budapest.
publishers: Blue Guidon Games, Perry Moore Games

name: Kontor: Die Ereigniskarten
description:
An expansion to the base game Kontor, published by Michael Schacht under his own label in a limited edition of 600. It provides 10 more action cards and can be downloaded from his website.

Expands

Kontor

name: BattleTech: Map Set 4
description:
User Comment:

One of 6 map sets released by FASA to expand the available terrain for BattleTech, BattleForce and CityTech, and one of three map sets to be released in the FASA 1991 product line.

This paper map set contained the maps "Heavy Forest #1", "Heavy Forest #2", "City Street Grid/Park #1", "City Street Grid/Park #2", "Large Lakes #1", "Large Lakes #2", "River Delta/Drainage Basin #1" and "River Delta/Drainage Basin #2". This Map Set was bundled up with Map Set 2 and Map Set 3 and the three sets re-issued as one item by FanPro, as the Classic Battletech Map Compilation 1.

In Germany, this set was released by FanPro under the name "GeoTech III."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Argent: The Consortium – Supporter Cards
description:
This expansion includes six cards that bring some of the new specialists from Empyreal: Spells & Steam into Argent: the Consortium. (And a seventh non-playable card with brief description/instructions.)

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Takaro!
description:
The game is incredibly simple yet entertaining and fun for the whole whānau. Each card features a number of symbols. Each of these symbols will have a direct Māori translation, which players will need to memorize and learn. Players will flip over two cards competing to find the matching symbols; the first player to call out the correct translation wins the round.

Tākaro can be played by ages 4+ with each round lasting 10-15 minutes. It will rely on the recognition of 57 various symbols, and the correct pronunciation of their Māori names.

By the end of the game, players will be able to confidently recall a number of the symbols and their corresponding te Reo Māori translations helping to expand their vocabulary.

Each pack contains

57 - Playing Cards & 8 reference cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Berlin: Red Vengeance
description:
The Battle for the Reichstag, April 28th-May 1st 1945

Including a revised map with larger hexes, and all errata included, this version of Heat of Battle's Historical ASL module details 10 historical scenarios and full campaign rules for the Soviet assault on Berlin.

Also included is a small sheet of 56 counters, including Gestapo Leaders, dug in tanks (treated as pillboxes - including King Tigers!) and numerous others.

Oh, and Hitler.

The game requires the ASL rules, Beyond Valor, Yanks, Kampfgruppe Peiper II, and also references Red Barricades.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1
Yanks: ASL Module 3
Kampfgruppe Peiper II: ASL Historical Module 3
Red Barricades: ASL Historical Module 1


(all are required for expansion play)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Evolution: Climate – Extra Sensory Perception Promo Pack
description:
Promotional card offered by "Man vs Meeple Season One Kickstarter".

Extra Sensory Perception is a 7-card promo
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Prehistoric
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: King of Tokyo: Champion of the Gods Promo Card
description:
Promo Card for King of Tokyo that was inserted into Arena: For the Gods! game from IELLO.

Card cost "3"

KEEP

"You can spend hearts as if it were lightening to buy power cards."

Part of the King of Tokyo series.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: 7.SS-Gebirgs Division "Prinz Eugen"
description:
This is a set of nine scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader. The scenarios all include German units from the 7th SS Gebirgs Division "Prinz Eugen". This division consisted of mountain troops made up of ethnic Germans from Croatia, Serbia, Hungary and Romania. In six of the scenarios the Germans are pitted against the Yugoslavia national army or Yugoslav partisans. One scenario has elements of the "Prinz Eugen" division fighting the Italians, while the final two has Bulgarians as the opponents.

These scenarios tend to be a mix of medium and large numbers of troops. Here is a summary of each scenario as provided by Lone Canuck Publishing:


PE-1 Operation Weiss- Boards 39,40, and 5-turns; a FT & DC toting Prinz Eugen SS-Engineer Platoon supported by 2 x 37L AT-Guns and a pair H38 French Tanks rush across a bridge to seize a Partisan Outpost. Meanwhile, a Prinz Eugen SS-Company having crossed the river downstream earlier hotfoots it to reinforce the Engineers just as a Yugoslav Company arrive.




PE-2 Operation Schwarz- Boards 3, 50, and 7½-turns; a Prinz Eugen SS-Battalion consisting of 18 squads packing a ½-dozen Axis Minor SWs, supported by a platoon of H38 French Tanks and 81mm Battalion Mortars OBA launches an assault to capture a village from a Yugoslav Company reinforced by HMG and a platoon of 76mm World War One artillery pieces.




PE-3 Shot Like Rabbits- Boards 9, HOB II, and 8½-turns; a full scale assault by a Prinz Eugen SS-Battalion consisting of 24 squads supported by HMGs, 81mm mortars, and 105mm OBA on an desolate Italian mountain stronghold made up of concrete bunkers, wire, and trenches. The Italian force consisting of 15 squads and numerous crews man, 2 x 81mm mortars and a pair of 150mm artillery pieces.




PE-4 Operation Kugelblitz- Boards 39, 52, and 6½-turns; a blizzard had struck dumping a heavy snowfall across central Yugoslavia, a Prinz Eugen SS-Company consisting of 10 squads and supported by a HMG, a 37mm AT-Gun, and an 81mm mortar has set up a blocking position along a forested ridge line. A Yugoslavian battalion- consisting of 30 squads and guided by Partisans, look to force a pass over the same ridge line.




PE-5 Operation Scheensturm- Boards 34, 36 and 8½-turns; a sequel to Operation Kugelblitiz, has a Prinz Eugen SS-Company consisting of 10½ squads supported by HMG and 81mm Mortars are spread thinly along a deep forested stream in central Yugoslavia. There they are assaulted by a Yugoslavian battalion consisting of 28 squads guided by Partisans looking to break out.




PE-6 Better to Sweat than Bleed- Boards 3, 40, and 7-turns; a Prinz Eugen SS-Heavy Weapons Platoon consisting of a HMG, a 37mm AT-Gun, a pair of Light mortars and a medium mortar struggles into position to provide fire support on the Partisans guarding the far bank as a Prinz Eugen SS-Company consisting of 9 squads and commanded by a 9-2 race forward to seize a bridge and the village before Yugoslavian reinforcements.




PE-7 Operation Draufgänger- Boards 14, HOB II, and 9-turns; a Prinz Eugen SS-Company consisting of a dozen squads and supported by a pair of HMG and 37mm AT-Guns fans out to capture and a Yugoslavian airfield defended by a pair of 37mm AA-Guns and the over watching mountain fortification manned by a dozen Partisan squads armed with medium machine guns and light mortars.




PE-8 Former Allies- Boards 23, 49, and 7-turns, the fortunes of war have change and the Bulgarians, now former allies are advancing into Yugoslavia. A depleted Prinz Eugen SS-Company consisting of 7½ squads reinforced by platoon of engineers and supported by platoon StuG IIIs, have been give the task of getting rid of an unwanted bridgehead. All that stands in their way is a Bulgarian battalion consisting of 15 squads armed with German SWs and supported by a pair of 50mm AT-Guns.




PE-9 No Sight for Sore Eyes- Boards 4, 17, and 5½-turns; the sequel to Former Allies, as the Bulgarians in battalion strength (15 squads) armed with German SWs and supported a platoon of Panzer IVs, now launches out of the bridgehead and streams southwards en masse. A Prinz Eugen SS-Company consisting of 7 squads quickly sets up a delaying position to slow the on rushing Bulgarians. During the night they receive much need support from a pair Luftwaffe 88mm AA-Guns formerly of the oilfields at Ploesti.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Shadowrun: Crossfire – Harlequin's Shadow Promo Card
description: Harlequin's Shadow is a promo Crossfire Deck card given out during GenCon 2014. It is used in Close The Portal scenario available for download from Catalyst Game Labs website.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – "Miau Pakhet" Promo Card
description:
Ally
Check to acquire: Charisma / Diplomacy 13
Traits: Catfolk, Bard, Gambling
Powers: After a character at your location rolls the dice on his check, recharge this card to allow him to reroll any die, or discard this card to allow him to reroll all the dice; he takes the new result.

Discard this card to examine the top card of your location deck, then put it on the top or bottom of the deck. Then you may explore your location.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Flamme Rouge: Etape de la Vallée
description: A promotional track card for Flamme Rouge. The card depicts the setup for a new track that can be played in Flamme Rouge.

name: Moku Tower
description:
Moku Tower’s gaming concept originates from our previous product – Woodas. The theme of Moku Tower is to integrate wood art into tabletop game. It is an unconventional idea that transforms wood art into an artistic, interactive and strategic tabletop game that can be played with a group of friends and/or family members. Moku Tower combines the concept of "timing", "stacking" and "strategy" into one single game. It allows you to casually mess round, laugh and interact closely with your cool friends.

Moku Tower is not only a great party game, it is also an amazing home decoration that can impress your friends. When you are not playing, you can simply display Moku Tower as an art piece. Each game contains 10 different pieces of wooden rocks (includes both big and small) and are made of 8 different types of natural wood material (ash, pine, sapele, maple, walnut, birch, camphor and rosewood). Each of them has different grain, color, weight, texture and even aroma. Also, each piece of wood is exquisitely handcrafted by our wood master. Hence, each of them has its own unique cutting and angle, making Moku Tower one of your most exquisite and unique home decoration.

In respect of the gameplay, in order to win in Moku Tower, you need to be good at timing, stacking and strategy. Within the time limit from the hourglass, players need to stack the wooden rocks to gain points based on the requirements that they draw from the cards. Throughout the stacking process, your opponents can attack you using their "Function cards". Make good use of the Function cards! It can be the turning point for the whole story. The player who first reaches the accumulative target point wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Stacking and Balancing, Take That

name: Tajemnicze Domostwo: Plansza Ducha
description: A board with hints going from the ghost to others players. The expansion makes game easier than regular.

name: Police Precinct: Rocket Launcher Promo Card
description: The Rocket Launcher Card acts in the same way as the Original 6 Mad Men Cards. It released much later and separately from the Mad Men Cards. It is a great way for fans of the Mad Men Deck to add another card into the mix.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Road Trippin
description:
This is a Vanity License Plate Word Game for Competitive People. Create and Solve Custom Vanity Plates in a Race Across Country

Players will draw a card containing a phrase and have to convert that phrase into a license plate. Then, depending on the game mode (Team Vs, Cooperative, or FFA) other players will guess what the phrase says. A point is scored for guessing a plate correctly as well as additional points for using numbers and having unused blank spaces at the end of the plate. Points are scored on a race track with cars representing the players/teams. First car to complete their road trip wins!

name: Quest for the Dragon
description:
This Sorcerer's Cave type adventure boardgame sees each player starting from a different corner of the board. Tiles are placed on the board as it is explored; initially each player is looking for the rooms containing their equipment (Key, allowing teleportation between various points, Weapon and Armour). On the way they encounter Monsters to defeat. Once they have found their equipment players make their way to the center of the board to challenge the Dragon; defeating him wins the game. Players can have combat with each other if they land on the same space and can barter items with each other.

Success is dependent on your rooms turning up somewhere near you early on in the game. There is a limited amount of decision making re the routes and which is the best way to put tiles.

The components are quite attractive and sturdy.

The game comes with a Story Booklet and a leaflet explaining how the Invalay board system will be used in subsequent games; unfortunately this game, the company and the system all appear to have sunk without trace!

name: 5 Card Nancy
description:
5 Card Nancy has never been published, so all existing sets have been constructed by hand.
The game is essentially an exercise in collaborative storytelling, played with a deck of cards. Each card in the deck features a single, unique panel taken from Ernie Bushmiller's classic newspaper comic-strip "Nancy." The strip is still in syndication today (and currently drawn by Olivia Jaimes), but McCloud insists that only panels from Bushmiller's peak years on the strip -- 1946 and later -- are suitable for use in a 5 Card Nancy deck.
Game play is very simple: an initial card is selected randomly from the draw pile and placed face up on the table. This card will serve as the first panel in the collaborative comic strip that will emerge as a result of gameplay. On her turn, a player will then select a single card from her hand, and place that card face up and to the right of the emerging comic strip. A judge or judges (usually the other players) then vote on the appropriateness of that particular panel to the unfolding narrative. If majority opinion favors the proposed panel, it becomes a part of the strip, otherwise it returns to the hand of the player who proposed it.

5 Card Nancy is a card game invented by cartoonist Scott McCloud, author of "Understanding Comics" and "Reinventing Comics," and creator of the "Zot!" series of comic books (among others). McCloud describes the game as a "Dada" game, by which he means a game in the spirit of the Dada movement.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Storytelling, Voting

name: De Bellis Napoleonicis
description: A simple fast play rules set for the Napoleonic era based upon the very popular De Bellis Antiquitatis (DBA). In its most basic format, about a dozen units on each side contest across a 2 foot by 2 foot. While bells & whistles are held to a minimum enough Napoleonic chrome exists to give this game a interesting flavor of the time --- Vistula Lancers, British rifles, Spanish guerrillas are differentiated as is the very slow Austrian army. Includes very usable army lists. KISR is following this up with sets for the American Civil War (DBACW) & WWII (Rommel's Battles). Similar to DBA in requiring only low costs in number of figures and space required, and rules that are quickly assimilated.

name: Il Gioco dello Scudetto
description: This game simulates an Italian soccer tournament. The players play each other moving their soccer team markers on the board spaces using a spinner. The spaces of the board represent events occurring in a typical soccer game that give the chance to score a goal: goal kicks, corner kicks, penalties, and so on. The game box includes cards and markers of the 30 best Italian soccer teams of the '70s, goal markers and a goalkeeper figure to be used on penalty kicks.

name: Battleground Fantasy Warfare: Scenario Booklet
description:
This book contains eight exciting Battleground: Fantasy Warfare scenarios that bring the world of Battleground to life while challenging your skills as a general. Play with the army lists given for each scenario or build your own.

One of the eight scenarios, First Contact, contains all the cards needed for play; for other scenarios you will need your own Battleground armies, as well as dice and a dry-erase marker.
categories: Book, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Schiebung
description:
The game board is triangular. The players have round wooden disks and try to place them on the game board. In the beginning, this can be done in any position where a disk doesn't touch any other disk. When the board becomes too full, the disks must be placed on the edge of the board, then pushed in with a wooden bar. In this way, all other disks that are hanging over the edge of that particular edge of the board, are pushed back in as well. Disks that fall over an edge are returned to the player of the respective color. Neutral disks are handed to any player (black disks) or to the player whose turn it is (red disks). The first player to place all his/her disks on the board wins the game.

A small number of copies of Schiebung were published as a "Test-Edition" by Edition Perlhuhn in 2009.

name: Paraguay
description:
In 1864, South America was in critical condition, in the midst of a constitutional crisis in Uruguay, Brazil invaded Uruguay in support of Venancio Flores, in response, Paraguay invaded Brazil... It was the onset of major armed conflict in the history of the continent! From 1864 to 1870 nearly half a million people lost their lives in a conflict that placed war: Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay and Paraguay.

"Paraguay" is a board game for 2-4 players created by Julio Trois, whose theme is the War of Paraguay. For 10 rounds, the armies of Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay must defend their cities and destroy all the defenses of Paraguay. Aiming to conquest Asunción!

"Paraguay" is a tactical game, where military strategy is very important. Each player must organize his troops, composed of tiles of infantry, cavalry and artillery. The movement is point to point, and the clashes follow the style of the best wargames, using dices and tables, for the resolution of battles.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Fantastiqa: Audacious Artifacts Expansion
description:
A mini-expansion of 18 (or 12 ... see NOTE further below) artifacts for Fantastiqa.

These artifacts can be used to expand your Fantastiqa game.

How they work: At the beginning of the game, shuffle all Audacious Artifact cards into the Artifacts deck. As always, include all and only those artifact cards you enjoy playing with - that includes including or removing cards from the base set as well. You might want to change the cards you include each game.

The artifacts included in this mini-expansion include:


2 x Cassens’ Uncanny Clasp of Unfastening (Cost: 4 Gems): Choose one card from your hand or discard pile and tuck it part-way beneath your current Region. A player who ends his turn in this Region must add this card to his discard pile.
2 x The Complete Troll-Gurgles of Beng Erber (Cost: 3 Gems): Discard as many cards from your hand as you wish, and then draw that many more again.
2 x Dozer’s Deranged Digging Stick (Cost: 4 Gems): Draw five cards from your draw deck and keep two. Discard the others.
2 x Paco’s Paranormal Pencilbox (Cost: 4 Gems): Draw one Beast card and add it to your hand.
2 x The Summerer’s Guide to Winter Wonderland (Cost: 3 Gems): If you are in the Frozen Wastelands, draw one Artifact or one Beast card and add it to your hand.
2 x Tox’s Ill-Tempered Tortoise of Directed Rigor Mortis (Cost: 4 Gems): Choose one card in your hand or discard pile and remove it from play.
2 x Vasel’s Disconcerting Dice of Mischievous Melody (Cost: 4 Gems): Add an additional +1 Point Bonus Token to any Open Quest. (Limit: 3 Tokens total on any Open Quest.)
2 x Ender’s Tollbooth of Never-Ending Adventure (Cost: 4 Gems): Travel to the Region most distant from your current location. (If more than one Region ties, choose either one.)
2 x The Ever-Clucking Chicken Cup of Rahdo’s Bravado (Cost: 4 Gems): Subdue any adjacent single-symbol Creature card and then travel to the Region just beyond it.


NOTE:
If you purchased this pack from the BoardGameGeek store prior to January 2016, you only received the following 12 cards:

2 x Cassens’ Uncanny Clasp of Unfastening
2 x The Complete Troll-Gurgles of Beng Erber
2 x Dozer’s Deranged Digging Stick
2 x Paco’s Paranormal Pencilbox
2 x The Summerer’s Guide to Winter Wonderland
2 x Tox’s Ill-Tempered Tortoise of Directed Rigor Mortis
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Goblin Fighter Troop Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Goblin Fighter Troop Expansion Pack includes six pre-painted miniatures, upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: In the Trenches: Coup de Grace
description:
Coup de Grace brings the French and British to the In the Trenches (ITT) system. Included are two battles from Verdun featuring the French, and an additional battle from the Britian's fight on the Somme. Gamers will fight with infantry platoons, British tanks, German flamethowers and much more. A "must have" addition to any gamer's ITT collection.

Designed by John Gorkowski, In the Trenches enables players to game historically accurate simulations of tactical operations from the Great War. ITT challenges players to move and fight with company-level formations made of separate platoon-sized units during five minute, impulsed-based turns. The historically accurate maps are scaled to 100 yards per hex. This approach recreates WWI command and control problems and inspire historically accurate play without forcing decisions.

Coup de Grace is an expansion. You must own either In the Trenches: Devil Dogs or In the Trenches: Doughboys to play In the Trenches: Coup de Grace.

Game includes:

88 die-cut counters to manouevre
One large 11" x 17" map
1 Player Aid Card and Scenario Card
1 Game Turn Track
3 scenarios


(source: Tiny Battle Publishing website)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Salvation Road Bonus Pack
description: Includes extremely difficult Apocalypse cards and new Road cards. Also 2 new locations for use with Salvation Road.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Assassin's Club
description:
The competition for a Hitman's contract represents the difference between the failure of his business and his personal survival. You must earn Prestige Points to keep up and have the option of extra missions. You must show your weaponry skills and knowledge in order to beat the defenses.

To win the game you have to win as many missions as possible. Every mission has a value in Prestige points, the more points you get, more chance to beat your own record or to beat your opponent score and then win the game but be careful if you run out of credits (life points) you are dead and game will be over.

You can play alone (Solo Game) or against a friend (Multi Game). The game dynamics are similar, differing mostly in the use of SPECIAL cards (strategy) and auctions to get the missions. There is a mix of luck and strategy in this fast-paced easy to learn game. Advanced mode is very intense where Characters make the difference with their action bonuses. The game is set to last 4 rounds, but getting to the final one might not be easy. Each mission has a cost you have to pay, reducing the CREDITS on your Score card. But no need to worry, because once you accomplish the mission, you will get some of that cost back.

The game is based on four main types of cards: MISSIONS, WEAPONS, LOCATIONS and ESPECIAL cards. We also need DEFENCE to combined with MISSIONS giving us different possibilities, but not always the same options.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Categorickell
description:
A general knowledge tug-of-war!

2 teams race to name a thing in the category, starting with either letter on a newly-flipped card! The winner flips the card one ‘step’ closer to their side and covers the previous card, so the next visible card is closer to whoever was first. It’s like a tug-of-war: flip the card at your end and win again to get a point!

There are various styles of categories.

Simple categories (Animals, places, food...) result in games only a few minutes long (and suitable for playing with children in an educational environment).

Specialist categories (novels/films, brands, celebrities, games...) allow one player to show off their specialist knowledge against multiple opponents.

Meta categories (number of syllables, number of letters, rhymes...) require quick thinking and almost entirely eschew general knowledge entirely.

This was the winner of the 2017/2018 Wibbell++ design competition and is the 8th 'core game' for the Wibbell++ deck. Rules will be freely available online on 1st August 2019.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Book, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Number, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia, Video Game Theme, Word Game

name: Duels of Cartisora
description:
You enter the pits of Cartisora with confidence. Your opponent faces you at the far side of the sandy fighting field, weapons brandished, brow furrowed. Looks like a worthy opponent, but you don’t let your admiration show. You release your weapon and let out an intimidating battle cry.

Only one of you will leave the battle pit alive …

A shotgun card game based on infamous warriors of their time. Quick to set-up and easy to play — a perfect interlude and travel game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Saboteur: Treasure Trove
description:
Saboteur: Treasure Trove is a single card expansion for Saboteur distributed during the 2018 Saboteur Belgian Championship. This card can be played with the base game of Saboteur and Saboteur: The Duel.

The card is played from the hand of one of the players, just like any other action card.

The procedure is as follows (after the player played the card):


The player looks at the the top 5 cards of the discard-deck
Of these five cards he chooses one and adds this card to his hand.
The player's turn is over and can not take another card from the drawing deck.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: D-Day Sword Beach: On to Caen
description:
The D-Day folio series consists of four separate games, each portraying a portion of the Normandy campaign area. Turns represent two to three days each; the games cover the campaign from the initial landing to the breakout. Each game comes with one map covering a portion of the battlefield at 2.5 miles per hex. The playing pieces represent the regiments and special battalions taking part, plus the multitude of fire support available to them.

The series uses the Fire & Movement system rules, with exclusive rules for each folio. The folios can be combined to display the entire American or British Commonwealth sectors, or into a single giant game on the entire campaign.

The British landing on Sword Beach, combined with the airborne landings was designed to guard the eastern flank of the bridgehead and ensure the capture of the crucial road junction of Caen. The initial landing is made from both air and sea, but will run into the heart of the German Panzer reserve. Caen was the cork in the Allied bottle and the Germans made every effort to halt progress on this front. In the campaign game, the Allies can — as they did historically — use threats on Caen to keep German forces away from the rest of the front and ease the progress elsewhere.

Contents:
17"x22" terrain map
100 die-cut counters
one Eight page system rule booklet
one exclusive scenario rule
10x13 ziplock
5x3 ziplock

Players: 1-3
Ages: 14+
Hex Scale: 2.5 miles
Play Time: 1-2 hours
Complexity: Low-Med
Solitaire Ability: Medium

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Ironjawz
description:
The Ironjawz are the biggest and hardest orruks of all. Clad in pig-iron armour and swinging enormous, bone-breaking weapons, they wreak untold devastation across the realms.

Destroy, pillage and smash your way through the battlefields of Warcry with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set allows you to command a warband of brutal Ironjawz in your skirmish battles. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of fighter cards provide profiles for Brutes and 'Ardboys.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as several fighter cards. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: D-Day and Beyond
description:
D-Day and Beyond, June 6, 1944 through May 19, 1945

D-Day, the largest amphibious invasion in history, opened the final chapter of the war in Europe with the landings on four Normandy beaches. For almost a year, General Eisenhower balanced Allied resources and clashing subordinates as he slowly drove back Field Marshal Karl von Rundstedt’s forces, who struggled with Hitler to command his theater forces. In late January 1945 the Rhine was breached and the end of the Third Reich drew nearer.

D-Day and Beyond is a tense, two-player operational board game covering the European theater from the French Atlantic and Mediterranean coasts to the dense German forests, the Siegfried line, and the Rhine River. The Allied player faces the tough decision about where and when to land troops, what scarce air and naval resources to employ on offense or defense, and struggles to keep a coherent supply line to his forward troops. The German player has to throw the landing(s) off the beach, if able, and failing that, fight a retrograde war that requires balancing holding key terrain, slowing the Allied advance, and preserving units. Additional rules showcase the Resistance, rail movement, airborne operations, carpet bombing, the release of German reserves, and the infamous Wacht Am Rhein offensive known as Autumn Mist.

—description from the publisher

name: Unsolved Case Files: ​Veronica Falcone
description:
ROBIN FALLS, CT - On August 26th, 1947, celebrated American WWII spy, Veronica Falcone, went missing while investigating something mysterious in town. Three months later, her motorcycle was found at the bottom of a ravine with the brake line intentionally cut.

Her boyfriend and mechanic, Joey Caruso, was arrested for the murder but hanged himself in jail while awaiting trial.

Did he kill Veronica? What was she investigating?

Can you bring about justice for this famous war heroine?

In order to solve this cold case murder mystery game you’ll need to find 3 separate clues that crack open the case. First reopen the case by proving Veronica didn't die the way investigators claimed. Then find the victim's body and finally identify the killer and close this case for good. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked it. If you don’t have the answer right you can keep investigating without being spoiled by the right answers.

name: The Thing with the Ring (Second Edition)
description:
Robbits (the nickname for Urban Halflings) are a small mischievous folk with an uncanny habit of ‘finding’ ancient relics of vast and horrifying power. In this case, a troublesome Ring, belonging to an evil wizard called Nörmün. Nörmün has sent his Goblins to retrieve the Ring, even as the Wizard Gudgrief tries to form a Party of Dwarves, Elves and Robbits to take the Ring away on a Quest.

But the reluctant Robbits know that nobody ever comes back from Gudgrief’s Quests, so the Dwarves are forced to Press-Gang and the Elves to Enchant them out of their Pits to join the Party. However, Robbits are innately ‘Tricksy’ and will use Magic and Excuses to avoid going on the Quest. Only one Robbit will live to tell the epic tale of...
The Thing with the Ring!

In The Thing with the Ring, you take on the role of a Robbit and the object of the game is to avoid going on the Quest to get rid of the evil Ring. Dwarves, Elves and Goblins will turn up on your doorstep and you must manage them with Magic and Excuses or risk joining the Party and going on the Quest.

The Game is for one to six Players and it is comprised of one Rulebook, one hundred cards, and one die, known as the Battle Die.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Stellarium
description:
Stellarium is a board game for people of different ages to have fun together, while being enchanted by the discoveries of the constellations looking at the night sky formed by pieces with different star patterns.

To play, you have to assemble a 5x5 night sky with the sky pieces and separate the constellation cards by their degree of difficulty. Players will always have 2 constellation cards in hand and must try to identify one of them in the sky, on their turn, within 30 seconds. If he succeeds, he takes for himself the number of pieces indicated on the letter and puts the constellation identified in his personal record.

Whoever has the highest score has made the most valuable constellation record and won this astronomical race!

—description from the publisher

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Siege of Coruscant Battle Pack
description:
Players relive a pivotal battle in the Star Wars saga with this new Scenario Pack for Star Wars: X-Wing! Siege of Coruscant puts players on both sides of this monumental battle, with one player commanding the Republic forces desperately trying to rescue Supreme Chancellor Palpatine from the clutches of the Separatists and the other player attempting to stop them. With 23 ship cards featuring a standard loadout combining pilots and upgrades, this pack gives players everything they need to create their own custom squads and play out this thrilling scenario!

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Snowpeople
description:
Snowpeople is the first print-at-home game published by Twin City Games. You are digging through a field of snow as you uncover and collect objects to decorate your snowman. Throughout the game, you use dice to choose paths to dig through the snow to uncover objects, as well as collect snow for the different body parts of your snowfolk's body. Whoever has excavated the largest and diverse set of objects to decorate their snowperson by the end of the game will be declared Best in Snow!

1. Every round one player rolls two dice, and each player records these results on the game sheet. All players use these results to dig around objects on their own player sheet.

2. Players use one result to choose a polyomino to draw within the grid. Players use the second result to choose a dig type for the polyomino and mark spaces in the grid.

3. After a player completely surrounds an object they count the number of squares that object occupies and marks that number in the matching row of that objects type. Players are encouraged to collect sets of objects using each type.

4. That player then marks an X in each row that matches the dig types used to surround the object scored. If there was only one dig type used to surround the shape, then a player marks three X's in that row.

5. Throughout the game players will earn Snowflakes that can be used for bonuses, and Stars that will earn them additional points at the end of the game.

6. At the end of the game players count the number of points earned from their objects collected, stars earned, as well as any unused bonus snowflakes.

-description from designer

name: Pica Pica
description:
On your turn play one or two cards, if there are 4 cards of the same color or the same number on the table, you take them to your scoring area.

To savor victory, avoid the spicy ones or manage to collect as many of the same color as you can by using the special cards in your favor.

name: Woodcraft: BoardGameGeek Promo Cards
description:
A pair of promo cards for the board game Woodcraft:

1 early-game helper card (HP2/3)
1 late-game order card (OP2/3)

name: Grimcoven
description:
Grimcoven is a miniature boss battler game for 1-4 players set in a dark Victorian universe where only the hunt matters.

To play, you take on the role of a hunter fueled by lament who has signed a pact with a coven of other hunters to venture on one of many modular boss battles. Every character has a distinct development tree you can use to advance. Build and execute your unique combo, such as teleporting into any space on the map, gathering lament, gaining extra dice, and firing up a devastating attack on the boss. Sometimes a special electricity die will help you power up your armor, while at other times, you will forge magical bullets to be fired at the right moment.

Who and where are you fighting? Each game you choose from multiple arenas, bosses, elites, and possible adventures. Every game is different and exciting. Instead of following a scripted campaign, dive right into a boss battle for an intense 2-3 hour gameplay session. Every boss offers a unique gameplay challenge, and bringing them down will be tactically demanding. You must work together and take full advantage of the arena and its resources to achieve your goal.

During combat, strategically use dice allocation to move around the board, fire up different combos, and gather lament to grow in strength. Build your character in roguelike fashion and try to claim the ultimate prize. Collect too much lament, however, and you may turn into one of the beasts you were sent to hunt, with your fellow hunters unable to help you in time!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Variable Player Powers

name: Duo Regna
description:
Two kingdoms are vying for the conquest of mighty dragons. It's up to you to summon your kingdom members to capture them.

Bring the most dragons to your lands and claim the glory and honor of a victor.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dois reinos estão disputando pela conquista de poderosos dragões. Cabe a você convocar os membros do seu reino para capturá-los.

Traga o maior número de dragões para suas terras e receba a glória e a honra de um vencedor.

—description from the publisher

name: Star Trader's Luck
description:
This is a dice game where players attempt to maximize profit by traveling from planet to planet buying and selling different types of goods within a limited time.
